" [[My]281-the german friend]3507-my friend , "[281-the german] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , holding out [his]67-bonaparte hand , " [I]281-the german forgive [you]281-the german ; do not be disturbed . Whatever the consequences , [I]281-the german forgive [you]281-the german . [I]281-the german know , [I]281-the german believe , it was with no ill - intent that[281-the german]

[you]281-the german allowed [me]0-i to go out . Give [me]0-i [your]281-the german hand . [I]0-i have no ill - feeling . "[67-bonaparte]

" [You]67-bonaparte are very kind , "[67-bonaparte] said [the German]281-the german , taking the extended hand , and feeling suddenly convinced that [he]281-the german was receiving magnanimous forgiveness for some great injury , " [you]67-bonaparte are very kind . "[67-bonaparte] " Do n't mention it , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . [He]67-bonaparte knocked out the crown of [his]67-bonaparte caved - in old hat , placed it on the table before [him]67-bonaparte , leaned [his]67-bonaparte elbows on the table and [his]67-bonaparte face in [his]67-bonaparte hands , and contemplated it . " Ah , [[my]67-bonaparte old friend]3644-my old friend , "[67-bonaparte] [he]67-bonaparte thus apostrophized the hat , " [you]3644-my old friend have served [me]67-bonaparte long , [you]3644-my old friend have served [me]67-bonaparte faithfully , but the last day has come . Never more shall [you]3644-my old friend be borne upon the head of [[your]3644-my old friend master]3645-your master . Never more shall [you]3644-my old friend protect [his]3645-your master brow from the burning rays of summer or the cutting winds of winter . Henceforth bare - headed must [[your]3644-my old friend master]3645-your master go . Good - bye , good - bye , old hat ! "[67-bonaparte]

At the end of this affecting appeal [the German]281-the german rose . [He]67-bonaparte went to the box at the foot of [his]67-bonaparte bed ; out of it [he]67-bonaparte took a black hat , which had evidently been seldom worn and carefully preserved . " It 's not exactly what [you]3644-my old friend may have been accustomed to , "[67-bonaparte] [he]67-bonaparte said nervously , putting it down beside the battered chimney - pot , " but it might be of some use a protection to the head , [you]3644-my old friend know . "[281-the german] " [[My]281-the german friend]3507-my friend , "[281-the german] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , " [you]3644-my old friend are not following [my]67-bonaparte advice ; [you]3644-my old friend are allowing [yourself]3644-my old friend to be reproached on [my]67-bonaparte account . Do not make [yourself]3644-my old friend unhappy . No ; [I]67-bonaparte shall go bare - headed . "[67-bonaparte] " No , no , no ! "[281-the german] cried [the German]281-the german energetically . " [I]0-i have no use for the hat , none at all . It is shut up in the box . "[0-i]

" Then [I]0-i will take it , [[my]0-i friend]3507-my friend . It is a comfort to [one]324-one 's own mind when [you]3644-my old friend have unintentionally injured [any one]504-any one to make reparation . [I]0-i know the feeling . The hat may not[0-i]

be of that refined cut of which the old one was , but it will serve , yes , it will serve . Thank [you]281-the german , " said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , adjusting it on [his]67-bonaparte head , and then replacing it on the table . "[281-the german] [I]0-i shall lie down now and take a little repose , " [he]0-i added ; "[281-the german] [I]0-i much fear [my]0-i appetite for supper will be lost . "[281-the german]

" [I]67-bonaparte hope not , [I]67-bonaparte hope not , "[67-bonaparte] said [the German]281-the german , reseating [himself]281-the german at [his]281-the german work , and looking much concerned as [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte stretched [himself]67-bonaparte on the bed and turned the end of the patchwork quilt over [his]67-bonaparte feet . " [You]67-bonaparte must not think to make [your]67-bonaparte departure not for many days , "[67-bonaparte] said [the German]281-the german presently . " [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie gives [her]53-tant ' sannie consent , and "[281-the german]

" [[My]281-the german friend]3507-my friend , "[281-the german] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , closing [his]67-bonaparte eyes sadly , " [you]3507-my friend are kind ; but were it not that to - morrow is the Sabbath , weak and trembling as [I]67-bonaparte lie here , [I]67-bonaparte would proceed on [my]67-bonaparte way . [I]67-bonaparte must seek work ; idleness but for a day is[67-bonaparte]

painful . Work , labour that is the secret of all true happiness ! "[67-bonaparte]

[He]67-bonaparte doubled the pillow under [his]67-bonaparte head , and watched how [the German]281-the german drew the leather thongs in and out . After a while [Lyndall]59-lyndall silently put [her]59-lyndall book on the shelf and went [home]302-home , and [the German]281-the german stood up and began to mix some water and meal for roaster - cakes . As [he]281-the german stirred them with [his]281-the german hands [he]281-the german said , " [I]67-bonaparte make always a double supply on Saturday night ; the hands are then free as the thoughts for Sunday . "[67-bonaparte] " The blessed Sabbath , "[281-the german] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . There was a pause . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte twisted [his]67-bonaparte eyes without moving [his]67-bonaparte head , to see if supper were already on the fire . " [You]3652-you must sorely miss the administration of [the Lord]3492-the lord 's word in this desolate spot , "[281-the german] added [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . " Oh , how love [I]67-bonaparte Thine house , and the place where Thine honour dwelleth ! "[67-bonaparte]

" Well , [we]3654-we do ; yes , "[67-bonaparte] said [the German]281-the german ; " but [we]3654-we do [our]3654-we best . [We]3654-we meet together , and [I]606-i well , [I]606-i say a few words , and perhaps they are not wholly lost , not quite . "[606-i] " Strange coincidence , "[606-i] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte ; " [my]0-i plan always was the same . Was in [the Free State]3655-the free state once [solitary farm]3656-solitary farm [one neighbour]3657-one neighbour . Every Sunday [I]0-i called together [friend]3658-friend and [neighbour]3659-neighbour , [child]3660-child and [servant]3661-servant , and said , "[0-i] Rejoice with [me]0-i , that [we]604-we may serve [the Lord]3492-the lord , í and then [I]0-i addressed [them]606-i . Ah , those were blessed times , " said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte ; "[0-i] would [they]606-i might return . " [The German]281-the german stirred at the cakes , and stirred , and stirred , and stirred . [He]281-the german could give [the stranger]418-the stranger [his]281-the german bed , and [he]281-the german could give [the stranger]418-the stranger [his]281-the german hat , and [he]281-the german could give [the stranger]418-the stranger [his]281-the german brandy ; but [his]281-the german Sunday service ! After a good while [he]281-the german said ,[67-bonaparte]

" [I]67-bonaparte might speak to [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie ; [I]67-bonaparte might[67-bonaparte]

arrange ; [you]607-you might take the service in [[my]0-i place]608-my place , if it "[281-the german]

" [[My]281-the german friend]3507-my friend , "[281-the german] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , " it would give [me]281-the german the profoundest felicity , the most unbounded satisfaction ; but in these worn - out habiliments , in these deteriorated garments , it would not be possible , it would not be fitting that [I]281-the german should officiate in service of [One whom , for respect]3667-one whom , for respect , [we]3668-we shall not name . No , [[my]281-the german friend]3507-my friend , [I]281-the german will remain [here]3430-here ; and , while [you]3507-my friend are assembling [yourselves]3507-my friend together in the presence of [the Lord]3492-the lord , [I]281-the german , in [my]281-the german solitude , will think of and pray for [you]3507-my friend . No ; [I]281-the german will remain [here]3430-here ! "[281-the german]

It was a touching picture [the solitary man there]609-the solitary man there praying for [them]610-them . [The German]281-the german cleared [his]281-the german hands from the meal , and went to the chest from which [he]281-the german had taken the black hat . After a little careful feeling about , [he]281-the german produced a black cloth coat , trowsers , and waistcoat , which [he]281-the german laid on the table , smiling knowingly . They

were of new shining cloth , worn twice a year , when [he]281-the german went to [the town]612-the town to " nachtmaal . "[234-the boy] [He]281-the german looked with great pride at the coat as [he]281-the german unfolded it and held it up .

" It 's not the latest fashion , perhaps , not a West End cut , not exactly ; but it might do ; it might serve at a push . Try it on , try it on ! "[60-waldo] [he]281-the german said , [his]281-the german old grey eyes twinkling with pride . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte stood up and tried on the coat . It fitted admirably ; the waistcoat could be made to button by ripping up the back , and the trowsers were perfect ; but below were the ragged boots . [The German]281-the german was not disconcerted . Going to the beam where a pair of top - boots hung , [he]281-the german took them off , dusted them carefully , and put them down before [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . The old eyes now fairly brimmed over with sparkling enjoyment . " [I]60-waldo have only worn them once . They might serve ; they might be endured . "[60-waldo]

[Bonaparte]67-bonaparte drew them on and stood upright , [his]67-bonaparte head almost touching the beams . [The German]281-the german looked at [him]67-bonaparte with profound admiration . It was wonderful what a difference feathers made in the bird .

CHAPTER V. SUNDAY SERVICES .

SERVICE NO . I.

[THE boy]234-the boy [Waldo]60-waldo kissed the pages of [his]60-waldo book and looked up . Far over [the flat]616-the flat lay the " kopje , "[617-he] a mere speck ; the sheep wandered quietly from bush to bush ; the stillness of the early Sunday rested everywhere , and the air was fresh .

[He]60-waldo looked down at [his]60-waldo book . On its page a black insect crept . [He]60-waldo lifted it off with [his]60-waldo finger . Then [he]60-waldo leaned on [his]60-waldo elbow , watching its quivering antenn ? and strange movements , smiling .

" Even [you]3673-you , "[625-high p?ans] [he]60-waldo whispered , " shall not die . Even [you]3673-you [He]617-he loves . Even [you]3673-you [He]617-he will enfold[628-the friend of god]

in [His]617-he arms when [He]617-he takes everything and makes it perfect and happy . "[628-the friend of god]

When the thing had gone [he]60-waldo smoothed the leaves of [his]60-waldo Bible somewhat caressingly . The leaves of that book had dropped blood for [him]60-waldo once ; they had taken the brightness out of [his]60-waldo childhood ; from between them had sprung the visions that had clung about [him]60-waldo and made night horrible . [Adder]93-adder - like thoughts had lifted [their]618-their heads , had shot out forked tongues at [him]60-waldo , asking mockingly strange , trivial questions that [he]60-waldo could not answer , [miserable child]619-miserable child :

Why did [the women in [Mark]94-mark]620-the women in mark see only [one angel]621-one angel and [the women in Luke two]622-the women in luke two ? Could a story be told in opposite ways and both ways be true ? Could it ? could it ? Then again : Is there nothing always right , and nothing always wrong ? Could [Jael]95-jael [the wife of [Heber the Kenite]96-heber the kenite]623-the wife of heber the kenite " put [her]623-the wife of heber the kenite hand to the nail , and [her]623-the wife of heber the kenite right hand to [the workman]3674-the workman 's hammer ? "[628-the friend of god] and could the Spirit of [the Lord]624-the lord chant p?ans over [her]95-jael , loud p?ans , [high p?ans]625-high p?ans , set in the

book of [the Lord]3492-the lord , and no voice cry out it was a mean and dastardly sin to lie , and kill [the trusting]627-the trusting in [their]618-their sleep ? Could [the friend of [God]56-god]628-the friend of god marry [[his]628-the friend of god own sister]629-his own sister , and be beloved , and [the man who does it to - day]630-the man who does it to - day goes to hell , to hell ? Was there nothing always right or always wrong ?

Those leaves had dropped blood for [him]628-the friend of god once : they had made [his]628-the friend of god heart heavy and cold ; they had robbed [his]628-the friend of god childhood of its gladness ; now [his]628-the friend of god fingers moved over them caressingly .

" [[My]0-i father]3420-my father God knows , [[my]0-i father]3420-my father knows , "[0-i] [he]628-the friend of god said ; " [we]3677-we can not understand ; [He]3420-my father knows . "[0-i] After a while [he]628-the friend of god whispered " [I]234-the boy heard [your]3420-my father voice this morning when [my]234-the boy eyes were not yet open , [I]234-the boy felt [you]3420-my father near [me]234-the boy , [[my]234-the boy Father]3420-my father . Why do [you]3420-my father love [me]234-the boy so ? How is it in the last four months all those old questions have gone from [me]234-the boy ? [I]234-the boy know [you]631-you are good ; [I]234-the boy know [you]631-you love everything ; [I]234-the boy know it is all right ; [I]234-the boy feel it . [I]234-the boy could not have borne it any more , not any more . [I]234-the boy was almost mad . And all the while[234-the boy]

[I]0-i was so miserable [you]631-you were looking at [me]0-i and loving [me]0-i , and [I]0-i never knew it . But [I]0-i know it now . [I]0-i feel it , " said [the boy]234-the boy , and [he]234-the boy laughed low ; "[234-the boy] [I]0-i feel it ! " [he]234-the boy laughed .[234-the boy]

After a while [he]0-i began partly to sing , partly to chant the disconnected verses of hymns , those which spoke [his]0-i gladness , many times over , and loudly and always louder . The sheep with [their]632-their senseless eyes turned to look at [him]0-i as [he]0-i sang . At last [he]0-i lapsed into quiet . Then as [the boy]234-the boy lay there , staring at bush and sand , [he]234-the boy saw a vision .

[He]234-the boy had crossed [the river of Death]634-the river of death , and walked on the other bank in [[the Lord]3492-the lord 's land of [Beulah]97-beulah]636-the lord 's land of beulah . [His]234-the boy feet sank into the dark grass , and [he]234-the boy walked alone . Then , far over [the fields]333-the fields , [he]234-the boy saw a figure coming across the dark green grass . At first [he]234-the boy thought it must be one of [the angels]638-the angels ; but as it came nearer [he]234-the boy began to feel what it was . And it came closer , closer

to [him]234-the boy , and then the voice said , " Come , "[234-the boy] and [he]234-the boy knew surely Who it was . [He]234-the boy ran to the dear feet and touched them with [his]234-the boy hands ; yes , [he]234-the boy held them fast ! [He]234-the boy lay down beside [them]639-them . When [he]234-the boy looked up the face was over [him]234-the boy , and the glorious eyes were loving [him]234-the boy ; and [they]640-they two were there alone together .

[He]234-the boy laughed a deep laugh ; then started up like [one suddenly awakened from sleep]641-one suddenly awakened from sleep . " Oh , [God]56-god ! "[234-the boy] [he]234-the boy cried , " [I]0-i can not wait ; [I]0-i can not wait ! [I]0-i want to die ; [I]0-i want to see [Him]234-the boy ; [I]0-i want to touch [him]234-the boy . Let [me]0-i die ! "[0-i] [He]234-the boy folded [his]234-the boy hands , trembling . " How can [I]644-her husband wait so long for long , long years perhaps ? [I]644-her husband want to die to see [Him]234-the boy . [I]644-her husband will die any death . Oh , let [me]644-her husband come ! "[644-her husband] Weeping [he]234-the boy bowed [himself]234-the boy , and quivered from head to foot . After a long while [he]234-the boy lifted [his]234-the boy head .

" Yes ; [I]234-the boy will wait ; [I]234-the boy will wait . But not long ; do not let it be very long , [Jesus]61-jesus christ . [I]0-i want [you]234-the boy ;[3681-the " predikant]

oh , [I]0-i want [you]234-the boy soon , soon ! " [He]234-the boy sat still , staring across [the plain]196-the plain with [his]234-the boy tearful eyes .[660-he]

SERVICE NO . II .

IN [the front room of [the farmhouse]643-the farmhouse]642-the front room of the farmhouse sat [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie in [her]53-tant ' sannie elbow - chair . In [her]53-tant ' sannie hand was [her]53-tant ' sannie great brass - clasped hymn - book , round [her]53-tant ' sannie neck was a clean white handkerchief , under [her]53-tant ' sannie feet was a wooden stove . There too sat [Em]54-em and [Lyndall]59-lyndall , in clean pinafores and new shoes . There too was the spruce Hottentot in a starched white " cappje , "[660-he] and [[her]53-tant ' sannie husband]644-her husband on the other side of the door , with [his]644-her husband wool oiled and very much combed out , and staring at [his]644-her husband new leather boots . [The Kaffir servants]645-the kaffir servants were not [there]317-there because [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie held [they]645-the kaffir servants were descended from apes , and needed no salvation . But [the rest]647-the rest were gathered for the Sunday service , and waited [the officiator]648-the officiator .

[Meanwhile Bonaparte]67-bonaparte and [the German]281-the german approached arm in arm [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte resplendent in the black cloth clothes , a spotless shirt , and a spotless collar ; the German in the old salt - and - pepper , casting shy glances of admiration at [[his]67-bonaparte companion]457-his companion . At the front door [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte removed [his]67-bonaparte hat with much dignity , raised [his]67-bonaparte shirt collar , and entered . To the centre table [he]67-bonaparte walked , put [his]67-bonaparte hat solemnly down by the big Bible , and bowed [his]67-bonaparte head over it in silent prayer . [The Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman looked at [the Hottentot]98-the hottentot , and [the Hottentot]98-the hottentot looked at [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman .

There was one thing on [earth]653-earth for which [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie had a profound reverence , which exercised a subduing influence over [her]53-tant ' sannie , which made [her]53-tant ' sannie for the time [a better woman]654-a better woman that thing was new , shining black cloth . It made [her]53-tant ' sannie think of [the " predikant]3681-the " predikant ; "[660-he] it made [her]53-tant ' sannie think of [the elders who sat in the top pew of [the church]656-the church on Sundays , with the hair so nicely oiled , so holy

and respectable , with [their]655-the elders who sat in the top pew of the church on sundays , with the hair so nicely oiled , so holy and respectable , with their little swallow - tailed coats little swallow - tailed coats]655-the elders who sat in the top pew of the church on sundays , with the hair so nicely oiled , so holy and respectable , with their little swallow - tailed coats ; it made [her]53-tant ' sannie think of [heaven]3422-heaven , where everything was so holy and respectable , and [nobody]658-nobody wore tan - cord , and [the littlest angel]659-the littlest angel had a black tail - coat . [She]53-tant ' sannie wished [she]53-tant ' sannie had n't called [him]660-he [a thief]661-a thief and [a Roman Catholic]662-a roman catholic . [She]53-tant ' sannie hoped [the German]281-the german had n't told [him]660-he . [She]53-tant ' sannie wondered where those clothes were when [he]660-he came in rags to [her]53-tant ' sannie door . There was no doubt , [he]660-he was [a very respectable man]664-a very respectable man , [a gentleman]441-a gentleman .

[The German]281-the german began to read a hymn . At the end of each line [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte groaned , and twice at the end of every verse .

[The Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman had often heard of [persons groaning during prayers]668-persons groaning during prayers , to add a certain poignancy and finish to [them]668-persons groaning during prayers ; [she]214-the boer - woman would have looked upon it as no especial sign of grace in any one ; but to groan at hymn - time ! [She]53-tant ' sannie was startled . [She]53-tant ' sannie wondered if [he]660-he remembered that [she]53-tant ' sannie shook [her]53-tant ' sannie fist in [his]660-he face . This was [a man of [God]56-god]669-a man of god . [They]670-they knelt down to pray . [The Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman

weighed two hundred and fifty pounds , and could not kneel . [She]53-tant ' sannie sat in [her]53-tant ' sannie chair , and peeped between [her]53-tant ' sannie crossed fingers at [the stranger]418-the stranger 's back . [She]53-tant ' sannie could not understand what [he]660-he said ; but [he]660-he was in earnest . [He]660-he shook the chair by the back rail till it made quite a little dust on the mud floor .

When [they]670-they rose from [their]670-they knees [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte solemnly seated [himself]67-bonaparte in the chair and opened the Bible . [He]660-he blew [his]660-he nose , pulled up [his]660-he shirt collar , smoothed the leaves , stroked down [his]660-he capacious waistcoat , blew [his]660-he nose again , looked solemnly round [the room]215-the room , then began , " [All liars]3682-all liars shall have [their]3682-all liars part in [the lake]3683-the lake which burneth with fire and brimstone , which is the second death . "[67-bonaparte] Having read this portion of Scripture , [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte paused impressively , and looked all round [the room]215-the room .

" [I]67-bonaparte shall not , [[my]67-bonaparte dear friends]3684-my dear friends , "[67-bonaparte] [he]660-he said , " long detain [you]676-you . Much of [our]675-our precious time has[67-bonaparte]

already fled blissfully from [us]675-our in the voice of thanksgiving and the tongue of praise . A few , a very few words are all [I]0-i shall address to [you]676-you , and may they be as a rod of iron dividing the bones from the marrow , and the marrow from the bones .

" In the first place : What is [a liar]3559-a liar ? "[439-his mother] The question was put so pointedly , and followed by a pause so profound , that even [the Hottentot man]677-the hottentot man left off looking at [his]677-the hottentot man boots and opened [his]677-the hottentot man eyes , though [he]677-the hottentot man understood not a word . " [I]439-his mother repeat , "[439-his mother] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , " what is [a liar]3559-a liar ? "[439-his mother] The sensation was intense ; the attention of [the audience]678-the audience was riveted .

" Have [you]676-you any of [you]676-you ever seen [a liar]3559-a liar , [[my]99-sampson dear friends]3684-my dear friends ? "[99-sampson] There was a still longer pause . " [I]439-his mother hope not ; [I]439-his mother truly hope not . But [I]439-his mother will tell [you]676-you what [a liar]3559-a liar is . [I]439-his mother knew [a liar]3559-a liar once [a little boy who lived in [Cape Town]19-cape town]3691-a little boy who lived in cape town , in [Short Market[439-his mother]

Street]20-short market street . [[His]679-he mother]439-his mother and [I]0-i sat together one day , discoursing about [our]681-our souls .

" "[439-his mother] Here , [Sampson]99-sampson , í said [[his]679-he mother]439-his mother , " go and buy sixpence of "[439-his mother] meiboss " from the Malay round the corner.í "[0-i] When [he]679-he came back [she]439-his mother said : " How much have [you]99-sampson got?í "[0-i] " Five , í [he]679-he said . "[0-i] [He]679-he was afraid if [he]679-he said six and a half [she]439-his mother 'd ask for some . And , [[my]0-i friends]683-my friends , that was a lie . The half of a " meibossí stuck in [his]679-he throat and [he]679-he died and was buried . And where did the soul of [that little liar]3692-that little liar go to , [[my]704-the other , with outstretched finger friends]683-my friends ? It went to [the lake of fire and brimstone]3694-the lake of fire and brimstone . This brings [me]704-the other , with outstretched finger to the second point of [my]704-the other , with outstretched finger discourse . "[704-the other , with outstretched finger] What is [a lake of fire and brimstone]684-a lake of fire and brimstone ? [I]0-i will tell [you]683-my friends , [[my]0-i friends]683-my friends , " said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte condescendingly . "[3492-the lord] The imagination unaided can not conceive it : but by the help of [the Lord]3492-the lord [I]0-i will put it before [your]683-my friends mind 's eye .

" [I]3492-the lord was travelling in [Italy]21-italy once on a time ;[3492-the lord]

[I]0-i came to [a city]687-a city called [Rome]22-rome , [a vast city]688-a vast city , and near [it]22-rome is [a mountain which spits forth fire]689-a mountain which spits forth fire . The next day [I]0-i went up . [I]0-i was not afraid ; [the Lord]3492-the lord preserves [[His]3492-the lord servants]696-his servants . And in [their]696-his servants hands shall [they]696-his servants bear [thee]697-thee up , lest at any time [thou]697-thee fall into a volcano . It was dark night when [I]0-i got there , but in the fear of [the Lord]3492-the lord [I]0-i walked to [the edge of [the yawning abyss]700-the yawning abyss]699-the edge of the yawning abyss , and looked in . That sight that sight , [[my]0-i friends]683-my friends , is impressed upon [my]0-i most indelible memory . [I]0-i looked down into the lurid depths upon [an incandescent lake]702-an incandescent lake , a melted fire , [a seething sea]703-a seething sea ; the billows rolled from side to side , and on their fiery crests tossed the white skeleton of the suicide . The heat had burnt the flesh from off

the bones ; they lay as a light cork upon the melted , fiery waves . One skeleton hand was raised upward , the finger pointing to heaven ; [the other , with outstretched finger]704-the other , with outstretched finger , pointing downward , as though it would say , " [I]0-i go below , but [you]67-bonaparte , [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , may soar above.í [I]0-i gazed ; [I]0-i stood entranced . At that instant there was a crack in [the lurid lake]3695-the lurid lake ; it swelled , expanded , and the skeleton of [the suicide]3696-the suicide disappeared , to be seen no more by mortal eye . "[0-i]

Here again [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte rested , and then continued

" [The lake of melted stone]3697-the lake of melted stone rose in [the crater]3698-the crater , it swelled higher and higher at the side , it streamed forth at the top . [I]101-ezekiel had presence of mind ; near [me]101-ezekiel was [a rock]3699-a rock ; [I]101-ezekiel stood upon it . The fiery torrent was vomited out and streamed on either side of [me]101-ezekiel . [the Lord]3492-the lord , who spared [me]0-i that [I]0-i might this day testify in [your]706-your ears of [Him]3492-the lord .

" Now , [[my]103-thousands dear friends]3684-my dear friends , let [us]707-us deduce the lessons that are to be learnt from this narrative . "[103-thousands] Firstly : let [us]707-us never commit suicide . [The man]372-the man is [a fool]709-a fool , [[my]0-i friends]683-my friends , [that man]3552-that man is insane , [[my]0-i friends]683-my friends , who would leave [this earth]713-this earth , [[my]0-i friends]683-my friends . Here are clothes , [[my]0-i friends]683-my friends ; here are beds , [[my]0-i friends]683-my friends ; here is delicious food , [[my]0-i friends]683-my friends . [Our]707-us precious bodies were given [us]707-us to love , to cherish . Oh , let [us]707-us do so ! Oh , let [us]707-us never hurt [them]683-my friends ; but care for and love [them]683-my friends , [[my]0-i friends]683-my friends ! " [Every one]3534-every one was impressed , and [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte proceeded .[724-a god]

" Thirdly ; let [us]707-us not love too much . If [that young man]3702-that young man had not loved [that young woman]3703-that young woman , [he]3702-that young man would not have jumped into [Mount Etna]24-mount etna . [The good men of old]3704-the good men of old never did so . Was [Jeremiah]100-jeremiah[725-the young girl]

ever in love , or [Ezekiel]101-ezekiel , or [Hosea]102-hosea , or even [any of [the minor prophets]722-the minor prophets]721-any of the minor prophets ? No . Then why should [we]707-us be ? " "[67-bonaparte] A charge to keep [I]0-i have , [A God]724-a god to glorify ; A never - dying soul to save , And fit it for the sky . '

about [her]53-tant ' sannie neck and wiped [her]53-tant ' sannie eyes , and [the coloured girl]732-the coloured girl , seeing [her]53-tant ' sannie do so , sniffled . The did not understand the discourse , which made it the more affecting . There hung over it that inscrutable charm which hovers forever for the human intellect , over the incomprehensible and shadowy . That evening [father]778-father and [son]779-son sat in [the cabin]460-the cabin eating [their]781-their supper . [The father]782-the father sighed deeply sometimes . Perhaps [he]782-the father thought how long a time it was since [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte had visited [the cabin]460-the cabin ; but [[his]782-the father son]282-his son was in [that land in which sighs have no part]785-that land in which sighs have no part . It is a question whether it were not better to be [the shabbiest of fools]786-the shabbiest of fools , and know the way up the little stair of imagination to [the land of dreams]787-the land of dreams , than the wisest of [men , who see nothing that the eyes]788-men , who see nothing that the eyes do not show , and feel nothing that the hands do not touch . [The boy]234-the boy chewed [his]234-the boy brown bread and drank [his]234-the boy coffee ; but in truth [he]234-the boy saw only [his]234-the boy machine finished that last something found out and added . [He]234-the boy saw it as it worked with beautiful smoothness ; and over and above , as [he]234-the boy chewed

[his]234-the boy bread and drank [his]234-the boy coffee , there was that delightful consciousness of something bending over [him]234-the boy and loving [him]234-the boy . It would not have been better in one of [the courts of heaven]790-the courts of heaven , where the walls are set with rows of [the King of Glory]791-the king of glory 's amethysts and milk - white pearls , than there , eating [his]791-the king of glory supper in [that little room]792-that little room .

As [they]793-they sat in silence there was a knock at the door . When it was opened the small woolly head of [a little nigger]794-a little nigger showed itself . [She]794-a little nigger was [a messenger from [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie]795-a messenger from tant ' sannie : [the German]281-the german was wanted at once at [the homestead]201-the homestead . Putting on [his]281-the german hat with both hands , [he]281-the german hurried off . [The kitchen]798-the kitchen was in darkness , but in [the pantry beyond]799-the pantry beyond , [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie and [[her]53-tant ' sannie maids]800-her maids were assembled .

[A Kaffir girl , who had been grinding pepper between two stones]801-a kaffir girl , who had been grinding pepper between two stones , knelt on the floor , [the lean Hottentot]802-the lean hottentot stood with a brass candlestick in [her]802-the lean hottentot hand , and [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , near the shelf , with a

hand on each hip , was evidently listening intently , as were [[her]53-tant ' sannie companions]803-her companions .

" What may it be ? "[281-the german] cried [the old German]428-the old german in astonishment . [The room beyond [the pantry]806-the pantry]805-the room beyond the pantry was [the store - room]807-the store - room . Through the thin wooden partition there arose at that instant , evidently from [some creature ensconced there]808-some creature ensconced there , a prolonged and prodigious howl , followed by a succession of violent blows against the partition wall . [The German]281-the german seized the churn - stick , and was about to rush round [the house]206-the house , when [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman impressively laid [her]214-the boer - woman hand upon [his]281-the german arm . " That is [his]281-the german head , "[67-bonaparte] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , " that is [his]281-the german head . "[53-tant ' sannie] " But what might it be ? "[53-tant ' sannie] asked [the German]281-the german , looking from one to the other , churn - stick in hand . " Is n't it dreadful ? "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , as the blows were repeated fiercely . " [He]281-the german has got a letter : [[his]281-the german wife]3738-his wife is dead . [You]281-the german must go and comfort [him]281-the german , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie at last , " and [I]53-tant ' sannie will go with [you]281-the german . " Oh , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , " [I]53-tant ' sannie see now it was n't wickedness made [him]67-bonaparte do without [[his]67-bonaparte wife]3738-his wife so long only necessity . "[53-tant ' sannie]

At the door [she]53-tant ' sannie motioned to [the German]281-the german to enter , and followed [him]281-the german closely . On the stretcher behind the sacks [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte lay on [his]67-bonaparte face , [his]67-bonaparte head pressed into a pillow , [his]67-bonaparte legs kicking gently . [The Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman sat down on a box at

the foot of the bed . [The German]281-the german stood with folded hands looking on .

" [We]3741-we must all die , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant]53-tant ' sannie ' [Sannie]53-tant ' sannie at last ; " it is [the dear Lord]3742-the dear lord 's will . "[67-bonaparte] [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , hearing [her]53-tant ' sannie voice , turned [himself]67-bonaparte on to [his]67-bonaparte back . " It 's very hard , "[67-bonaparte] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , " [I]825-the kaffir girl who looked in at the door know , for [I]825-the kaffir girl who looked in at the door 've lost [two husbands]3743-two husbands . "[825-the kaffir girl who looked in at the door] [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte looked up into [the German]281-the german 's face . " Oh , what does [she]281-the german say ? Speak to [me]53-tant ' sannie words of comfort ! "[53-tant ' sannie] [The German]281-the german repeated [Tant]53-tant ' sannie ' [Sannie]53-tant ' sannie 's remark . " Ah , [I]53-tant ' sannie [I]53-tant ' sannie also ! [Two dear , dear wives]3744-two dear , dear wives , whom [I]53-tant ' sannie shall never see any more ! "[53-tant ' sannie] cried [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , flinging [himself]67-bonaparte back upon the bed . [He]67-bonaparte howled till the tarantulas , who lived between the rafters and the zinc roof , felt the unusual vibration , and looked out with [their]823-their wicked bright eyes , to see what was going on .

[Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie sighed , [the Hottentot maid]737-the hottentot maid sighed , [the Kaffir girl who looked in at the

door]825-the kaffir girl who looked in at the door put [her]825-the kaffir girl who looked in at the door hand over [her]825-the kaffir girl who looked in at the door mouth and said " Mow wah ! "[67-bonaparte]

" [You]67-bonaparte must trust in [the Lord]3492-the lord , "[67-bonaparte] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie . " [He]3492-the lord can give [you]67-bonaparte more than [you]67-bonaparte have lost . "[281-the german] " [I]827-the widower do , [I]827-the widower do ! "[827-the widower] [he]67-bonaparte cried ; " but oh , [I]53-tant ' sannie have [no wife]3746-no wife ! [I]53-tant ' sannie have [no wife]3746-no wife ! "[53-tant ' sannie] [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie was much affected , and came and stood near the bed . " Ask [him]3492-the lord if [he]3492-the lord wo n't have [a little pap nice , fine , flour pap]3748-a little pap nice , fine , flour pap . There is some boiling on the kitchen fire . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte caught the word .

" Perhaps , perhaps if [I]214-the boer - woman struggled with [myself]214-the boer - woman[214-the boer - woman]

for the sake of [my]0-i duties [I]0-i might imbibe a few drops , " [he]214-the boer - woman said , looking with quivering lip up into [the German]281-the german 's face . "[214-the boer - woman] [I]0-i must do [my]0-i duty , must [I]0-i not ? "[214-the boer - woman]

[Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie gave the order , and [the girl]345-the girl went for the pap .

" [I]830-his know how it was when [[my]830-his first husband]3750-my first husband died . [They]3751-they could do nothing with [me]830-his , "[830-his] [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman said , " till [I]67-bonaparte had eaten a sheep 's trotter and honey , and a little roaster - cake . [I]67-bonaparte know . "[67-bonaparte]

[Bonaparte]67-bonaparte sat up on the bed with [his]67-bonaparte legs stretched out in front of [him]67-bonaparte , and a hand on each knee , blubbering softly .

" Oh , [she]214-the boer - woman was [a woman]540-a woman ! [You]281-the german are very kind to try and comfort [me]53-tant ' sannie , but [she]214-the boer - woman was [[my]53-tant ' sannie wife]3448-my wife . For [a woman that is [[my]53-tant ' sannie wife]3448-my wife [I]53-tant ' sannie could live ; for the woman that is [[my]53-tant ' sannie wife]3448-my wife [I]53-tant ' sannie could die]3754-a woman that is my wife i could live ; for the woman that is my wife i could die ! For [a woman that is [[my]53-tant ' sannie wife]3448-my wife [I]53-tant ' sannie could Ah ! [that sweet word wife]3759-that sweet word wife]3757-a woman that is my wife i could ah ! that sweet word wife ; when will it rest upon [my]53-tant ' sannie lips again ? "[53-tant ' sannie]

When [his]830-his feelings had subsided a little [he]830-his raised the corners of [his]830-his turned - down mouth , and spoke to [the German with flabby lips]831-the german with flabby lips . " Do [you]831-the german with flabby lips think [she]3757-a woman that is my wife i could ah ! that sweet word wife understands [me]53-tant ' sannie ? Oh , tell [her]3757-a woman that is my wife i could ah ! that sweet word wife every word , that [she]3757-a woman that is my wife i could ah ! that sweet word wife may know [I]53-tant ' sannie thank [her]3757-a woman that is my wife i could ah ! that sweet word wife . "[53-tant ' sannie] At that instant [the girl]345-the girl reappeared with a basin of steaming gruel and a black bottle . [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie poured some of its contents into the basin , stirred it well , and came to the bed . " Oh , [I]53-tant ' sannie ca n't , [I]53-tant ' sannie ca n't ! [I]53-tant ' sannie shall die ! [I]53-tant ' sannie shall die ! "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , putting [his]67-bonaparte hands to [his]67-bonaparte side . " Come , just a little , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie coaxingly ; " just a drop . "[214-the boer - woman] " It 's too thick , it 's too thick . [I]214-the boer - woman should choke . "[214-the boer - woman]

[Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie added something from the bottle and held out a spoonful ; [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte opened [his]67-bonaparte mouth like a little bird waiting for a worm , and

held it open , as [she]53-tant ' sannie dipped again and again into the pap .

" Ah , this will do [your]67-bonaparte heart good , "[67-bonaparte] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , in whose mind the relative functions of heart and stomach were exceedingly ill - defined . When the basin was emptied the violence of [his]67-bonaparte grief was much assuaged ; [he]67-bonaparte looked at [Tant]53-tant ' sannie ' [Sannie]53-tant ' sannie with gentle tears . " Tell [him]67-bonaparte , "[67-bonaparte] said [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman , " that [I]67-bonaparte hope [he]67-bonaparte will sleep well , and that [the Lord]3492-the lord will comfort [him]67-bonaparte , as [the Lord]3492-the lord only can . "[67-bonaparte] " Bless [you]53-tant ' sannie , [dear friend]3611-dear friend , God bless [you]53-tant ' sannie , "[85-bon] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . When the door was safely shut [he]67-bonaparte got off the bed and washed away the soap [he]67-bonaparte had rubbed on [his]67-bonaparte eyelids .

" [Bon]85-bon , "[67-bonaparte] [he]67-bonaparte said , slapping [his]67-bonaparte leg , " [you]67-bonaparte 're [the ' cutest lad [I]281-the german ever came across]3763-the ' cutest lad i ever came across . fat one]3765-the fat one 's waist and a wedding - ring on [her]834-her finger , then [you]67-bonaparte are not [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . But [you]67-bonaparte are [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . [Bon]85-bon , [you]67-bonaparte 're [a fine boy]835-a fine boy ! "[281-the german]

Making which pleasing reflection , [he]67-bonaparte pulled off [his]67-bonaparte trousers and got into bed cheerfully .

[CHAPTER VII]106-chapter vii . [HE]67-bonaparte SETS [HIS]67-bonaparte TRAP .

" MAY [I]67-bonaparte come in ? [I]67-bonaparte hope [I]67-bonaparte do not disturb [you]85-bon , [[my]67-bonaparte dear friend]3510-my dear friend , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , late one evening , putting [his]67-bonaparte nose in at [the cabin]460-the cabin door , where [the German]281-the german and [[his]281-the german son]282-his son sat finishing [their]839-their supper .

It was now two months since [he]67-bonaparte had been installed as schoolmaster in [[Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie 's household]840-tant ' sannie 's household , and [he]67-bonaparte had grown mighty and more mighty day by day . [He]67-bonaparte visited [the cabin]460-the cabin no more , sat close to [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie drinking coffee all the evening , and walked about loftily with [his]67-bonaparte hands under the coat tails of [the German]73-the german 's black cloth and failed to see even [a nigger]842-a nigger who wished [him]67-bonaparte the time of day . It was

therefore with no small surprise that [the German]281-the german perceived [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte 's red nose at the door .

" Walk in , walk in , "[67-bonaparte] [he]281-the german said joyfully . " [Boy]3767-boy , [boy]3767-boy , see if there is any coffee left . Well , none . Make a fire . [We]3769-we have done supper , but "[281-the german] " [[My]67-bonaparte dear friend]3510-my dear friend , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , taking off [his]67-bonaparte hat , " [I]281-the german came not to sup , not for mere creature comforts , but for an hour of brotherly intercourse with a kindred spirit . The press of business and the weight of thought , but they alone , may sometimes prevent [me]281-the german from sharing the secrets of [my]281-the german bosom with [him]73-the german for whom [I]281-the german have so great a sympathy . [You]3510-my dear friend perhaps wonder when [I]281-the german shall return the two pounds "[281-the german] " Oh , no , no ! Make a fire , make a fire , [boy]3767-boy . [We]3772-we will have a pot of hot coffee presently , "[281-the german] said [the German]281-the german , rubbing [his]281-the german hands and looking about , not knowing how best to show [his]281-the german pleasure at the unexpected visit .

For three weeks [the German]73-the german 's diffident

" Good evening "[281-the german] had met with a stately bow ; the chin of [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte lifting itself higher daily ; and [his]67-bonaparte shadow had not darkened [the cabin]460-the cabin doorway since [he]67-bonaparte came to borrow the two pounds . [The German]281-the german walked to the head of the bed and took down a blue bag that hung there . Blue bags were a speciality of [the German]281-the german 's . [He]281-the german kept above fifty stowed away in different corners of [[his]281-the german room]848-his room some filled with curious stones , some with seeds that had been in [his]281-the german possession fifteen years , some with rusty nails , buckles , and bits of old harness in all , a wonderful assortment , but highly prized .

" [We]3772-we have something here not so bad , "[850-we] said [the German]281-the german , smiling knowingly , as [he]281-the german dived [his]281-the german hand into the bag and took out a handful of almonds and raisins ; " [I]73-the german buy these for [my]73-the german chickens . They increase in size , but [they]3773-they still think [the old man]473-the old man must have something nice for [them]3773-they . And [the old man]473-the old man well , [a big boy]3776-a big boy[73-the german]

may have a sweet tooth sometimes , may [he]281-the german not ? Ha , ha ! " said [the German]281-the german , chuckling at [his]281-the german own joke , as [he]281-the german heaped the plate with almonds . "[73-the german] Here is a stone two stones to crack them no late patent improvement well , [Adam]107-adam 's nut - cracker ; ha , ha ! But [I]0-i think [we]850-we shall do . [We]850-we will not leave them uncracked . [We]850-we will consume a few without fashionable improvements . "[73-the german]

Here [the German]281-the german sat down on one side of the table , [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte on the other ; each one with a couple of flat stones before [him]67-bonaparte , and the plate between [them]852-them .

" Do not be afraid , "[73-the german] said [the German]73-the german , " do not be afraid . [I]67-bonaparte do not forget [the boy at the fire]3778-the boy at the fire ; [I]67-bonaparte crack for [him]3778-the boy at the fire . The bag is full . Why , this is strange , "[67-bonaparte] [he]73-the german said suddenly , cracking upon a large nut ; " three kernels ! [I]67-bonaparte have not observed that before . This must be retained . This is valuable . "[67-bonaparte] [He]73-the german wrapped the nut gravely in paper , and put it carefully in [his]73-the german waistcoat - pocket .

" Valuable , very valuable ! "[67-bonaparte] [he]73-the german said , shaking [his]73-the german head .

" Ah , [[my]281-the german friend]3507-my friend , "[281-the german] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , " what joy it is to be once more in [[your]3507-my friend society]3780-your society . "[281-the german] [The German]73-the german 's eyes glistened , and [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte seized [his]73-the german hand and squeezed it warmly . [They]853-they then proceeded to crack and eat . "[67-bonaparte] " Oh , no , no , "[67-bonaparte] said [the German]281-the german ; " it is all right now . A few sheep missing ; but [I]281-the german make it good [myself]281-the german . "[281-the german] " It is rather hard that [you]3507-my friend should have to make good the lost sheep , "[281-the german] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte ; " it is no fault of [yours]3507-my friend . "[856-he]

" Well , "[0-i] said [the German]281-the german , " this is the case . Last evening [I]860-that boy count the sheep at [the kraal[860-that boy]

twenty]3782-the kraal twenty are missing . This afternoon [I]0-i count [the other flock]858-the other flock . The sheep are not there . [I]0-i come back here : the herd is gone ; the sheep are gone . "[73-the german] [Some one else]859-some one else , but not [he]856-he . [I]0-i know [that boy]860-that boy . [I]0-i knew [him]860-that boy three years . "[281-the german]

" [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie is [a singular woman]3795-a singular woman , "[281-the german] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , taking the tobacco bag [the German]281-the german passed to [him]67-bonaparte .

" Ah , [[my]67-bonaparte friend]3507-my friend , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , " when the grace of [God]56-god is in [our]3798-we hearts , is it not so with [us]3798-we all ? " It is time that [I]67-bonaparte took [my]67-bonaparte departure , [dear friend]3611-dear friend , "[67-bonaparte] [he]67-bonaparte said ; " but , before [I]67-bonaparte do so , shall [we]870-they not close this evening of sweet communion and brotherly intercourse by a few words of prayer ? Then [he]67-bonaparte opened the door and vanished out into the darkness . " [He]67-bonaparte , [he]67-bonaparte , [he]67-bonaparte ! "[67-bonaparte] laughed [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , as [he]67-bonaparte stumbled over the stones . When the worms come out then the blackbirds feed . Ha , ha , ha ! "[281-the german] [He]67-bonaparte looked in at the [kitchen]878-kitchen door . [The Hottentot maid who acted as interpreter between [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie and [himself]67-bonaparte]879-the hottentot maid who acted as interpreter between tant ' sannie and himself was gone , and [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie [herself]53-tant ' sannie was in bed . " Never mind , [Bon]85-bon , [[my]473-the old man boy]3810-my boy , "[473-the old man] [he]67-bonaparte said , as [he]67-bonaparte walked round to [[his]67-bonaparte own room]880-his own room , " to - morrow will do . [He]67-bonaparte , [he]67-bonaparte , [he]67-bonaparte ! "[281-the german]

CHAPTER VIII . [HE]67-bonaparte CATCHES [THE OLD BIRD]881-the old bird .

AT four o'clock the next afternoon [the German]281-the german rode across [the plain]196-the plain , returning from [his]281-the german search for the lost sheep . [He]281-the german rode slowly , for [he]281-the german had been in the saddle since sunrise and was somewhat weary , and the heat of the afternoon made [his]281-the german horse sleepy as it picked its way slowly along [the sandy road]884-the sandy road . Every now and then a great red spider would start out of the karroo on one side of [the path]885-the path and run across to the other , but nothing else broke the still monotony . Presently , behind one of the highest of the milk - bushes that dotted the roadside , [the German]281-the german caught sight of [a Kaffir woman]887-a kaffir woman , seated there evidently for such shadow as the milk - bush

might afford from the sloping rays of the sun . [The German]73-the german turned the horse 's head out of [the road]888-the road . It was not [his]73-the german way to pass [a living creature]889-a living creature without a word of greeting . Coming nearer , [he]73-the german found it was no other than [the wife of [the absconding Kaffir herd]891-the absconding kaffir herd]890-the wife of the absconding kaffir herd . [She]887-a kaffir woman had [a baby]892-a baby tied on [her]887-a kaffir woman back by a dirty strip of red blanket ; another strip hardly larger was twisted round [her]887-a kaffir woman waist , for the rest [her]887-a kaffir woman black body was naked . [She]887-a kaffir woman was [a sullen , ill - looking woman]893-a sullen , ill - looking woman , with lips hideously protruding .

[The German]281-the german questioned [her]887-a kaffir woman as to how [she]887-a kaffir woman came [there]317-there . [She]887-a kaffir woman muttered in broken Dutch that [she]887-a kaffir woman had been turned away . Had [she]887-a kaffir woman done evil ? [She]887-a kaffir woman shook [her]887-a kaffir woman head sullenly . Had [she]887-a kaffir woman had food given [her]887-a kaffir woman ? [She]887-a kaffir woman grunted a negative , and fanned the flies from [[her]887-a kaffir woman baby]896-her baby . Telling [the woman]693-the woman to remain where [she]693-the woman was , [he]281-the german turned [his]281-the german horse 's head to [the road]888-the road and rode off at a furious pace . " [Hard - hearted]3816-hard - hearted ! cruel ! Oh , [my God]3633-my god ! Is this the way ? Is [this charity]3818-this charity ? "[281-the german]

" Yes , yes , yes , "[54-em] ejaculated [the old man]473-the old man as [he]473-the old man rode on ; but , presently , [his]473-the old man anger began to evaporate , [his]473-the old man horse 's pace slackened , and by the time [he]473-the old man had reached [his]473-the old man own door [he]473-the old man was nodding and smiling . Dismounting quickly , [he]473-the old man went to the great chest where [his]473-the old man provisions were kept . Here [he]473-the old man got out a little meal , a little mealies , a few roaster - cakes . These [he]473-the old man tied up in three blue handkerchiefs , and putting them into a sail - cloth bag , [he]473-the old man strung them over [his]473-the old man shoulders . Then [he]473-the old man looked circumspectly out at the door . It was very bad to be discovered in the act of giving ; it made [him]473-the old man red up to the roots of [his]473-the old man old grizzled hair . [No one]237-no one was about , however , so [he]473-the old man rode off again . Beside the milk - bush sat [the Kaffir woman]901-the kaffir woman still like [Hagar]109-hagar , [he]473-the old man thought , thrust out by [[her]901-the kaffir woman mistress]738-her mistress in [the wilderness]903-the wilderness to die . Telling [her]901-the kaffir woman to loosen the handkerchief from [her]901-the kaffir woman head , [he]473-the old man poured into it the contents of [his]473-the old man bag . [The woman]693-the woman tied it up in sullen silence .

" [You]693-the woman must try and get to [the next farm]3819-the next farm , "[59-lyndall] said [the German]281-the german . [The woman]693-the woman shook [her]693-the woman head ; [she]693-the woman would sleep in [the field]301-the field . [The German]281-the german reflected . [Kaffir women]909-kaffir women were accustomed to sleep in the open air ; but then , [the child]3411-the child was small , and after so hot a day the night might be chilly . That [she]3411-the child would creep back to [the huts at [the homestead]201-the homestead]911-the huts at the homestead when the darkness favoured [her]3411-the child , [the German]281-the german 's sagacity did not make evident to [him]473-the old man . [He]473-the old man took off the old brown salt - and - pepper coat , and held it out to [her]693-the woman . [The woman]693-the woman received it in silence , and laid it across [her]693-the woman knee . " With that [they]909-kaffir women will sleep warmly ; not so bad . Ha , ha ! "[59-lyndall] said [the German]281-the german . And [he]473-the old man rode [home]302-home , nodding [his]473-the old man head in a manner that would have made [any other man]917-any other man dizzy . " [I]59-lyndall wish [he]281-the german would not come back to - night , "[59-lyndall] said [Em]54-em , [her]54-em face wet with tears . " It will be just the same if [he]281-the german comes back to - morrow , "[281-the german] said [Lyndall]59-lyndall .

[The two girls]305-the two girls sat on the step of [the cabin]460-the cabin weeping for [the German]281-the german 's return . [Lyndall]59-lyndall shaded [her]59-lyndall eyes with [her]59-lyndall hand from the sunset light . " There [he]281-the german comes , "[281-the german] [she]59-lyndall said , " whistling "[281-the german] Ach Jerķsalem du schŲneí so loud [I]0-i can hear [him]281-the german from here . " "[281-the german] Perhaps [he]281-the german has found the sheep . " "[281-the german] Found [them]921-them ! " said [Lyndall]59-lyndall . "[281-the german] [He]281-the german would whistle just so if [he]281-the german knew [he]281-the german had to die to - night . "[281-the german]

" [You]281-the german look at the sunset , eh , chickens ? "[281-the german] [the German]281-the german said , as [he]281-the german came up at a smart canter . " Ah , yes , that is beautiful ! "[473-the old man] [he]281-the german added , as [he]281-the german dismounted , pausing for a moment with [his]281-the german hand on the saddle to look at the evening sky , where the sun shot up long flaming streaks , between which and the eye thin yellow clouds floated . " Ei ! [you]307-the girls weep ? "[281-the german] said [the German]281-the german , as [the girls]307-the girls ran up to [him]281-the german .

Before [they]307-the girls had time to reply the voice of [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie was heard .

" [[You]307-the girls child]3820-you child , of [the child]3411-the child , of the child of a [Kaffir]110-kaffir 's dog , come here ! "[281-the german] [The German]281-the german looked up . [He]281-the german thought [the Dutch - woman]926-the dutch - woman , come out to cool [herself]926-the dutch - woman in [the yard]927-the yard , called to some misbehaving [Kaffir]110-kaffir . [The old man]473-the old man looked round to see who it might be . " [[You]307-the girls old vagabond of [a praying German]3823-a praying german]3822-you old vagabond of a praying german , are [you]307-the girls deaf ? "[307-the girls] [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie stood before the steps of [the kitchen]798-the kitchen ; upon [them]930-them sat [the lean Hottentot]802-the lean hottentot , upon the highest stood [Bonaparte Blenkins]67-bonaparte , both hands folded under the tails of [his]67-bonaparte coat , and [his]67-bonaparte eyes fixed on the sunset sky . [The German]281-the german dropped the saddle on the ground .

" Bish , bish , bish ! what may this be ? "[281-the german] [he]281-the german said , and walked toward [the house]206-the house . " Very strange ! "[0-i]

[The girls]307-the girls followed [him]281-the german : [Em]54-em still weeping ; [Lyndall]59-lyndall with [her]59-lyndall face rather white and [her]59-lyndall eyes wide open .

" And [I]0-i have the heart of [a devil]3824-a devil , did [you]281-the german[0-i]

say ? [You]281-the german could run [me]0-i through with a knife , could [you]281-the german ? " cried [the Dutch - woman]926-the dutch - woman . "[111-the kaffirs] [I]0-i could not drive [the Kaffir girl]817-the kaffir girl away because [I]0-i was afraid of [you]281-the german , was [I]0-i ? Oh , [you]281-the german miserable rag ! [I]0-i loved [you]281-the german , did [I]0-i ? [I]0-i would have liked to marry [you]281-the german , would [I]0-i ? would [I]0-i ? WOULD [I]0-i ? " cried [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman ; "[0-i] [you]281-the german cat 's tail , [you]281-the german dog 's paw ! Be near [[my]0-i house]936-my house to - morrow morning when the sun rises , " [she]214-the boer - woman gasped , "[0-i] [[my]0-i [Kaffirs]111-the kaffirs]937-my kaffirs will drag [you]281-the german through the sand . [They]111-the kaffirs would do it gladly , any of [them]111-the kaffirs , for a bit of tobacco , for all [your]281-the german prayings with [them]111-the kaffirs . "[53-tant ' sannie]

" [I]926-the dutch - woman am bewildered , [I]926-the dutch - woman am bewildered , said [the German]281-the german , standing before [her]214-the boer - woman and raising [his]926-the dutch - woman hand to [his]926-the dutch - woman forehead ; "[926-the dutch - woman] [I]0-i [I]0-i do not understand . "[214-the boer - woman]

" Ask [him]67-bonaparte , ask [him]67-bonaparte ! "[214-the boer - woman] cried [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , pointing to [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte ; " [he]67-bonaparte knows . [You]67-bonaparte thought [he]67-bonaparte could not make [me]67-bonaparte understand , but [he]67-bonaparte did , [he]67-bonaparte did , [[you]67-bonaparte old fool]3828-you old fool ! [I]67-bonaparte know enough English for that . [You]67-bonaparte be here , "[67-bonaparte] shouted [the Dutch - woman]926-the dutch - woman ,

" when the morning star rises , and [I]67-bonaparte will let [[my]67-bonaparte Kaffirs]937-my kaffirs take [you]67-bonaparte out and drag [you]67-bonaparte , till there is not one bone left in [your]67-bonaparte old body that is not broken as fine as bobotie - meat , [[you]67-bonaparte old beggar]3830-you old beggar ! All [your]67-bonaparte rags are not worth that they should be thrown out onto the ash - heap , "[67-bonaparte] cried [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman ; " but [I]67-bonaparte will have them for [my]67-bonaparte sheep . Not one rotten hoof of [[your]67-bonaparte old mare]3831-your old mare do [you]67-bonaparte take with [you]67-bonaparte ; [I]67-bonaparte will have [her]3831-your old mare all , all for [my]67-bonaparte sheep that [you]67-bonaparte have lost , [you]67-bonaparte godless thing ! "[67-bonaparte]

[The Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman wiped the moisture from [her]214-the boer - woman mouth with the palm of [her]214-the boer - woman hand . [The German]281-the german turned to [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , who still stood [on the step absorbed in the beauty of the sunset]942-on the step absorbed in the beauty of the sunset .

" Do not address [me]281-the german ; do not approach [me]281-the german , [lost man]3832-lost man , "[281-the german] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , not moving [his]67-bonaparte eye nor lowering [his]67-bonaparte chin . " There is a crime from which all nature revolts ; there is a crime whose name is loathsome to [the human ear]3833-the human ear that crime is [yours]67-bonaparte ; that crime is ingratitude . [This[281-the german]

woman]3834-this woman has been [[your]67-bonaparte benefactress]943-your benefactress ; on [her]943-your benefactress farm [you]67-bonaparte have lived ; after [her]943-your benefactress sheep [you]67-bonaparte have looked ; into [[her]943-your benefactress house]944-her house [you]67-bonaparte have been allowed to enter and hold Divine service an honour of which [you]67-bonaparte were never worthy ; and how have [you]67-bonaparte rewarded [her]943-your benefactress ? Basely , basely , basely ! "[744-the dutchwoman]

" But it is all false , lies and falsehoods . [I]744-the dutchwoman must , [I]744-the dutchwoman will speak , "[744-the dutchwoman] said [the German]281-the german , suddenly looking round bewildered . " Do [I]281-the german dream ? Are [you]67-bonaparte mad ? What may it be ? "[281-the german] " Go , [dog]3835-dog , "[693-the woman] cried [the Dutchwoman]744-the dutchwoman ; " [I]59-lyndall would have been [a rich woman]3836-a rich woman this day if it had not been for [your]281-the german laziness . Praying with [the Kaffirs]111-the kaffirs behind the kraal walls . Go , [you]281-the german Kaffir 's dog ! "[59-lyndall] " But what then is the matter ? What may have happened since [I]59-lyndall left ? "[59-lyndall] said [the German]281-the german , turning to [the Hottentot woman who sat upon the step]948-the hottentot woman who sat upon the step .

[She]948-the hottentot woman who sat upon the step was [[his]281-the german friend]949-his friend ; [she]948-the hottentot woman who sat upon the step would tell [him]281-the german kindly the truth . [The woman]693-the woman answered by a loud , ringing laugh .

" Give it [him]473-the old man , [old missis]3837-old missis ! Give it [him]473-the old man ! "[59-lyndall] It was so nice to see [the white man who had been master hunted down]951-the white man who had been master hunted down . [The coloured woman]952-the coloured woman laughed , and threw a dozen mealie grains into [her]952-the coloured woman mouth to chew . All anger and excitement faded from [the old man]473-the old man 's face . [He]473-the old man turned slowly away and walked down the little path to [[his]473-the old man cabin]954-his cabin , with [his]473-the old man shoulders bent ; it was all dark before [him]473-the old man . [He]473-the old man stumbled over the threshold of [[his]473-the old man own well - known door]955-his own well - known door . [Em]54-em , sobbing bitterly , would have followed [him]473-the old man ; but [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman prevented [her]54-em by a flood of speech which convulsed [the Hottentot]98-the hottentot , so low were its images . " Come , [Em]54-em , "[345-the girl] said [Lyndall]59-lyndall , lifting [her]59-lyndall small proud head , " let [us]3838-us go in . [We]3838-us will not stay to hear such language . "[54-em]

[She]59-lyndall looked into [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman 's eyes . [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie understood the meaning of the look if not the words . [She]59-lyndall waddled after [them]958-them , and

caught [Em]54-em by the arm . [She]59-lyndall had struck [Lyndall]59-lyndall once years before , and had never done it again , so [she]59-lyndall took [Em]54-em .

" So [you]3411-the child will defy [me]54-em , too , will [you]3411-the child , [you]3411-the child [Englishman]112-englishman 's ugliness ! "[54-em] [she]59-lyndall cried , and with one hand [she]59-lyndall forced [the child]3411-the child down , and held [her]54-em head tightly against [her]54-em knee ; with the other [she]59-lyndall beat [her]54-em face , first upon one cheek and then upon the other . For one instant [Lyndall]59-lyndall looked on , then [she]59-lyndall laid [her]59-lyndall small fingers on [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman 's arm . With the exertion of half its strength [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie might have flung [the girl]345-the girl back upon the stones . It was not the power of the slight fingers , tightly though [they]962-they clinched [her]54-em broad wrist so tightly that at bedtime the marks were still there ; but [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman looked into the clear eyes and at the quivering white lips , and with a half - surprised curse relaxed [her]214-the boer - woman hold . [The girl]345-the girl drew [Em]54-em 's arm through [her]345-the girl own .

" Move ! "[59-lyndall] [she]345-the girl said to [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , who stood in

the door ; and [he]67-bonaparte , [Bonaparte the invincible]67-bonaparte , in the hour of [his]67-bonaparte triumph , moved to give [her]345-the girl place .

[The Hottentot]98-the hottentot ceased to laugh , and an uncomfortable silence fell on [all the three in the doorway]965-all the three in the doorway . Once in [[their]965-all the three in the doorway room]966-their room , [Em]54-em sat down on the floor and wailed bitterly . [Lyndall]59-lyndall lay on the bed with [her]59-lyndall arm drawn across [her]59-lyndall eyes , very white and still . " Hoo , hoo ! "[59-lyndall] cried [Em]54-em ; " and [they]965-all the three in the doorway wo n't let [him]67-bonaparte take the grey mare ; and [Waldo]60-waldo has gone to [the mill]3807-the mill . Hoo , hoo , and perhaps [they]965-all the three in the doorway wo n't let [us]965-all the three in the doorway go and say good - bye to [him]67-bonaparte . Hoo , hoo , hoo ! "[59-lyndall] " [I]54-em wish [you]54-em would be quiet , "[54-em] said [Lyndall]59-lyndall without moving . " Does it give [you]54-em such felicity to let [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte know [he]67-bonaparte is hurting [you]54-em ? [We]965-all the three in the doorway will ask [no one]237-no one . It will be supper - time soon . Listen , and when [you]54-em hear the clink of the knives and forks [we]965-all the three in the doorway will go out and see [him]67-bonaparte .[54-em]

[Em]54-em suppressed [her]54-em sobs and listened intently , kneeling at the door . Suddenly [some one]3445-some one came to the window and put the shutter up . " Who was that ? "[54-em] said [Lyndall]59-lyndall , starting . " [The girl]345-the girl , [I]59-lyndall suppose , "[59-lyndall] said [Em]54-em . " How early [she]345-the girl is this evening ! "[59-lyndall] But [Lyndall]59-lyndall sprang from the bed and seized the handle of the door , shaking it fiercely . The door was locked on the outside . [She]59-lyndall ground [her]59-lyndall teeth . " What is the matter ? "[54-em] asked [Em]54-em . [The room]215-the room was in perfect darkness now . " Nothing , "[54-em] said [Lyndall]59-lyndall quietly ; " only [they]3842-they have locked [us]3843-us in . "[54-em]

[She]59-lyndall turned , and went back to bed again . But ere long [Em]54-em heard a sound of movement . [Lyndall]59-lyndall had climbed up into the window , and with [her]59-lyndall fingers felt the wood - work that surrounded the panes . Slipping down , [the girl]345-the girl loosened the iron knob from the foot of the bedstead , and climbing up again , [she]345-the girl broke with it every pane of glass

in the window , beginning at the top and ending at the bottom .

" What are [you]59-lyndall doing ? "[54-em] asked [Em]54-em , [who heard the falling fragments]970-who heard the falling fragments . [[Her]54-em companion]341-her companion made [her]54-em no reply ; but with all [her]54-em weight leaned on every little cross - bar , which cracked and gave way beneath [her]54-em . Then [she]54-em pressed with all [her]54-em strength against the shutter . [She]54-em had thought the wooden buttons would give way , but by the clinking sound [she]54-em knew that the iron bar had been put across . [She]54-em was quite quiet for a time . Clambering down , [she]54-em took from the table a small one - bladed penknife , with which [she]54-em began to peck at the hard wood of the shutter . " What are [you]59-lyndall doing now ? "[54-em] asked [Em]54-em , who had ceased crying in [her]54-em wonder , and had drawn near . " Trying to make a hole ? "[54-em] was the short reply . " Do [you]59-lyndall think [you]59-lyndall will be able to ? "[59-lyndall]

" No ; but [I]59-lyndall am trying . "[59-lyndall] In an agony of suspense [Em]54-em waited . For ten minutes [Lyndall]59-lyndall pecked . The hole was three - eighths of an inch deep then the blade sprang into ten pieces . " What has happened now ? "[54-em] [Em]54-em asked , blubbering afresh . " Nothing , "[54-em] said [Lyndall]59-lyndall . " Bring [me]54-em [my]54-em night - gown , a piece of paper , and the matches . "[54-em] [Wondering]113-wondering , [Em]54-em fumbled about till [she]54-em found them . " What are [you]59-lyndall going to do with [them]3844-them , "[54-em] [she]54-em whispered . " Burn it down . "[54-em] " But wo n't [the whole house]3845-the whole house take fire and burn down too ? "[54-em] " Yes . "[54-em] " But will it not be very wicked ? "[54-em] " Yes , very . And [I]59-lyndall do n't care . "[59-lyndall]

[She]54-em arranged the night - gown carefully in the corner of the window , with the chips of the

frame about it . There was only one match in the box . [She]54-em drew it carefully along the wall . For a moment it burnt up blue , and showed the tiny face with its glistening eyes . [She]54-em held it carefully to the paper . For an instant it burnt up brightly , then flickered and went out . [She]54-em blew the spark , but it died also . Then [she]54-em threw the paper on to the ground , trod on it , and went to [her]54-em bed , and began to undress .

[Em]54-em rushed to the door , knocking against it wildly . " Tant ' [Sannie]53-tant ' sannie ! [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie ! Oh , let [us]3846-us out ! "[59-lyndall] [she]54-em cried . " Oh , [Lyndall]59-lyndall , what are [we]3846-us to do ? "[59-lyndall] [Lyndall]59-lyndall wiped a drop of blood off the lip [she]59-lyndall had bitten . " [I]59-lyndall am going to sleep , "[59-lyndall] [she]59-lyndall said . " If [you]59-lyndall like to sit there and howl till the morning , do . Perhaps [you]59-lyndall will find that it helps ; [I]54-em never heard that howling helped [any one]504-any one . "[54-em]

Long after , when [Em]54-em [herself]54-em had gone to bed and was almost asleep , [Lyndall]59-lyndall came and stood at [her]54-em bedside . " Here , "[281-the german] [she]59-lyndall said , slipping a little pot of powder into [her]59-lyndall hand ; " rub some on to [your]59-lyndall face . Does it not burn where [she]54-em struck [you]59-lyndall ? "[0-i] Then [she]59-lyndall crept back to [her]59-lyndall own bed . Long , long after , when [Em]54-em was really asleep , [she]54-em lay still awake , and folded [her]54-em hands on [her]54-em little breast , and muttered , " When that day comes , and [I]60-waldo am strong , [I]60-waldo will hate everything that has power , and help everything that is weak . "[60-waldo] And [she]54-em bit [her]54-em lip again . [The German]281-the german looked out at [the cabin]460-the cabin door for the last time that night . Then [he]281-the german paced [the room]215-the room slowly and sighed . Then [he]281-the german drew out pen and paper , and sat down to write , rubbing [his]281-the german old grey eyes with [his]281-the german knuckles before [he]281-the german began .

" [MY]0-i CHICKENS ,[0-i]

" [You]975-you did not come to say good - bye to [the old man]473-the old man . Might [you]975-you ? Ah , well , there is [a land where [they]3850-they part no more , where [saints immortal reign]3851-saints immortal reign]3849-a land where they part no more , where saints immortal reign . "[0-i] [I]0-i sit here alone , and [I]0-i think of [you]975-you . Will [you]975-you forget [the old man]473-the old man ? When [you]975-you wake to - morrow [he]473-the old man will be far away . [The old horse]977-the old horse is lazy , but [he]977-the old horse has [his]977-the old horse stick to help [him]977-the old horse ; that is three legs . [He]977-the old horse comes back one day with gold and diamonds . Will [you]975-you welcome [him]977-the old horse ? Well , [we]978-we shall see . [I]0-i go to meet [Waldo]60-waldo . [He]60-waldo comes back with the waggon ; then [he]60-waldo follows [me]0-i . [Poor boy]979-poor boy ! God knows . There is [a land where all things are made right]980-a land where all things are made right , but [that land]565-that land is not here . " [[My]0-i little children]3852-my little children , serve [the Saviour]3853-the saviour ; give [your]3852-my little children hearts to [Him]3853-the saviour while [you]3852-my little children are yet young . Life is short . "[0-i] Nothing is [mine]0-i , otherwise [I]0-i would say , [Lyndall]59-lyndall , take [my]0-i books , Em [my]0-i stones . Now [I]0-i say nothing . The things are mine ; it is not righteous , God knows ! But [I]0-i am silent . Let it be . But [I]0-i feel it , [I]0-i must say [I]0-i feel it .

" Do not cry too much for [the old man]473-the old man . [He]0-i[0-i]

goes out to seek [his]0-i fortune , and comes back with it in a bag , it may be .

" [I]281-the german love [[my]281-the german children]3855-my children . Do [they]3855-my children think of [me]281-the german ? [I]281-the german am [Old Otto]66-old otto , who goes out to seek [his]0-i fortune .[281-the german]

" O.F. "[473-the old man]

Having concluded this quaint production , [he]0-i put it where [the children]358-the children would find it the next morning , and proceeded to prepare [his]0-i bundle . [He]0-i never thought of entering a protest against the loss of [his]0-i goods ; like [a child]224-a child , [he]0-i submitted , and wept . [He]0-i had been [there]317-there eleven years , and it was hard to go away . [He]0-i spread open on the bed a blue handkerchief , and on it put one by one the things [he]0-i thought most necessary and important a little bag of curious seeds , which [he]0-i meant to plant some day , an old German hymn - book , three misshapen stones that [he]0-i greatly valued , a Bible , a shirt and two handkerchiefs ; then there was room for nothing more . [He]0-i tied up the bundle tightly and put it on a chair by [his]0-i bed - side .

" That is not much ; [they]3856-they can not say [I]473-the old man take much , "[473-the old man] [he]0-i said , looking at it . [He]0-i put [his]0-i knotted stick beside it , [his]0-i blue tobacco bag and [his]0-i short pipe , and then inspected [his]0-i coats . [He]0-i had two left a moth - eaten over - coat and a black alpaca out at the elbows . [He]0-i decided for the over - coat ; it was warm , certainly , but then [he]0-i could carry [it]985-it over [his]0-i arm and only put it on when [he]0-i met [some one along [the road]888-the road]986-some one along the road . It was more respectable than the black alpaca . [He]0-i hung the great - coat over the back of the chair , and stuffed a hard bit of roaster - cake under the knot of the bundle , and then [his]0-i preparations were completed . [The German]281-the german stood contemplating [them]989-them with much satisfaction . [He]281-the german had almost forgotten [his]281-the german sorrow at leaving in [his]281-the german pleasure at preparing . Suddenly [he]281-the german started ; an expression of intense pain passed over [his]281-the german face . [He]281-the german drew back [his]281-the german left arm quickly , and then pressed [his]281-the german right hand upon [his]281-the german breast . " Ah , the sudden pang again , "[473-the old man] [he]281-the german said .

[His]281-the german face was white , but it quickly regained its colour . Then [the old man]473-the old man busied [himself]473-the old man in putting everything right . " [I]473-the old man will leave it neat . [They]3857-they shall not say [I]473-the old man did not leave it neat , "[473-the old man] [he]473-the old man said . Even the little bags of seeds on the mantel - piece [he]473-the old man put in rows and dusted . Then [he]473-the old man undressed and got into bed . Under [his]473-the old man pillow was a little story - book . [He]473-the old man drew it forth . To [the old German]73-the german a story was no story . Its events were as real and as important to [himself]473-the old man as the matters of [his]473-the old man own life . [He]473-the old man could not go away without knowing whether [that wicked Earl]991-that wicked earl relented and whether [the Baron]992-the baron married [Emilina]114-emilina . So [he]473-the old man adjusted [his]473-the old man spectacles and began to read . Occasionally , as [his]473-the old man feelings became too strongly moved , [he]473-the old man ejaculated , " Ah , [I]473-the old man thought so ! That was [a rogue]3858-a rogue ! [I]473-the old man saw it before ! [I]473-the old man knew it from the beginning ! "[473-the old man] More than half - an - hour had passed when [he]473-the old man looked up to the silver watch at the top of [his]473-the old man bed .

" The march is long to - morrow ; this will not do , "[1023-they] [he]473-the old man said , taking off [his]473-the old man spectacles and putting them carefully into the book to mark the place . " This will be good reading as [I]60-waldo walk along to - morrow , "[60-waldo] [he]473-the old man added , as [he]473-the old man stuffed the book into the pocket of the great - coat ; " very good reading . "[60-waldo] [He]473-the old man nodded [his]473-the old man head and lay down . [He]473-the old man thought a little of [his]473-the old man own troubles , a good deal of [the two little girls [he]473-the old man was leaving]993-the two little girls he was leaving , of [the Earl]994-the earl , of [Emilina]114-emilina , of [the Baron]992-the baron ; but [he]473-the old man was soon asleep sleeping as peacefully as [a little child upon whose innocent soul sorrow and care can not rest]996-a little child upon whose innocent soul sorrow and care can not rest .

It was very quiet in [the room]215-the room . The coals in [the fire - place]998-the fire - place threw a dull red light across the floor upon the red lions on the quilt . Eleven o'clock came , and [the room]215-the room was very still . [One o'clock]1000-one o'clock came . The glimmer had died out , though the ashes were still warm , and [the room]215-the room was very dark . The grey mouse , who had its hole under the tool - box , came out and sat on the sacks in

the corner ; then , growing bolder , [the room]215-the room was so dark , it climbed the chair at the bedside , nibbled at the roaster - cake , took one bite quickly at the candle , and then sat on [his]473-the old man haunches listening .
