[It]1003-it heard the even breathing of [the old man]473-the old man , and the steps of the hungry Kaffir dog going [his]473-the old man last round in search of a bone or a skin that had been forgotten ; and [it]1003-it heard the white hen call out as the wild cat ran away with one of [her]473-the old man brood , and [it]1003-it heard the chicken cry . Then the grey mouse went back to its hole under the tool - box , and [the room]215-the room was quiet . And two o'clock came . By that time the night was grown dull and cloudy . [The wild cat]1006-the wild cat had gone to [[its]1006-the wild cat home on [the kopje]1008-the kopje]1007-its home on the kopje ; [the Kaffir]110-kaffir 's dog had found a bone , and lay gnawing it .

An intense quiet reigned everywhere . Only in [[her]473-the old man room]1009-her room [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman tossed [her]473-the old man great arms in [her]473-the old man sleep ; for [she]473-the old man dreamed that a dark shadow with outstretched wings fled slowly over

[[her]473-the old man house]944-her house , and [she]473-the old man moaned and shivered . And the night was very still .

But quiet as all places were , there was a quite peculiar quiet in [[the German]281-the german 's room]1013-the german 's room . Though [you]1014-you strained [your]1014-you ear most carefully [you]1014-you caught no sound of breathing .

[He]281-the german was not gone , for the old coat still hung on the chair the coat that was to be put on when [he]281-the german met [any one]504-any one ; and the bundle and stick were ready for to - morrow 's long march . [The old German]428-the old german [himself]428-the old german lay there , [his]428-the old german wavy black hair just touched with grey thrown back upon the pillow . [The old face]1017-the old face was lying there alone in the dark , smiling like [a little child]3461-a little child 's oh , so peacefully . There is [a stranger whose coming , they say , is worse than all the ills of life]1019-a stranger whose coming , they say , is worse than all the ills of life , from whose presence [we]1020-we flee away trembling ; but [he]1019-a stranger whose coming , they say , is worse than all the ills of life comes very tenderly sometimes . And it seemed almost as though [Death]115-death had known and loved [the old man]473-the old man , so gently it touched [him]473-the old man . And how could it deal hardly

with [him]473-the old man [the loving , simple , childlike old man]1022-the loving , simple , childlike old man ?

So it smoothed out the wrinkles that were in the old forehead , and fixed the passing smile , and sealed the eyes that they might not weep again ; and then the short sleep of time was melted into the long , long sleep of eternity . " How has [he]473-the old man grown so young in this one night ? "[60-waldo] [they]1023-they said when [they]1023-they found [him]473-the old man in the morning . Yes , [dear old man]1024-dear old man ; to such as [you]1024-dear old man time brings no age . [You]1024-dear old man die with the purity and innocence of [your]1024-dear old man childhood upon [you]1024-dear old man , though [you]1024-dear old man die in [your]1024-dear old man grey hairs .

CHAPTER IX . [HE]473-the old man SEES [A GHOST]116-a ghost .

[BONAPARTE]67-bonaparte stood on the ash - heap . [He]67-bonaparte espied across [the plain]196-the plain a moving speck , and [he]67-bonaparte chucked [his]67-bonaparte coat - tails up and down in expectancy of a dainty morsel .

The waggon came on slowly . [Waldo]60-waldo lay curled among the sacks at the back of the waggon , [his]60-waldo hand in [his]60-waldo breast resting on the sheep - shearing machine . It was finished now . The right thought had struck [him]60-waldo the day before as [he]60-waldo sat , half asleep , watching the water go over the mill - wheel . [He]60-waldo muttered to [himself]60-waldo with half - closed eyes ,

" To - morrow smooth the cogs tighten the screws a little show it to [them]3859-them . "[60-waldo] Then after a

pause " Over [the whole world]3860-the whole world [the whole world]3860-the whole world mine , that [I]60-waldo have made ! "[60-waldo] [He]60-waldo pressed the little wheels and pulleys in [his]60-waldo pocket till they cracked . Presently [his]60-waldo muttering became louder " And fifty pounds a black hat for [[my]60-waldo dad]3862-my dad for [Lyndall]59-lyndall a blue silk , very light , and one purple like the earth - bells , and white shoes . "[60-waldo] [He]60-waldo muttered on " A box full , full of books . [They]3859-them shall tell [me]60-waldo all , all , all , "[60-waldo] [he]60-waldo added , moving [his]60-waldo fingers desiringly : " why the crystals grow in such beautiful shapes ; why lightning runs to the iron ; why [black people]3863-black people are black ; why the sunlight makes things warm . [I]67-bonaparte shall read , read , read , "[67-bonaparte] [he]60-waldo muttered slowly . Then came over [him]60-waldo suddenly what [he]60-waldo called " The presence of [God]56-god ; "[234-the boy] a sense of a good , strong something folding [him]60-waldo round . [He]60-waldo smiled through [his]60-waldo half - shut eyes . " Ah , [Father]117-father , [[my]67-bonaparte own Father]3864-my own father , it is so sweet to feel [you]117-father , like the warm sunshine . The Bibles and books can not tell of [you]117-father and all [I]67-bonaparte feel [you]117-father . They are mixed with [men]3470-men 's words ; but [you]117-father "[67-bonaparte]

[His]60-waldo muttering sank into inaudible confusion , till , opening [his]60-waldo eyes wide , it struck [him]60-waldo that [the brown plain]1026-the brown plain [he]60-waldo looked at was [the old home farm]1027-the old home farm . For half an hour [they]1028-they had been riding in [it]1026-the brown plain , and [he]60-waldo had not known it . [He]60-waldo roused [the leader]1029-the leader , who sat nodding on the front of [the waggon in the early morning sunlight]1030-the waggon in the early morning sunlight . [They]1028-they were within half a mile of [the homestead]201-the homestead . It seemed to [him]60-waldo that [he]60-waldo had been gone from [them]1028-they all a year . [He]60-waldo fancied [he]60-waldo could see [Lyndall]59-lyndall standing on the brick wall to watch for [him]60-waldo ; [[his]60-waldo father]235-his father , passing from [one house]1033-one house to the other , stopping to look .

[He]60-waldo called aloud to [the oxen]1034-the oxen . For [each one]1035-each one at [home]302-home [he]60-waldo had brought something . For [[his]60-waldo father]235-his father a piece of tobacco , bought at the shop by [the mill]3807-the mill ; for [Em]54-em a thimble ; for [Lyndall]59-lyndall a beautiful flower dug out by the roots , at a place where [they]1028-they had " out - spanned "[67-bonaparte] ; for [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie a handkerchief . When [they]1028-they drew near [the house]206-the house [he]60-waldo threw the whip to [the Kaffir leader]1040-the kaffir leader , and sprang

from the side of [the waggon]1041-the waggon to rush on . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte stopped [him]60-waldo as [he]60-waldo ran past the ash - heap .

" Good morning , [[my]1043-the lad dear boy]3866-my dear boy . Where are [you]234-the boy running to so fast with [your]234-the boy rosy cheeks ? "[1043-the lad] [The boy]234-the boy looked up at [him]60-waldo , glad even to see [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . " [I]67-bonaparte am going to [the cabin]460-the cabin , "[67-bonaparte] [he]67-bonaparte said , out of breath . " [You]234-the boy wo n't find [them]1044-the stone - walled ostrich - camps in just now not [[your]234-the boy good old father]3868-your good old father , "[234-the boy] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . " Where is [he]3868-your good old father ? "[67-bonaparte] asked [the lad]1043-the lad . " There , beyond [the camps]3869-the camps , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , waving [his]67-bonaparte hand oratorically toward [the stone - walled [ostrich - camps]1045-ostrich - camps]1044-the stone - walled ostrich - camps . " What is [he]3868-your good old father doing [there]317-there ? "[67-bonaparte] asked [the boy]234-the boy . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte patted [him]234-the boy on the cheek kindly .

" [He]3868-your good old father smelt so , [we]3871-we could not keep [him]3868-your good old father any more . [We]3871-we 've buried [him]3868-your good old father , [[my]67-bonaparte boy]3810-my boy , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , sticking [his]67-bonaparte finger into [the boy]234-the boy 's cheek . " [He]3868-your good old father was quite bad already . [He]3868-your good old father , [he]3868-your good old father , [he]3868-your good old father ! "[67-bonaparte] laughed [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , as [the boy]234-the boy fled away

along the low stone wall , almost furtively , as one in fear . There was a gurgling of enjoyment in [the man]372-the man 's stomach .

At five o'clock [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte knelt before a box in [[the German]281-the german 's room]1013-the german 's room . [He]67-bonaparte was busily unpacking it .

It had been agreed upon between [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie and [himself]67-bonaparte , that now [the German]281-the german was gone [he]67-bonaparte , [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , was to be no longer schoolmaster , but [overseer of [the farm]260-the farm]1053-overseer of the farm . In return for [his]67-bonaparte past scholastic labours [he]67-bonaparte had expressed [himself]67-bonaparte willing to take possession of [the dead man]1055-the dead man 's goods and [room]1056-room . [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie hardly liked the arrangement . [She]53-tant ' sannie had a great deal more respect for [the German dead]1057-the german dead than [the German living]1058-the german living , and would rather [his]67-bonaparte goods had been allowed to descend peacefully to [[his]67-bonaparte son]282-his son . For [she]53-tant ' sannie was a firm believer in the chinks in [the world above]1060-the world above , where not only ears , but eyes might be applied to see how things went on in [this world below]1061-this world below .

[She]53-tant ' sannie never felt sure how far [the spirit - world]1062-the spirit - world might overlap [this world of sense]1063-this world of sense , and , as a rule , prudently abstained from doing anything which might offend [unseen auditors]1064-unseen auditors . For this reason [she]53-tant ' sannie abstained from ill - using [[the dead Englishman]270-the dead englishman 's daughter]1066-the dead englishman 's daughter and [niece]1067-niece , and for this reason [she]53-tant ' sannie would rather [the boy]234-the boy had had [[his]234-the boy father]235-his father 's goods . But it was hard to refuse [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte anything when [she]53-tant ' sannie and [he]67-bonaparte sat so happily together in the evening drinking coffee , [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte telling [her]53-tant ' sannie in the broken Dutch [he]67-bonaparte was fast learning how [he]67-bonaparte adored [fat women]771-fat women , and what [a splendid farmer]1071-a splendid farmer [he]67-bonaparte was .

So at five o'clock on this afternoon [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte knelt in [[the German]281-the german 's room]1013-the german 's room .

" Somewhere , here it is , "[67-bonaparte] [he]67-bonaparte said , as [he]67-bonaparte packed the old clothes carefully out of the box , and , finding nothing , packed them in again . " Somewhere in [this room]3873-this room it is ; and if it 's here [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte finds it , "[67-bonaparte] [he]67-bonaparte repeated . " [You]1074-my lamb did n't stay [here]3430-here all these years without making a little pile[67-bonaparte]

somewhere , [[my]0-i lamb]1074-my lamb . [You]1074-my lamb were n't such [a fool]709-a fool as [you]1074-my lamb looked . Oh , no ! " said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte .[67-bonaparte]

[He]67-bonaparte now walked about [the room]215-the room , diving [his]67-bonaparte fingers in everywhere : sticking them into the great crevices in the wall and frightening out the spiders ; rapping them against the old plaster till it cracked and fell in pieces ; peering up the chimney , till the soot dropped on [his]67-bonaparte bald head and blackened it . [He]67-bonaparte felt in little bags ; [he]67-bonaparte tried to raise the hearth stone ; [he]67-bonaparte shook each book , till the old leaves fell down in showers on the floor .

It was getting dark , and [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte stood with [his]67-bonaparte finger on [his]67-bonaparte nose reflecting . Finally [he]67-bonaparte walked to the door , behind which hung the trousers and waistcoat [the dead man]1055-the dead man had last worn . [He]67-bonaparte had felt in them but hurriedly just after the funeral the day before ; [he]67-bonaparte would examine them again . Sticking [his]67-bonaparte fingers into the waistcoat pockets , [he]67-bonaparte found in one corner a hole . Pressing [his]67-bonaparte hand through it , between the

lining and the cloth , [he]67-bonaparte presently came into contact with something . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte drew it forth a small , square parcel , sewed up in sail - cloth . [He]67-bonaparte gazed at it , squeezed it ; it cracked , as though full of bank notes . [He]67-bonaparte put it quickly into [his]67-bonaparte own waistcoat pocket , and peeped over the half - door to see if there was [no one]237-no one coming . Then [he]67-bonaparte sat down on the nearest chair , and taking out [his]67-bonaparte pen - knife , ripped it open . The first thing that fell was a shower of yellow , faded papers . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte opened them carefully one by one , and smoothed them out on [his]67-bonaparte knee . They were certainly something very valuable to be hidden so carefully , though the German characters [he]67-bonaparte could not decipher . When [he]67-bonaparte came to the last one , [he]67-bonaparte felt there was something hard in it .

" [You]67-bonaparte 've got it , [Bon]85-bon , [[my]67-bonaparte boy]3810-my boy ! [you]67-bonaparte 've got it ! "[67-bonaparte] [he]67-bonaparte cried , slapping [his]67-bonaparte leg hard . Edging nearer to the door , for the light was fading , [he]67-bonaparte opened it carefully . There was nothing inside but a plain gold wedding - ring .

" Better than nothing ! "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , trying to put it on [his]67-bonaparte little finger , which , however , proved too fat . [He]67-bonaparte took it off and set it down on the table before [him]67-bonaparte , and looked at it with [his]67-bonaparte crosswise eyes .

" When that auspicious hour , [Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , "[67-bonaparte] [he]67-bonaparte said , " shall have arrived , when , panting , [I]67-bonaparte shall lead [thee]53-tant ' sannie , lighted by [Hymen]118-hymen 's torch , to the connubial altar , then upon [thy]53-tant ' sannie fair amaranthine finger , [[my]67-bonaparte joyous bride]3876-my joyous bride , shall this ring repose .[67-bonaparte]

" [Thy]53-tant ' sannie fair body , oh , [[my]67-bonaparte girl]3877-my girl , Shall [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte possess ; [His]67-bonaparte fingers in [thy]53-tant ' sannie money - bags , [He]67-bonaparte therein , too , shall mess . "[67-bonaparte]

Having given utterance to this flood of poesy , [he]67-bonaparte sat lost in joyous reflection .

" [He]67-bonaparte therein , too , shall mess , "[67-bonaparte] [he]67-bonaparte repeated meditatively .

At this instant , as [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte swore , and swore truly , to the end of [his]67-bonaparte life , a slow and distinct rap was given on the crown of [his]67-bonaparte bald head .

[Bonaparte]67-bonaparte started and looked up . No " reim , "[59-lyndall] or strap hung down from the rafters above , and [not a human creature]1079-not a human creature was near the door . It was growing dark ; [he]67-bonaparte did not like it . [He]67-bonaparte began to fold up the papers expeditiously . [He]67-bonaparte stretched out [his]67-bonaparte hand for the ring . The ring was gone ! Gone , although [no human creature]1080-no human creature had entered [the room]215-the room ; gone , although no form had crossed the doorway . Gone ! [He]67-bonaparte would not sleep there , that was certain . [He]67-bonaparte stuffed the papers into [his]67-bonaparte pocket . As [he]67-bonaparte did so , three slow and distinct taps were given on the crown of [his]67-bonaparte head . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte 's jaw fell : [each separate joint]1082-each separate joint lost its power : [he]67-bonaparte could not move ; [he]67-bonaparte dared not rise ; [his]67-bonaparte tongue lay loose in [his]67-bonaparte mouth . " Take all , take all ! "[59-lyndall] [he]67-bonaparte gurgled in [his]67-bonaparte throat . " [I]59-lyndall [I]59-lyndall do not want them . Take "[59-lyndall]

Here a resolute tug at the grey curls at the back of [his]67-bonaparte head caused [him]67-bonaparte to leap up , yelling wildly . Was [he]67-bonaparte to sit still paralyzed , to be

dragged away bodily to the devil ? With terrific shrieks [he]67-bonaparte fled , casting no glance behind .

When the dew was falling , and the evening was dark , [a small figure]1083-a small figure moved toward the gate of [the furthest ostrich camp]1084-the furthest ostrich camp , driving a bird before [it]1083-a small figure . When the gate was opened and [the bird driven in]1085-the bird driven in turned away , but then suddenly paused . " Is that [you]234-the boy , [Waldo]60-waldo ? "[234-the boy] said [Lyndall]59-lyndall . [The boy]234-the boy was sitting on [the damp ground]1087-the damp ground with [his]234-the boy back to the wall . [He]234-the boy gave [her]59-lyndall no answer . " Come , "[59-lyndall] [she]59-lyndall said , bending over [him]234-the boy , " [I]59-lyndall have been looking for [you]234-the boy all day . "[59-lyndall] [He]234-the boy mumbled something . " [You]234-the boy have had nothing to eat . [I]59-lyndall have put some supper in [[your]234-the boy room]3530-your room . [You]234-the boy must come [home]302-home with [me]59-lyndall , [Waldo]60-waldo . "[59-lyndall] [She]59-lyndall took [his]234-the boy hand , and [the boy]234-the boy rose slowly . [She]59-lyndall made [him]234-the boy take [her]59-lyndall arm , and twisted [her]59-lyndall small fingers among [his]234-the boy .

" [You]234-the boy must forget , "[59-lyndall] [she]59-lyndall whispered . " Since it happened [I]59-lyndall walk , [I]59-lyndall talk , [I]59-lyndall never sit still . If [we]3880-we remember , [we]3880-we can not bring back the dead . "[59-lyndall] [She]59-lyndall knit [her]59-lyndall little fingers closer among [his]234-the boy . " Forgetting is the best thing . [He]234-the boy did not watch it coming , "[59-lyndall] [she]59-lyndall whispered presently . " That is the dreadful thing , to see it coming ! "[234-the boy] [She]59-lyndall shuddered . " [I]234-the boy want it to come suddenly to [me]234-the boy too . Why do [you]234-the boy think [I]234-the boy was driving that bird ? "[234-the boy] [she]59-lyndall added quickly . " That was [Hans]68-hans , the bird that hates [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . [I]234-the boy let [him]68-hans out this afternoon ; [I]234-the boy thought [he]68-hans would chase [him]68-hans and perhaps kill [him]68-hans . "[234-the boy] [The boy]234-the boy showed no sign of interest . " [He]68-hans did n't ; but [he]68-hans put [his]68-hans head over the half door of [[your]234-the boy cabin]3881-your cabin and frightened [him]68-hans horribly . [He]68-hans was there busy stealing [your]234-the boy things . Perhaps [he]68-hans will leave them alone now ; but [I]1092-i wish the bird had trodden on [him]68-hans . "[1092-i] [They]1090-they said no more till [they]1090-they reached the door of [the cabin]460-the cabin .

" There is a candle and supper on the table .[234-the boy]

[You]234-the boy must eat , " [she]1093-she said authoritatively . "[234-the boy] [I]0-i can not stay with [you]234-the boy now , lest [they]1092-i find out about the bird . "[234-the boy]

[He]234-the boy grasped [her]1093-she arm and brought [his]234-the boy mouth close to [her]1093-she ear . " There is [no God]3882-no god ! "[1093-she] [he]234-the boy almost hissed ; " no [God]56-god , not anywhere ! "[59-lyndall] [She]1093-she started . " Not anywhere ! "[67-bonaparte] [He]234-the boy ground it out between [his]234-the boy teeth , and [she]1093-she felt [his]234-the boy hot breath on [her]1093-she cheek . " [Waldo]60-waldo , [you]234-the boy are mad , "[67-bonaparte] [she]1093-she said , drawing [herself]1093-she from [him]234-the boy . [He]234-the boy loosened [his]234-the boy grasp and turned away from [her]1093-she also . In truth , it is life 's way . [We]1094-we fight [our]1094-we little battles alone ; [you]1095-you yours , [I]0-i mine . [We]1094-we are not to help or find help . When [your]1095-you life is most real , [you]1095-you seem to [me]0-i mad ; when [your]1095-you agony is greatest [I]0-i look at [you]1095-you and wonder . Friendship is good , but it is a delusion .

[Lyndall]59-lyndall stood by [him]234-the boy in the dark , pityingly , wonderingly . As [he]234-the boy walked to the door [she]59-lyndall ran after [him]234-the boy . " Eat [your]234-the boy supper ; it will do [you]234-the boy good , "[53-tant ' sannie] [she]59-lyndall said . [She]59-lyndall pressed [his]234-the boy hand and then ran away . In [the front room]1096-the front room [the little woolly Kaffir girl]1097-the little woolly kaffir girl was washing [Tant]53-tant ' sannie ' [Sannie]53-tant ' sannie 's feet in a small tub , and [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , who sat on the wooden sofa , was pulling off [his]67-bonaparte shoes and stockings that [his]67-bonaparte own feet might be washed also . There were three candles burning in [the room]215-the room , and [he]67-bonaparte and [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie sat close together , with [the lean Hottentot not far off]1099-the lean hottentot not far off ; for when ghosts are about there is great strength in numbers . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte had completely recovered from the effects of [his]67-bonaparte fright in the afternoon , and the numerous doses of brandy that it had been necessary to administer to [him]67-bonaparte to effect [his]67-bonaparte restoration had put [him]67-bonaparte into a singularly pleasant and amiable mood .

" [That boy Waldo]60-waldo , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , rubbing

[his]67-bonaparte toes , " took [himself]60-waldo off coolly this morning as soon as the waggon came , and has not done a stiver of work all day . [I]53-tant ' sannie 'll not have that kind of thing now [I]53-tant ' sannie 'm [master of [this farm]3442-this farm]3883-master of this farm . "[53-tant ' sannie]

[The Hottentot maid]737-the hottentot maid translated . " Ah , [I]53-tant ' sannie expect [he]60-waldo 's sorry that [[his]60-waldo father]235-his father 's dead , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie . " It 's nature , [you]67-bonaparte know . [I]53-tant ' sannie cried the whole morning when [[my]53-tant ' sannie father]3420-my father died . [One]324-one can always get [another husband]3888-another husband , but [one]324-one ca n't get [another father]3890-another father , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , casting a sidelong glance at [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte expressed a wish to give [Waldo]60-waldo [his]67-bonaparte orders for the next day 's work , and [the little woolly - headed [Kaffir]110-kaffir]1101-the little woolly - headed kaffir was sent to call [him]60-waldo . After some time [he]60-waldo appeared , and stood in the doorway .

If [they]1102-they had dressed [him]60-waldo in one of the swallow - tailed coats , and oiled [his]60-waldo hair till the drops fell from it , and it lay as smooth as [an elder]1103-an elder 's on sacrament Sunday , there would still have been something unanointed in the aspect of [the

fellow]400-the fellow . As it was , standing there in [his]60-waldo strange old costume , [his]60-waldo head presenting much the appearance of having been deeply rolled in sand , [his]60-waldo eyelids swollen , the hair hanging over [his]60-waldo forehead , and a dogged sullenness on [his]60-waldo features , [he]60-waldo presented most the appearance of an ill - conditioned young buffalo .

" [Beloved Lord]119-beloved lord , "[53-tant ' sannie] cried [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , " how [he]60-waldo looks ! Come in , [boy]3767-boy . Could n't [you]3767-boy come and say good - day to [me]234-the boy ? Do n't [you]3767-boy want some supper ? "[234-the boy] [He]60-waldo said [he]60-waldo wanted nothing , and turned [his]60-waldo heavy eyes away from [her]53-tant ' sannie . " There 's a ghost been seen in [[[your]3767-boy father]3433-your father 's room]3893-your father 's room , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie . " If [you]3767-boy 're afraid [you]3767-boy can sleep in [the kitchen]798-the kitchen . "[53-tant ' sannie] " [I]53-tant ' sannie will sleep in [[our]3895-our room]3896-our room , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [the boy]234-the boy slowly . " Well , [you]3767-boy can go now , "[67-bonaparte] [she]53-tant ' sannie said ; " but be up early to take the sheep . The herd "[67-bonaparte]

" Yes , be up early , [[my]67-bonaparte boy]3810-my boy , "[67-bonaparte] interrupted

[Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , smiling . " [I]53-tant ' sannie am to be [master of [this farm]3442-this farm]3883-master of this farm now ; and [we]3895-our shall be [good friends]3900-good friends , [I]53-tant ' sannie trust , [very good friends]3901-very good friends , if [you]3810-my boy try to do [your]3810-my boy duty , [[my]53-tant ' sannie dear boy]3866-my dear boy . "[53-tant ' sannie]

[Waldo]60-waldo turned to go , and [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , looking benignly at the candle , stretched out one unstockinged foot , over which [Waldo]60-waldo , looking at nothing in particular , fell with a heavy thud upon the floor . " Dear [me]53-tant ' sannie ! [I]53-tant ' sannie hope [you]3810-my boy are not hurt , [[my]53-tant ' sannie boy]3810-my boy , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . " [You]3810-my boy 'll have many a harder thing than that though , before [you]3810-my boy 've got all [you]3810-my boy will get , "[53-tant ' sannie] [he]67-bonaparte added consolingly , as [Waldo]60-waldo picked [himself]60-waldo up . [The lean Hottentot]98-the hottentot laughed till [the room]215-the room rang again ; and [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie tittered till [her]53-tant ' sannie sides ached . When [he]67-bonaparte had gone [the little maid]1107-the little maid began to wash [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte 's feet .

" Oh , [Lord]3904-lord , [beloved Lord]3905-beloved lord , how [he]67-bonaparte did fall ! [I]67-bonaparte ca n't think of it , "[67-bonaparte] cried [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , and [she]53-tant ' sannie

laughed again . " [I]67-bonaparte always did know [he]67-bonaparte was not right ; but this evening [any one]504-any one could see it , "[67-bonaparte] [she]53-tant ' sannie added , wiping the tears of mirth from [her]53-tant ' sannie face . " [His]67-bonaparte eyes are as wild as if the devil was in them . [He]67-bonaparte never was like [other children]3907-other children . [The dear Lord]3742-the dear lord knows , if [he]67-bonaparte does n't walk alone for hours talking to [himself]67-bonaparte . If [you]67-bonaparte sit in [the room]215-the room with [him]67-bonaparte [you]67-bonaparte can see [his]67-bonaparte lips moving the whole time ; and if [you]67-bonaparte talk to [him]67-bonaparte twenty times [he]67-bonaparte does n't hear [you]67-bonaparte . Daft - eyes ; [he]67-bonaparte 's as mad as mad can be . "[67-bonaparte]

This repetition of the word mad conveyed meaning to [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte 's mind . [He]67-bonaparte left off paddling [his]67-bonaparte toes in the water .

" [Mad]120-mad , mad ? [I]67-bonaparte know that kind of mad , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , " and [I]67-bonaparte know the thing to give for it . The front end of a little horse - whip , the tip ! Nice thing ; takes it out , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte .

[The Hottentot]98-the hottentot laughed , and translated .

" No more walking about and talking to [themselves]98-the hottentot on [this farm]3442-this farm now , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte ; " no[67-bonaparte]

more minding of sheep and reading of books at the same time . The point of a horsewhip is a little thing , but [I]0-i think [he]67-bonaparte 'll have a taste of it before long . " [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , rubbing [his]67-bonaparte hands and looking pleasantly across [his]67-bonaparte nose ; and then [the three]3911-the three laughed together grimly .[67-bonaparte]

And [Waldo]60-waldo in [[his]60-waldo cabin]954-his cabin crouched in the dark in a corner , with [his]60-waldo knees drawn up to [his]60-waldo chin .

CHAPTER X. [HE]60-waldo SHOWS [HIS]60-waldo TEETH .

[DOSS]70-doss sat among the karroo - bushes , one yellow ear drawn over [his]70-doss wicked little eye , ready to flap away any adventurous fly that might settle on [his]70-doss nose . Around [him]70-doss in the morning sunlight fed the sheep ; behind [him]70-doss lay [[his]70-doss master]361-his master polishing [his]361-his master machine . [He]70-doss found much comfort in handling it that morning . A dozen philosophical essays , or angelically attuned songs for the consolation of [the bereaved]1110-the bereaved , could never have been to [him]70-doss what [that little sheep - shearing machine]1111-that little sheep - shearing machine was that day .

After struggling to see the unseeable , growing drunk with the endeavour to span the infinite , and writhing before the inscrutable mystery , it

is a renovating relief to turn to some simple , feelable , weighable substance ; to something which has a smell and a colour , which may be handled and turned over this way and that . Whether there be or be not a hereafter , whether there be any use in calling aloud to the Unseen power , whether there be an Unseen power to call to , whatever be the true nature of the [I]0-i who call and of the objects around [me]0-i , whatever be [our]1112-our meaning , [our]1112-our internal essence , [our]1112-our cause and in a certain [order of minds death and the agony of loss]1113-order of minds death and the agony of loss inevitably awaken the wild desire , at other times smothered , to look into these things , whatever be the nature of that which lies beyond the unbroken wall which the limits of [the human intellect]1114-the human intellect build up on every hand , this thing is certain a knife will cut wood , and one cogged wheel will turn another . This is sure .

[Waldo]60-waldo found an immeasurable satisfaction in the handling of [his]60-waldo machine ; but [Doss]70-doss winked and blinked , and thought it all frightfully

monotonous out there on [the flat]616-the flat , and presently dropped asleep , sitting bolt upright . Suddenly [his]60-waldo eyes opened wide ; something was coming from the direction of [the homestead]201-the homestead . Winking [his]60-waldo eyes and looking intently , [he]60-waldo perceived it was [the grey mare]1117-the grey mare . Now [Doss]70-doss had wondered much of late what had become of [[her]1117-the grey mare master]1118-her master . Seeing [she]1117-the grey mare carried some one on [her]1117-the grey mare back , [he]60-waldo now came to [his]60-waldo own conclusion , and began to move [his]60-waldo tail violently up and down . Presently [he]60-waldo pricked up one ear and let the other hang ; [his]60-waldo tail became motionless , and the expression of [his]60-waldo mouth one of decided disapproval bordering on scorn . [He]60-waldo wrinkled [his]60-waldo lips up on each side into little lines .

[The sand]287-the sand was soft , and [the grey mare]1117-the grey mare came on so noiselessly that [the boy]234-the boy heard nothing till [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte dismounted . Then [Doss]70-doss got up and moved back a step . [He]70-doss did not approve of [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte 's appearance . [His]67-bonaparte costume , in truth , was of a unique kind . It was a combination of

[the town]612-the town and [country]1123-country . The tails of [his]67-bonaparte black cloth coat were pinned up behind to keep them from rubbing ; [he]67-bonaparte had on a pair of moleskin trousers and leathern gaiters , and in [his]67-bonaparte hand [he]67-bonaparte carried a little whip of rhinoceros hide .

[Waldo]60-waldo started and looked up . Had there been a moment 's time [he]60-waldo would have dug a hole in the sand with [his]60-waldo hands and buried [his]60-waldo treasure . It was only a poor toy of wood , but [he]60-waldo loved it , as one of necessity loves what has been born of [him]60-waldo . " What have [you]234-the boy here , [[my]67-bonaparte lad]3912-my lad ? "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , standing by [him]60-waldo , and pointing with the end of [his]67-bonaparte whip to the medley of wheels and hinges . [The boy]234-the boy muttered something inaudible , and half - spread over the thing . " But this seems to be a very ingenious little machine , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , seating [himself]67-bonaparte on the ant - heap , and bending down over it with deep interest . " What is it for , [[my]67-bonaparte lad]3912-my lad ? "[67-bonaparte]

" [Shearing sheep]3914-shearing sheep . "[67-bonaparte] " It is a very nice little machine , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . " How does it work , now ? [I]234-the boy have never seen anything so ingenious ! "[234-the boy] There was never [a parent]1125-a parent who heard deception in the voice that praised [[his]60-waldo child]1126-his child [[his]60-waldo first - born]1127-his first - born . Here was one who liked the thing that had been created in [him]60-waldo . [He]60-waldo forgot everything . [He]60-waldo showed how the shears would work with a little guidance , how the sheep would be held , and the wool fall into the trough . A flush burst over [his]60-waldo face as [he]60-waldo spoke .

" [I]234-the boy tell [you]234-the boy what , [[my]234-the boy lad]3912-my lad , "[234-the boy] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte emphatically , when the explanation was finished , " [we]3916-we must get [you]234-the boy a patent . [Your]234-the boy fortune is made . In three years ' time there 'll not be [a farm in [this colony]3918-this colony where it is n't working]3917-a farm in this colony where it is n't working . [You]234-the boy 're [a genius]3919-a genius , that 's what [you]234-the boy are ! "[234-the boy] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , rising .

" If it were made larger , "[67-bonaparte] said [the boy]234-the boy quickly , " it would work more smoothly . Do [you]67-bonaparte think[67-bonaparte]

there would be [any one in [this colony]3918-this colony]1129-any one in this colony would be able to make it ? "[234-the boy]

" [I]67-bonaparte 'm sure [they]1129-any one in this colony could , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte ; " and if not , why [I]67-bonaparte 'll do [my]67-bonaparte best for [you]234-the boy . [I]67-bonaparte 'll send it to [England]15-england . It must be done somehow . How long have [you]67-bonaparte worked at [it]3920-it ? "[67-bonaparte] " Nine months , "[67-bonaparte] said [the boy]234-the boy .

" Oh , it is such a nice little machine , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , " one ca n't help feeling an interest in it . There is only one little improvement , one very little improvement [I]67-bonaparte should like to make . "[67-bonaparte]

[Bonaparte]67-bonaparte put [his]67-bonaparte foot on the machine and crushed it into the sand . [The boy]234-the boy looked up into [his]67-bonaparte face . " Looks better now , "[54-em] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , " does n't it ? If [we]3921-we ca n't have it made in [England]15-england [we]3921-we 'll send it to [America]26-america . Good - bye ; ta - ta , "[60-waldo] [he]67-bonaparte added . " [You]234-the boy 're [a great genius]3922-a great genius , [a born genius]3923-a born genius , [[my]1140-she dear boy]3866-my dear boy , there 's no doubt about it . "[1140-she]

[He]67-bonaparte mounted the grey mare and rode off .

[The dog]1133-the dog watched [his]67-bonaparte retreat with cynical satisfaction ; but [[his]67-bonaparte master]361-his master lay on the ground with [his]361-his master head on [his]361-his master arms in [the sand]287-the sand , and the little wheels and chips of wood lay on the ground around [him]361-his master . The dog jumped on to [his]67-bonaparte back and snapped at the black curls , till , finding that no notice was taken , [he]67-bonaparte walked off to play with a black beetle . The beetle was hard at work trying to roll home a great ball of dung it had been collecting all the morning : but [Doss]70-doss broke the ball , and ate the beetle 's hind legs , and then bit off its head . And it was all play , and [no one]237-no one could tell what [it]1137-it had lived and worked for . A striving , and a striving , and an ending in nothing .

[CHAPTER XI]121-chapter xi . [HE]70-doss SNAPS .

" [I]1140-she HAVE found something in [the loft]205-the loft , "[1140-she] said [Em]54-em to [Waldo]60-waldo , who was listlessly piling cakes of fuel on the kraal wall , a week after [[his]60-waldo father]235-his father 's death . " It is a box of books that belonged to [[my]234-the boy father]3420-my father . [We]3927-we thought [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie had burnt them . "[234-the boy]

[The boy]234-the boy put down the cake [he]234-the boy was raising and looked at [her]1140-she . " [I]1165-men to whom not only kopjes and stones do n't think they are very nice , not stories , "[1165-men to whom not only kopjes and stones] [she]1140-she added , " but [you]234-the boy can go and take any [you]234-the boy choose . "[67-bonaparte] So saying , [she]1140-she took up the plate in which [she]1140-she had brought [his]234-the boy breakfast , and walked off to [the house]206-the house .

After that [the boy]234-the boy worked quickly . The pile

of fuel [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte had ordered [him]234-the boy to pack was on the wall in half an hour . [He]234-the boy then went to throw salt on the skins laid out to dry . Finding the pot empty , [he]234-the boy went to [the loft]205-the loft to refill it .

[Bonaparte Blenkins]67-bonaparte , whose door opened at the foot of the ladder , saw [the boy]234-the boy go up , and stood in the doorway waiting for [his]234-the boy return . [He]234-the boy wanted [his]234-the boy boots blacked . [Doss]70-doss , finding [he]70-doss could not follow [[his]70-doss master]361-his master up the round bars , sat patiently at the foot of the ladder . Presently [he]70-doss looked up longingly , but [no one]237-no one appeared . Then [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte looked up also , and began to call ; but there was no answer . What could [the boy]234-the boy be doing ? [The loft]205-the loft was [an unknown land]1149-an unknown land to [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . [He]67-bonaparte had often wondered what was up [there]317-there ; [he]67-bonaparte liked to know what was in all locked - up places and [out - of - the - way corners]1151-out - of - the - way corners , but the ladder [he]67-bonaparte could not scale . So [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte looked up , and in the name of all that was tantalizing , questioned what [the boy]234-the boy did up there . [The loft]205-the loft was used only as [a lumber-

room]1154-a lumber- room . What could [the fellow]400-the fellow find up [there]317-there to keep [him]67-bonaparte so long .

Could [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman have beheld [Waldo]60-waldo at that instant , any lingering doubt which might have remained in [her]214-the boer - woman mind as to [the boy]234-the boy 's insanity would instantly have vanished . For , having filled the salt - pot , [he]67-bonaparte proceeded to look for the box of books among the rubbish that filled [the loft]205-the loft . Under a pile of sacks [he]67-bonaparte found it a rough packing - case , nailed up , but with one loose plank . [He]67-bonaparte lifted that , and saw the even backs of a row of books . [He]67-bonaparte knelt down before the box , and ran [his]67-bonaparte hand along its rough edges , as if to assure [himself]67-bonaparte of its existence . [He]67-bonaparte stuck [his]67-bonaparte hand in among the books , and pulled out two . [He]67-bonaparte felt them , thrust [his]67-bonaparte fingers in among the leaves , and crumpled them a little , as [a lover]1160-a lover feels the hair of [[his]1160-a lover mistress]1161-his mistress . [The fellow]400-the fellow gloated over [his]67-bonaparte treasure . [He]67-bonaparte had had a dozen books in the course of [his]67-bonaparte life ; now here was a mine of them opened at [his]67-bonaparte feet .

After a while [he]67-bonaparte began to read the titles , and now and again opened a book and read a sentence ; but [he]67-bonaparte was too excited to catch the meanings distinctly . At last [he]67-bonaparte came to a dull , brown volume . [He]67-bonaparte read the name , opened it in the centre , and where [he]67-bonaparte opened began to read . ' Twas a chapter on property that [he]67-bonaparte fell upon [Communism]122-communism , Fourierism , [St. Simonism]27-st. simonism , in a work on Political Economy . [He]67-bonaparte read down one page and turned over to the next ; [he]67-bonaparte read down that without changing [his]67-bonaparte posture by an inch ; [he]67-bonaparte read the next , and the next , kneeling up all the while with the book in [his]67-bonaparte hand , and [his]67-bonaparte lips parted .

All [he]67-bonaparte read [he]67-bonaparte did not fully understand ; the thoughts were new to [him]67-bonaparte ; but this was [the fellow]400-the fellow 's startled joy in the book the thoughts were [his]67-bonaparte , they belonged to [him]67-bonaparte . [He]67-bonaparte had never thought them before , but they were [his]67-bonaparte . [He]67-bonaparte laughed silently and internally , with the still intensity of triumphant joy .

So , then , [all thinking creatures]1164-all thinking creatures did not send up the one cry " As [thou]3928-thou , [dear Lord]3527-dear lord , has created things in the beginning , so are [they]1164-all thinking creatures now , so ought [they]1164-all thinking creatures to be , so will [they]1164-all thinking creatures be , world without end ; and it does n't concern [us]3930-us what [they]1164-all thinking creatures are . Amen . "[67-bonaparte] There were [men to whom not only kopjes and stones]1165-men to whom not only kopjes and stones were calling out imperatively , " What are [we]3930-us , and how came [we]3930-us here ? Understand [us]3930-us , and know [us]3930-us ; "[234-the boy] but to whom even the old , old relations between [man]329-man and [man]329-man , and the customs of the ages called , and could not be made still and forgotten .

[The boy]234-the boy 's heavy body quivered with excitement . So [he]67-bonaparte was not alone , not alone . [He]67-bonaparte could not quite have told [any one]504-any one why [he]67-bonaparte was so glad , and this warmth had come to [him]67-bonaparte . [His]67-bonaparte cheeks were burning . No wonder that [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte called in vain , and [Doss]70-doss put [his]70-doss paws on the ladder , and whined till three quarters of an hour had passed . At last [the boy]234-the boy put the book in [his]234-the boy breast and buttoned it tightly to [him]234-the boy .

[He]234-the boy took up the salt - pot , and went to the top of the ladder . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , with [his]67-bonaparte hands folded under [his]67-bonaparte coat - tails , looked up when [he]67-bonaparte appeared , and accosted [him]234-the boy .

" [You]234-the boy 've been rather a long time up there , [[my]67-bonaparte lad]3912-my lad , "[67-bonaparte] [he]67-bonaparte said , as [the boy]234-the boy descended with a tremulous haste , most unlike [his]234-the boy ordinary slow movements . " [You]234-the boy did n't hear [me]67-bonaparte calling , [I]67-bonaparte suppose ? "[67-bonaparte]

[Bonaparte]67-bonaparte whisked the tails of [his]67-bonaparte coat up and down as [he]67-bonaparte looked at [him]234-the boy . [He]67-bonaparte , [Bonaparte Blenkins]67-bonaparte , had eyes which were very far - seeing . [He]67-bonaparte looked at the pot . It was rather a small pot to have taken three - quarters of an hour in the filling . [He]67-bonaparte looked at the face . It was flushed . And yet , [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie kept no wine [he]67-bonaparte had not been drinking ; [his]67-bonaparte eyes were wide open and bright [he]67-bonaparte had not been sleeping ; there was [no girl]1172-no girl up [there]317-there [he]67-bonaparte had not been making love . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte looked at [him]234-the boy sagaciously . What would account for the marvellous change in [the

boy]234-the boy coming down the ladder from [the boy]234-the boy going up the ladder ? One thing there was . Did not [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie keep in [the loft]205-the loft " bultongs , "[67-bonaparte] and nice smoked sausages ? There must be something nice to eat up there ! Aha ! that was it !

[Bonaparte]67-bonaparte was so interested in carrying out this chain of inductive reasoning that [he]67-bonaparte quite forgot to have [his]67-bonaparte boots blacked . [He]67-bonaparte watched [the boy]234-the boy shuffle off with the salt - pot under [his]67-bonaparte arm ; then [he]67-bonaparte stood in [his]67-bonaparte doorway and raised [his]67-bonaparte eyes to the quiet blue sky , and audibly propounded this riddle to [himself]67-bonaparte : " What is the connection between the naked back of [a certain boy]3932-a certain boy with a great coat on and a salt - pot under [his]3932-a certain boy arm , and the tip of a horsewhip ? Answer : No connection at present , but there will be soon . "[67-bonaparte] [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte was so pleased with this sally of [his]67-bonaparte wit that [he]67-bonaparte chuckled a little , and went to lie down on [his]67-bonaparte bed .

There was bread - baking that afternoon , and

there was a fire lighted in the brick oven behind [the house]206-the house , and [[Tant]53-tant ' sannie ' [Sannie]53-tant ' sannie]1179-tant ' sannie had left the great wooden - elbowed chair in which [she]1179-tant ' sannie passed [her]1179-tant ' sannie life , and waddled out to look at [it]1180-it . Not far off was [Waldo]60-waldo , who , having thrown a pail of food into the pig - sty , now leaned over the sod - wall looking at the pigs . Half of [the sty]1181-the sty was dry , but the lower half was a pool of mud , on the edge of which [the mother sow]1182-the mother sow lay with closed eyes , [her]1182-the mother sow ten little ones sucking ; [the father pig]1183-the father pig , knee - deep in the mud , stood running [his]1183-the father pig snout into a rotten pumpkin and wriggling [his]1183-the father pig curled tail .

[Waldo]60-waldo wondered dreamily as [he]60-waldo stared why [they]1184-they were pleasant to look at . Taken singly [they]1184-they were not beautiful ; taken together they were . Was it not because there was a certain harmony about [them]1184-they ? [The old sow]1185-the old sow was suited to the little pigs , and the little pigs to [[their]1184-they mother]1186-their mother , the old boar to the rotten pumpkin , and all to the mud . [They]1184-they suggested the thought of

nothing that should be added , of nothing that should be taken away . And , [he]60-waldo wondered on vaguely , was not that the secret of all beauty , that [you]1187-you who look on . So [he]60-waldo stood dreaming , and leaned further and further over the sod - wall , and looked at the pigs .

All this time [Bonaparte Blenkins]67-bonaparte was sloping down from [the house]206-the house in an aimless sort of way ; but [he]67-bonaparte kept one eye fixed on [the pig - sty]1189-the pig - sty , and each gyration brought [him]67-bonaparte nearer to it . [Waldo]60-waldo stood like a thing asleep when [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte came close up to [him]60-waldo .

In old days , when [a small boy]1190-a small boy , playing in [an Irish street - gutter]1191-an irish street - gutter , [he]1190-a small boy , [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , had been familiarly known among [[his]1190-a small boy comrades]1192-his comrades under the title of Tripping - [Ben]123-ben ; this from the rare ease and dexterity with which , by merely projecting [his]1190-a small boy foot , [he]1190-a small boy could precipitate [any unfortunate companion]1193-any unfortunate companion on to the crown of [his]1190-a small boy head . Years had elapsed , and [Tripping - Ben]123-ben had become [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte ; but the old gift was in [him]67-bonaparte still . [He]67-bonaparte

came close to [the pig - sty]1189-the pig - sty . All the defunct memories of [[his]67-bonaparte boyhood]1195-his boyhood returned on [him]67-bonaparte in a flood , as , with an adroit movement , [he]67-bonaparte inserted [his]67-bonaparte leg between [Waldo]60-waldo and the wall , and sent [him]60-waldo over into the pig - sty .

The little pigs were startled at [the strange intruder]1196-the strange intruder , and ran behind [[their]1197-their mother]1186-their mother , who sniffed at [him]67-bonaparte . [Tant]53-tant ' sannie ' [Sannie]53-tant ' sannie smote [her]53-tant ' sannie hands together and laughed ; but [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte was far from joining [her]53-tant ' sannie . Lost in reverie , [he]67-bonaparte gazed at the distant horizon . The sudden reversal of head and feet had thrown out the volume that [Waldo]60-waldo carried in [his]60-waldo breast . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte picked it up , and began to inspect it , as [the boy]234-the boy climbed slowly over the wall . [He]67-bonaparte would have walked off sullenly , but [he]67-bonaparte wanted [his]67-bonaparte book , and [he]67-bonaparte waited until it should be given [him]67-bonaparte .

" Ha ! "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , raising [his]67-bonaparte eyes from the leaves of the book which [he]67-bonaparte was examining . " [I]53-tant ' sannie hope [your]234-the boy coat has not been injured ; it is of[53-tant ' sannie]

an elegant cut . An heirloom , [I]0-i presume , from [[your]234-the boy paternal grandfather]1200-your paternal grandfather ? It looks nice now . "[67-bonaparte]

" Oh , [Lord]3933-lord ! oh ! [Lord]3933-lord ! "[67-bonaparte] cried [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , laughing and holding [her]53-tant ' sannie sides ; " how [the child]3411-the child looks as though [he]3411-the child thought the mud would never wash off . Oh , [Lord]3933-lord , [I]53-tant ' sannie shall die ! [You]67-bonaparte , [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , are [the funniest man [I]53-tant ' sannie ever saw]3937-the funniest man i ever saw . "[53-tant ' sannie]

[Bonaparte Blenkins]67-bonaparte was now carefully inspecting the volume [he]67-bonaparte had picked up . Among the subjects on which the darkness of [his]67-bonaparte understanding had been enlightened during [his]67-bonaparte youth , Political Economy had not been one . [He]67-bonaparte was not , therefore , very clear as to what the nature of the book might be ; and as the name of [the writer]1201-the writer , [J.S. Mill]124-j.s. mill , might , for anything [he]67-bonaparte knew to the contrary , have belonged to [a venerable member of the British and Foreign Bible Society]1202-a venerable member of the british and foreign bible society , it by no means threw light upon the question . [He]67-bonaparte was not in any way sure that Political

Economy had nothing to do with the cheapest way of procuring clothing for [the army]1203-the army and navy , which would be certainly both a political and economical subject .

But [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte soon came to a conclusion as to the nature of the book and its contents , by the application of a simple rule now largely acted upon , but which , becoming universal , would save much thought and valuable time . It is of marvellous simplicity , of infinite utility , of universal applicability . It may easily be committed to memory and runs thus :

Whenever [you]1204-you come into contact with any book , [person]1205-person , or opinion of which [you]1204-you absolutely comprehend nothing , declare that book , person or opinion to be immoral . Bespatter it , vituperate against it , strongly insist that [any man]1206-any man or woman harbouring it is [a fool]709-a fool or [a knave]1208-a knave , or both . Carefully abstain from studying it . Do all that in [you]1204-you lies to annihilate that book , person , or opinion .

Acting on this rule , so wide in its

comprehen- comprehensiveness

siveness , so beautifully simple in its working , [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte approached [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie with the book in [his]67-bonaparte hand . [Waldo]60-waldo came a step nearer , eyeing [it]53-tant ' sannie like a dog whose young has fallen into evil hands .

" This book , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , " is not a fit and proper study for [a young and immature mind]3938-a young and immature mind . "[67-bonaparte] [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie did not understand a word , and said , " What ? "[53-tant ' sannie]

" This book , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , bringing down [his]67-bonaparte finger with energy on the cover , " this book is sleg , sleg , [Davel]125-davel , [Davel]125-davel ! "[234-the boy]

[Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie perceived from the gravity of [his]67-bonaparte countenance that it was no laughing matter . From the words sleg and [Davel]125-davel [she]53-tant ' sannie understood that the book was evil , and had some connection with [the prince who pulls the wires of evil over [the whole earth]1210-the whole earth]1209-the prince who pulls the wires of evil over the whole earth .

" Where did [you]67-bonaparte get this book ? "[234-the boy] [she]53-tant ' sannie asked ,

turning [her]53-tant ' sannie twinkling little eyes on [Waldo]60-waldo . " [I]53-tant ' sannie wish that [my]53-tant ' sannie legs may be as thin as [an Englishman]3939-an englishman 's if it is n't one of [[your]60-waldo father]3433-your father 's . [He]3433-your father had more sins than [all the Kaffirs in [Kaffirland]28-kaffirland]3941-all the kaffirs in kaffirland , for all that [he]3433-your father pretended to be so good all those years , and to live without [a wife]3519-a wife because [he]3433-your father was thinking of [the one that was dead]3943-the one that was dead ! As though [ten dead wives]3944-ten dead wives could make up for [one fat one with arms and legs]3945-one fat one with arms and legs ! "[53-tant ' sannie] cried [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , snorting .

" It was not [[my]234-the boy father]3420-my father 's book , "[234-the boy] said [the boy]234-the boy savagely . " [I]53-tant ' sannie got it from [[your]60-waldo loft]3947-your loft . "[53-tant ' sannie] " [[My]67-bonaparte loft]3948-my loft ! [my]67-bonaparte book ! How dare [you]234-the boy ? "[67-bonaparte] cried [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie . " It was [[Em]54-em 's father]3949-em 's father 's . [She]3949-em 's father gave it [me]53-tant ' sannie , "[53-tant ' sannie] [he]234-the boy muttered more sullenly . " Give it here . What is the name of it ? What is it about ? "[53-tant ' sannie] [she]53-tant ' sannie asked , putting [her]53-tant ' sannie finger upon the title . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte understood . " Political Economy , "[53-tant ' sannie] [he]67-bonaparte said slowly .

" [Dear Lord]126-dear lord ! "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , " can [not one]3950-not one hear from the very sound what an ungodly book it is ! [One]324-one can hardly say the name . Have n't [we]3952-we got curses enough on [this farm]3442-this farm ? "[53-tant ' sannie] cried [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , eloquently ; " [my]53-tant ' sannie best imported Merino ram dying of [nobody]658-nobody knows what , and the short - horn cow casting [her]3949-em 's father two calves , and the sheep eaten up with the scab and the drought ? And is this a time to bring ungodly things about [the place]3955-the place , to call down the vengeance of [Almighty God]3956-almighty god to punish [us]3952-we more ? Did n't [the minister]3957-the minister tell [me]53-tant ' sannie when [I]53-tant ' sannie was confirmed not to read any book except [my]53-tant ' sannie Bible and hymn - book , that [the Devil]3496-the devil was in all the rest ? And [I]53-tant ' sannie never have read any other book , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie with virtuous energy , " and [I]53-tant ' sannie never will ! "[53-tant ' sannie]

[Waldo]60-waldo saw that the fate of [his]60-waldo book was sealed , and turned sullenly on [his]60-waldo heel .

" So [you]60-waldo will not stay to hear what [I]53-tant ' sannie say ! "[53-tant ' sannie] cried [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie . " There , take [your]60-waldo polity - gollity - gominy , [your]60-waldo devil 's book ! "[67-bonaparte] [she]53-tant ' sannie cried ,

flinging the book at [his]60-waldo head with much energy .

It merely touched [his]60-waldo forehead on one side and fell to the ground . " Go on , "[67-bonaparte] [she]53-tant ' sannie cried ; " [I]67-bonaparte know [you]60-waldo are going to talk to [yourself]60-waldo . [People who talk to [themselves]3959-people who talk to themselves]3959-people who talk to themselves always talk to [the Devil]3496-the devil . Go and tell [him]3496-the devil all about it . Go , go ! run ! "[67-bonaparte] cried [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie . But [the boy]234-the boy neither quickened nor slackened [his]234-the boy pace , and passed sullenly round the back of [the waggon - house]229-the waggon - house .

Books have been thrown at other heads before and since that summer afternoon , by hands more white and delicate than those of [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman ; but whether the result of the process has been in any case wholly satisfactory , may be questioned . [We]1215-we love that with a peculiar tenderness , [we]1215-we treasure it with a peculiar care , it has for [us]1215-we quite a fictitious value , for which [we]1215-we have suffered . If [we]1215-we may not carry it anywhere

else [we]1215-we will carry it in [our]1215-we hearts , and always to the end .

[Bonaparte Blenkins]67-bonaparte went to pick up the volume , now loosened from its cover , while [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie pushed the stumps of wood further into the oven . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte came close to [her]53-tant ' sannie , tapped the book knowingly , nodded , and looked at the fire . [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie comprehended , and , taking the volume from [his]67-bonaparte hand , threw it into the back of the oven . [It]1216-it lay upon the heap of coals , smoked , flared , and blazed , and the " Political Economyí was no more gone out of existence , like [many another poor heretic of flesh and blood]3961-many another poor heretic of flesh and blood .[67-bonaparte]

[Bonaparte]67-bonaparte grinned , and to watch the process brought [his]67-bonaparte face so near the oven door that the white hair on [his]67-bonaparte eyebrows got singed . [He]67-bonaparte then inquired if there were any more in [the loft]205-the loft . Learning that there were , [he]67-bonaparte made signs indicative of taking up armfuls and flinging them into the fire . But [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie was dubious . [The

deceased Englishman]1218-the deceased englishman had left all [his]1218-the deceased englishman personal effects specially to [[his]1218-the deceased englishman child]1126-his child . It was all very well for [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte to talk of burning the books . [He]67-bonaparte had had [his]67-bonaparte hair spiritually pulled , and [she]53-tant ' sannie had no wish to repeat [his]67-bonaparte experience .

[She]53-tant ' sannie shook [her]53-tant ' sannie head . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte was displeased . But then a happy thought occurred to [him]67-bonaparte . [He]67-bonaparte suggested that the key of [the loft]205-the loft should henceforth be put into [his]67-bonaparte own safe care and keeping [no one]237-no one gaining possession of it without [his]67-bonaparte permission . To [this Tant ' Sannie]1222-this tant ' sannie readily assented , and [the two]1223-the two walked lovingly to [the house]206-the house to look for it .

CHAPTER XII . [HE]67-bonaparte BITES .

[BONAPARTE BLENKINS]67-bonaparte was riding [home]302-home on the grey mare . [He]67-bonaparte had ridden out that afternoon , partly for the benefit of [his]67-bonaparte health , partly to maintain [his]67-bonaparte character as [overseer of [the farm]260-the farm]1053-overseer of the farm . As [he]67-bonaparte rode on slowly , [he]67-bonaparte thoughtfully touched the ears of the grey mare with [his]67-bonaparte whip .

" No , [Bon]85-bon , [[my]67-bonaparte boy]3810-my boy , "[67-bonaparte] [he]67-bonaparte addressed [himself]67-bonaparte , " do n't propose ! [You]85-bon ca n't marry for four years , then why propose ? Wheedle [her]3963-her , tweedle [her]3963-her , teedle [her]3963-her , but do n't let [her]3963-her make sure of [you]85-bon . When [a woman]540-a woman , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , sagely resting [his]67-bonaparte finger against the side of [his]67-bonaparte nose , " when [a woman]540-a woman is sure of [you]85-bon [she]540-a woman does what [she]540-a woman likes with [you]85-bon ; but when [she]540-a woman is n't , [you]85-bon do what [you]85-bon like with [her]540-a woman . And [I]53-tant ' sannie "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte .

Here [he]67-bonaparte drew the horse up suddenly and looked . [He]67-bonaparte was now close to [the house]206-the house , and leaning over the pigsty wall , in company with [Em]54-em , who was showing [her]54-em the pigs , was a strange female figure . It was [the first visitor that had appeared on [the farm]260-the farm since [his]67-bonaparte arrival]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival , and [he]67-bonaparte looked at [her]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival with interest . [She]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival was [a tall , pudgy girl of fifteen , weighing a hundred and fifty pounds , with baggy pendulous cheeks and up - turned nose]1231-a tall , pudgy girl of fifteen , weighing a hundred and fifty pounds , with baggy pendulous cheeks and up - turned nose . [She]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival strikingly resembled [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie in form and feature , but [her]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival sleepy good eyes lacked that twinkle that dwelt in [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman 's small orbs . [She]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival was attired in a bright green print , wore brass rings in [her]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival ears and glass beads round [her]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival neck , and was sucking the tip of [her]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival large finger as [she]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival looked at the pigs . " Who is it that has come ? "[53-tant ' sannie] asked [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , when [he]67-bonaparte stood drinking [his]67-bonaparte coffee in [the front room]1096-the front room .

" Why , [[my]53-tant ' sannie niece]3966-my niece , to be sure , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant '

Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , [the Hottentot maid translating]1234-the hottentot maid translating . " [She]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival 's the only daughter of [[my]53-tant ' sannie only brother]3967-my only brother [Paul]127-paul , and [she]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival 's come to visit [me]53-tant ' sannie . [She]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival 'll be a nice mouthful to [the man that can get [her]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival]3968-the man that can get her , "[53-tant ' sannie] added [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie . " [[Her]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival father]3969-her father 's got two thousand pounds in the green waggon box under [his]3969-her father bed , and [a farm]3970-a farm , and five thousand sheep , and [God Almighty]56-god knows how many goats and horses . [They]3971-they milk ten cows in mid winter , and [the young men]3972-the young men are after [her]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival like flies about a bowl of milk . [She]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival says [she]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival means to get married in about four months , but [she]1229-the first visitor that had appeared on the farm since his arrival does n't yet know to whom . It was so with [me]67-bonaparte when [I]67-bonaparte was young , "[67-bonaparte] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie . " [I]128-trana 've sat up with [the young men]3972-the young men four and five nights a week . And [they]3972-the young men will come riding again as soon as ever [they]3972-the young men know that the time 's up that [the Englishman]3974-the englishman made [me]128-trana agree not to marry in . "[128-trana]

[The Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman smirked complacently . " Where are [you]67-bonaparte going to ? "[1237-they] asked [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie presently , seeing that [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte rose .

" Ha ! [I]53-tant ' sannie 'm just going to [the kraals]3975-the kraals ; [I]53-tant ' sannie 'll be in to supper , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . Nevertheless , when [he]67-bonaparte reached [his]67-bonaparte own door [he]67-bonaparte stopped and turned in there . Soon after [he]67-bonaparte stood before the little glass , arrayed in [his]67-bonaparte best white shirt with the little tucks , and shaving [himself]67-bonaparte . [He]67-bonaparte had on [his]67-bonaparte very best trousers , and had heavily oiled the little fringe at the back of [his]67-bonaparte head , which , however , refused to become darker . But what distressed [him]67-bonaparte most was [his]67-bonaparte nose it was very red . [He]67-bonaparte rubbed [his]67-bonaparte finger and thumb on the wall , and put a little whitewash on it ; but , finding it rather made matters worse , [he]67-bonaparte rubbed it off again . Then [he]67-bonaparte looked carefully into [his]67-bonaparte own eyes . They certainly were a little pulled down at the outer corners , which gave [them]1236-them the appearance of looking cross - wise ; but then they were a nice blue . So [he]67-bonaparte put on [his]67-bonaparte best coat , took up [his]67-bonaparte stick , and went out to supper , feeling on the whole well satisfied .

" [Aunt]3976-aunt , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Trana]128-trana to [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie when

that night [they]1237-they lay together in the great wooden bed , " why does [the Englishman]3974-the englishman sigh so when [he]3974-the englishman looks at [me]53-tant ' sannie ? "[53-tant ' sannie]

" Ha ! "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant]53-tant ' sannie ' [Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , who was half asleep , but suddenly started , wide awake . " It 's because [he]3974-the englishman thinks [you]53-tant ' sannie look like [me]128-trana . [I]128-trana tell [you]53-tant ' sannie , [Trana]128-trana , "[128-trana] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , " [the man]372-the man is mad with love of [me]128-trana . [I]128-trana told [him]372-the man the other night [I]128-trana could n't marry till [Em]54-em was sixteen , or [I]128-trana 'd lose all the sheep [[her]54-em father]3969-her father left [me]128-trana . And [he]372-the man talked about [Jacob]129-jacob working seven years and seven years again for [[his]372-the man wife]3738-his wife . And of course [he]372-the man meant [me]128-trana , "[128-trana] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie pompously . " But [he]372-the man wo n't get [me]53-tant ' sannie so easily as [he]372-the man thinks ; [he]372-the man 'll have to ask more than once . "[53-tant ' sannie] " Oh ! "[0-i] said [Trana]128-trana , who was [a lumpish girl]1238-a lumpish girl and not much given to talking ; but presently [she]128-trana added , " [Aunt]3981-aunt , why does [the Englishman]3974-the englishman always knock against [you]3981-aunt when [he]1239-he passes [you]3981-aunt ? "[0-i] " That 's because [you]3981-aunt are always in the way , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie .

" But , [aunt]3983-aunt , said [Trana]128-trana , presently , "[53-tant ' sannie] [I]0-i think [he]1239-he is very ugly . " "[128-trana] Phugh ! " said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie . It 's only because [we]3984-we 're not accustomed to such noses in [this country]431-this country . In [[his]372-the man country]3986-his country [he]372-the man says [all the people]3466-all the people have such noses , and the redder [your]3981-aunt nose is the higher [you]3981-aunt are . [He]372-the man 's of [the family of [the Queen]3989-the queen]3988-the family of the queen , [Victoria]130-victoria , [you]3981-aunt know , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , wakening up with [her]53-tant ' sannie subject ; " and [he]372-the man does n't think anything of [governors]3990-governors and [Church elders]3991-church elders , and [such people]3992-such people ; [they]3992-such people are nothing to [him]372-the man . When [[his]372-the man aunt]3993-his aunt with the dropsy dies [he]372-the man 'll have money enough to buy [all the farms in [this district]3995-this district]3994-all the farms in this district ! "[53-tant ' sannie] " Oh ! "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Trana]128-trana . That certainly made a difference . " Yes , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie ; " and [he]372-the man 's only forty - one , though [you]3996-you 'd take [him]372-the man to be sixty . And [he]372-the man told [me]128-trana last night the real reason of [his]372-the man baldness . "[128-trana]

[Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie then proceeded to relate how , at

eighteen years of age , [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte had courted [a fair young lady]1240-a fair young lady . How [a deadly rival]1241-a deadly rival , jealous of [his]67-bonaparte verdant locks , [his]67-bonaparte golden flowing hair , had , with a damnable and insinuating deception , made [him]67-bonaparte a present of a pot of pomatum . How applying it in the evening , on rising in the morning [he]67-bonaparte found [his]67-bonaparte pillow strewn with the golden locks , and , looking into the glass , beheld the shining and smooth expanse which henceforth [he]67-bonaparte must bear . The few remaining hairs were turned to a silvery whiteness , and [the young lady]1242-the young lady married [[his]67-bonaparte rival]1243-his rival .

" And , "[60-waldo] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie solemnly , " if it had not been for the grace of [God]56-god , and reading of the psalms , [he]372-the man says [he]372-the man would have killed [himself]372-the man . [He]372-the man says [he]372-the man could kill [himself]372-the man quite easily if [he]372-the man wants to marry [a woman]540-a woman and [she]540-a woman wo n't . "[60-waldo] " All [the world]252-the world ! "[60-waldo] said [Trana]128-trana : and then [they]1244-they went to sleep .

[Every one]3534-every one was lost in sleep soon ; but from the window of [the cabin]460-the cabin the light streamed

forth . It came from a dung fire , over which [Waldo]60-waldo sat brooding . Hour after hour [he]60-waldo sat there , now and again throwing a fresh lump of fuel on to the fire , which burnt up bravely , and then sank into a great bed of red coals , which reflected themselves in [the boy]234-the boy 's eyes as [he]60-waldo sat there brooding , brooding , brooding . At last , when the fire was blazing at its brightest , [he]60-waldo rose suddenly and walked slowly to a beam from which an ox "[60-waldo]

riem reim

" hung . Loosening it , [he]60-waldo ran a noose in one end and then doubled it round [his]60-waldo arm .[60-waldo]

" [Mine]60-waldo , [mine]60-waldo ! [I]60-waldo have a right , "[60-waldo] [he]60-waldo muttered ; and then something louder , " if [I]60-waldo fall and am killed , so much the better ! "[60-waldo] [He]60-waldo opened the door and went out into the starlight .

[He]60-waldo walked with [his]60-waldo eyes bent upon the ground , but over - head it was one of those brilliant southern nights when every space so small that [your]1248-your hand might cover it shows fifty cold white points , and the milky - way is a belt of sharp

frosted silver . [He]60-waldo passed the door where [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte lay dreaming of [Trana]128-trana and [her]128-trana wealth , and [he]60-waldo mounted the ladder steps . From those [he]60-waldo clambered with some difficulty on to the roof of [the house]206-the house . [It]1250-it was of old rotten thatch with a ridge of white plaster , and it crumbled away under [his]60-waldo feet at every step . [He]60-waldo trod as heavily as [he]60-waldo could . So much the better if [he]60-waldo fell !

[He]60-waldo knelt down when [he]60-waldo got to the far gable , and began to fasten [his]60-waldo "[60-waldo]

riem reim

" to the crumbling bricks . Below was the little window of [the loft]205-the loft . With one end of the "[60-waldo]

riem reim

" tied round [the gable]4000-the gable , the other end round [his]60-waldo waist , how easy to slide down to it , and to open it , through one of the broken panes , and to go in , and to fill [his]60-waldo arms with books , and to clamber up again ! [They]4001-they had burnt one book [he]60-waldo would have twenty . [Every man]4002-every man 's hand was against [his]60-waldo [his]60-waldo should be against [every man]4002-every man 's . [No one]237-no one would help [him]60-waldo [he]60-waldo would help [himself]60-waldo .[1251-they]

[He]60-waldo lifted the black damp hair from [his]60-waldo knit

forehead , and looked round to cool [his]60-waldo hot face . Then [he]60-waldo saw what a regal night it was . [He]60-waldo knelt silently and looked up . A thousand eyes were looking down at [him]60-waldo , bright and so cold . There was a laughing irony in them .

" So hot , so bitter , so angry ? [Poor little mortal]4005-poor little mortal ! "[1251-they] [He]60-waldo was ashamed . [He]60-waldo folded [his]60-waldo arms , and sat on the ridge of the roof looking up at [them]1251-they .

" So hot , so bitter , so angry ? "[1251-they]

It was as though a cold hand had been laid upon [his]60-waldo throbbing forehead , and slowly they began to fade and grow dim . [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie and the burnt book , [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte and the broken machine , the box in [the loft]205-the loft , [he]60-waldo [himself]60-waldo sitting there how small [they]1251-they all became ! Even [the grave over yonder]1253-the grave over yonder . Those stars that shone on up above so quietly , [they]1251-they had seen a thousand such little existences fight just so fiercely , flare up just so

brightly , and go out ; and [they]1251-they , the old , old stars , shone on forever .

" So hot , so angry , [poor little soul]4006-poor little soul ? "[1251-they] [they]1251-they said .

The "[1251-they]

riem reim

" slipped from [his]60-waldo fingers ; [he]60-waldo sat with [his]60-waldo arms folded , looking up .[1251-they]

" [We]1251-they , "[60-waldo] said the stars , " have seen [the earth]335-the earth when it was young . [We]1251-they have seen small things creep out upon [its]335-the earth surface [small things that prayed and loved and cried very loudly , and then crept under it]4008-small things that prayed and loved and cried very loudly , and then crept under it again . But [we]1251-they , "[60-waldo] said the stars , " are as old as [the Unknown]131-the unknown . "[60-waldo] [He]60-waldo leaned [his]60-waldo chin against the palm of [his]60-waldo hand and looked up at [them]1251-they . So long [he]60-waldo sat there that bright stars set and new ones rose , and yet [he]60-waldo sat on .

Then at last [he]60-waldo stood up , and began to loosen the "[60-waldo]

riem reim

" from the gable .[1251-they]

What did it matter about the books ? The lust and the desire for [them]1251-they had died out . If [they]1251-they pleased to keep them from [him]60-waldo [they]1251-they might .

What matter ? it was a very little thing . Why hate , and struggle , and fight ? Let it be as it would .

[He]60-waldo twisted the "[67-bonaparte]

riem reim

" round [his]60-waldo arm and walked back along [the ridge of [the house]206-the house]4009-the ridge of the house .[214-the boer - woman]

By this time [Bonaparte Blenkins]67-bonaparte had finished [his]67-bonaparte dream of [Trana]128-trana , and as [he]67-bonaparte turned [himself]67-bonaparte round for a fresh doze [he]67-bonaparte heard the steps descending the ladder . [His]67-bonaparte first impulse was to draw the blanket over [his]67-bonaparte head and [his]67-bonaparte legs under [him]67-bonaparte , and to howl ; but recollecting that the door was locked and the window carefully bolted , [he]67-bonaparte allowed [his]67-bonaparte head slowly to crop out among the blankets , and listened intently . Whosoever it might be , there was no danger of [their]1251-they getting at [him]67-bonaparte ; so [he]67-bonaparte clambered out of bed , and going on tiptoe to the door , applied [his]67-bonaparte eye to the keyhole . There was nothing to be seen ; so walking to the window , [he]67-bonaparte brought [his]67-bonaparte face as close to the glass as [his]67-bonaparte nose would allow . There was [a figure just discernible]1254-a figure just discernible . [The lad]1043-the lad

was not trying to walk softly , and the heavy shuffling of the well - known " vel - schoens "[214-the boer - woman] could be clearly heard through the closed window as [they]1251-they crossed the stones in [the yard]927-the yard . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte listened till [they]1251-they had died away round the corner of [the waggon - house]229-the waggon - house ; and , feeling that [his]67-bonaparte bare legs were getting cold , [he]67-bonaparte jumped back into bed again .

" What do [you]214-the boer - woman keep up in [[your]214-the boer - woman loft]3947-your loft ? "[67-bonaparte] inquired [[Bonaparte]67-bonaparte of [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman]1258-bonaparte of the boer - woman the next evening , pointing upwards and elucidating [his]67-bonaparte meaning by the addition of such Dutch words as [he]67-bonaparte knew , for [the lean Hottentot]98-the hottentot was gone [home]302-home . " Dried skins , "[67-bonaparte] said [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman , " and empty bottles , and boxes , and sacks , and soap . "[67-bonaparte] " [You]214-the boer - woman do n't keep any of [your]214-the boer - woman provisions there sugar , now ? "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , pointing to the sugar - basin and then up at [the loft]205-the loft . [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie shook [her]53-tant ' sannie head .

" Only salt , and dried peaches . "[67-bonaparte] " Dried peaches ! [Eh]4012-eh ? "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte .
