" Shut the door , [[my]67-bonaparte dear child]4013-my dear child , shut it tight , "[67-bonaparte] [he]67-bonaparte called out to [Em]54-em , who stood in [the dining - room]1263-the dining - room . Then [he]67-bonaparte leaned over the elbow of the sofa and brought [his]67-bonaparte face as close as possible to [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman 's , and made signs of eating . Then [he]67-bonaparte said something [she]214-the boer - woman did not comprehend ; then said , " [Waldo]60-waldo , [Waldo]60-waldo , [Waldo]60-waldo , "[53-tant ' sannie] pointed up to [the loft]205-the loft , and made signs of eating again . Now an inkling of [his]67-bonaparte meaning dawned on [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman 's mind . To make it clearer , [he]67-bonaparte moved [his]67-bonaparte legs after the manner of one going up a ladder , appeared to be opening a door , masticated vigorously , said , " Peaches , peaches , peaches , "[53-tant ' sannie] and appeared to be coming down the ladder . It was now evident to [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie that [Waldo]60-waldo had been in [[her]53-tant ' sannie loft]1267-her loft and eaten [her]53-tant ' sannie peaches .

To exemplify [his]67-bonaparte own share in the proceedings ,

[Bonaparte]67-bonaparte lay down on the sofa , and shutting [his]67-bonaparte eyes tightly , said , " Night , night , night ! "[67-bonaparte] Then [he]67-bonaparte sat up wildly , appearing to be intently listening , mimicked with [his]67-bonaparte feet the coming down [a ladder]1268-a ladder , and looked at [Tant]53-tant ' sannie ' [Sannie]53-tant ' sannie . This clearly showed how , roused in the night , [he]67-bonaparte had discovered the theft .

" [He]60-waldo must have been [a great fool]4014-a great fool to eat [my]67-bonaparte peaches , "[67-bonaparte] said [Tant]53-tant ' sannie ' [Sannie]53-tant ' sannie . " [They]4015-they are full of mites as a sheepskin , and as hard as stones . "[67-bonaparte] [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , fumbling in [his]67-bonaparte pocket , did not even hear [her]53-tant ' sannie remark , and took out from [his]67-bonaparte coat - tail a little horsewhip , nicely rolled up . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte winked at the little rhinoceros horsewhip , at [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman , and then at the door . " Shall [we]4016-we call [him]234-the boy [Waldo]60-waldo , [Waldo]60-waldo ? "[53-tant ' sannie] [he]67-bonaparte said .

[Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie nodded , and giggled . There was something so exceedingly humorous in the idea that [he]67-bonaparte was going to beat [the boy]234-the boy , though for [her]53-tant ' sannie own part [she]53-tant ' sannie did not see that the peaches

were worth it . When [the Kaffir maid]1271-the kaffir maid came with the wash - tub [she]1271-the kaffir maid was sent to summon [Waldo]60-waldo ; and [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte doubled up the little whip and put it in [his]67-bonaparte pocket . Then [he]67-bonaparte drew [himself]67-bonaparte up , and prepared to act [his]67-bonaparte important part with becoming gravity . Soon [Waldo]60-waldo stood in the door , and took off [his]60-waldo hat .

" Come in , come in , [[my]53-tant ' sannie lad]3912-my lad , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , " and shut the door behind . "[67-bonaparte] [The boy]234-the boy came in and stood before [them]1273-them . " [You]234-the boy need not be so afraid , [child]3660-child , "[926-the dutch - woman] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie . " [I]926-the dutch - woman was [a child]224-a child [myself]926-the dutch - woman once . It 's no great harm if [you]67-bonaparte have taken a few . "[926-the dutch - woman] [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte perceived that [her]53-tant ' sannie remark was not in keeping with the nature of the proceedings , and of the little drama [he]67-bonaparte intended to act . Pursing out [his]67-bonaparte lips , and waving [his]67-bonaparte hand , [he]67-bonaparte solemnly addressed [the boy]234-the boy .

" [Waldo]60-waldo , it grieves [me]67-bonaparte beyond expression to have to summon [you]60-waldo for so painful a purpose ; but it is at the imperative call of duty , which [I]67-bonaparte[67-bonaparte]

dare not evade . [I]0-i do not state that frank and unreserved confession will obviate the necessity of chastisement , which if requisite shall be fully administered ; but the nature of that chastisement may be mitigated by free and humble confession . [Waldo]60-waldo , answer [me]0-i as [you]60-waldo would [[your]60-waldo own father]1275-your own father , in whose place [I]0-i now stand to [you]60-waldo ; have [you]60-waldo , or have [you]60-waldo not , did [you]60-waldo , or did [you]60-waldo not , eat of the peaches in [the loft]205-the loft ? "[67-bonaparte]

" Say [you]60-waldo took them , [boy]3767-boy , say [you]60-waldo took them , then [he]1275-your own father wo n't beat [you]3767-boy so much , "[60-waldo] said [the Dutch - woman]926-the dutch - woman , good - naturedly , getting a little sorry for [him]60-waldo . [The boy]234-the boy raised [his]234-the boy eyes slowly and fixed them vacantly upon [her]926-the dutch - woman , then suddenly [his]234-the boy face grew dark with blood .

" So , [you]60-waldo have n't got anything to say to [us]4021-us , [[my]60-waldo lad]3912-my lad ? "[60-waldo] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , momentarily forgetting [his]67-bonaparte dignity , and bending forward with a little snarl . " But what [I]60-waldo mean is just this , [[my]60-waldo lad]3912-my lad when it takes [a boy]3640-a boy three - quarters of an[60-waldo]

hour to fill a salt - pot , and when at three o'clock in the morning [he]234-the boy goes knocking about the doors of [a loft]1279-a loft , it 's natural to suppose there 's mischief in it . It 's certain there is mischief in it ; and where there 's mischief in it must be taken out , " said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , grinning into [the boy]234-the boy 's face . Then , feeling that [he]234-the boy had fallen from that high gravity which was as spice to the pudding , and the flavour of the whole little tragedy , [he]234-the boy drew [himself]234-the boy up . "[234-the boy] [Waldo]60-waldo , " [he]0-i said , "[53-tant ' sannie] confess to [me]0-i instantly , and without reserve , that [you]60-waldo ate the peaches . "[53-tant ' sannie]

[The boy]234-the boy 's face was white now . [His]234-the boy eyes were on the ground , [his]234-the boy hands doggedly clasped before [him]234-the boy . " What , do [you]60-waldo not intend to answer ? "[0-i] [The boy]234-the boy looked up at [them]1282-them once from under [his]234-the boy bent eyebrows , and then looked down again .

" The creature looks as if all the devils in [hell]4026-hell were in it , "[67-bonaparte] cried [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie . " Say [you]234-the boy took them , [boy]3767-boy . [Young things]4028-young things will be young things ,[67-bonaparte]

[I]0-i was older than [you]234-the boy when [I]0-i used to eat " bultongí in [[[my]67-bonaparte mother]3493-my mother 's loft]4030-my mother 's loft , and get [the little niggers]4031-the little niggers whipped for it . Say [you]234-the boy took [them]4031-the little niggers . "[67-bonaparte]

But [the boy]234-the boy said nothing . " [I]67-bonaparte think a little solitary confinement might perhaps be beneficial , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . " It will enable [you]234-the boy , [Waldo]60-waldo , to reflect on the enormity of the sin [you]234-the boy have committed against [[our]4032-our Father]4033-our father in [heaven]3422-heaven . And [you]234-the boy may also think of the submission [you]234-the boy owe to those who are older and wiser than [you]234-the boy are , and whose duty it is to check and correct [you]234-the boy . "[67-bonaparte] Saying this , [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte stood up and took down the key of [the fuel - house]1284-the fuel - house , which hung on a nail against the wall . " Walk on , [[my]67-bonaparte boy]3810-my boy , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , pointing to the door ; and as [he]67-bonaparte followed [him]67-bonaparte out [he]67-bonaparte drew [his]67-bonaparte mouth expressively on one side , and made the lash of the little horsewhip stick out of [his]67-bonaparte pocket and shake up and down .

[Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie felt half sorry for [the lad]1043-the lad ; but

[she]53-tant ' sannie could not help laughing , it was always so funny when [one]324-one was going to have a whipping , and it would do [him]324-one good . Anyhow , [he]324-one would forget all about it when the places were healed .

[Bonaparte]67-bonaparte took up a lighted candle that had been left burning on the [kitchen]878-kitchen table , and told [the boy]234-the boy to walk before [him]67-bonaparte . [They]1289-they went to [the fuel - house]1284-the fuel - house . It was a little stone erection that jutted out from the side of [the waggon - house]229-the waggon - house . [It]1284-the fuel - house was low , and without a window ; and the dried dung was piled in one corner , and [the coffee - mill]1292-the coffee - mill stood in another , fastened on the top of a post . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte took the padlock off the rough door . " Walk in , [[my]67-bonaparte lad]3912-my lad , "[67-bonaparte] [he]67-bonaparte said . [Waldo]60-waldo obeyed sullenly ; one place to [him]60-waldo was much the same as another . [He]60-waldo had no objection to being locked up .

[Bonaparte]67-bonaparte followed [him]60-waldo in , and closed the door carefully . [He]67-bonaparte put the light down on the heap of dung in the corner , and quietly

intro- introduced

duced [his]67-bonaparte hand under [his]67-bonaparte coat - tails , and drew slowly from [his]67-bonaparte pocket the end of a rope , which [he]67-bonaparte concealed behind [him]67-bonaparte .

" [I]67-bonaparte 'm very sorry , exceedingly sorry , [Waldo]60-waldo , [[my]67-bonaparte lad]3912-my lad , that [you]60-waldo should have acted in this manner . It grieves [me]67-bonaparte , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . [He]67-bonaparte moved round toward [the boy]234-the boy 's back . [He]67-bonaparte hardly liked the look in [the fellow]400-the fellow 's eyes , though [he]67-bonaparte stood there motionless . If [he]67-bonaparte should spring on [him]234-the boy ! So [he]67-bonaparte drew the rope out very carefully , and shifted round to the wooden post . There was a slip - knot in one end of the rope , and a sudden movement drew [the boy]234-the boy 's hands to [his]234-the boy back and passed it round them . It was an instant 's work to drag it twice round the wooden post : then [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte was safe . For a moment [the boy]234-the boy struggled to free [himself]234-the boy ; then [he]234-the boy knew that [he]234-the boy was powerless , and stood still .

" Horses that kick must have [their]4038-their legs tied , "[67-bonaparte]

said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , as [he]67-bonaparte passed the other end of the rope round [the boy]234-the boy 's knees . " And now , [[my]67-bonaparte dear]3426-my dear [Waldo]60-waldo , "[67-bonaparte] taking the whip out of [his]67-bonaparte pocket , " [I]67-bonaparte am going to beat [you]60-waldo . "[67-bonaparte]

[He]67-bonaparte paused for a moment . It was perfectly quiet ; [they]1298-they could hear [each other]280-each other 's breath . " "[67-bonaparte] Chasten [[thy]1300-thy son]1301-thy son while there is hope , í " said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , "[67-bonaparte] " and let not [thy]1300-thy soul spare for [his]1301-thy son crying.í Those are [God]56-god 's words . [I]67-bonaparte shall act as [a father to [you]60-waldo]4040-a father to you , [Waldo]60-waldo . [I]67-bonaparte think [we]1298-they had better have [your]60-waldo naked back . "[67-bonaparte] [He]67-bonaparte took out [his]67-bonaparte pen - knife , and slit the shirt down from the shoulder to the waist . " Now , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , " [I]67-bonaparte hope [the Lord]3492-the lord will bless and sanctify to [you]234-the boy what [I]67-bonaparte am going to do to [you]234-the boy . "[67-bonaparte] The first cut ran from the shoulder across the middle of the back ; the second fell exactly in the same place . A shudder passed through [the boy]234-the boy 's frame .

" Nice , eh ? "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , peeping round

into [his]67-bonaparte face , speaking with a lisp , as though to [a very little child]1303-a very little child . " Nith , eh ? "[67-bonaparte]

But the eyes were black and lustreless , and seemed not to see [him]67-bonaparte . When [he]67-bonaparte had given sixteen [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte paused in [his]67-bonaparte work to wipe a little drop of blood from [his]67-bonaparte whip . " Cold , eh ? What makes [you]234-the boy shiver so ? Perhaps [you]234-the boy would like to pull up [your]234-the boy shirt ? But [I]1305-the priests of baal 've not quite done yet . "[1305-the priests of baal] When [he]67-bonaparte had finished [he]67-bonaparte wiped the whip again , and put it back in [his]67-bonaparte pocket . [He]67-bonaparte cut the rope through with [his]67-bonaparte pen - knife , and then took up the light . " [You]234-the boy do n't seem to have found [your]234-the boy tongue yet . Forgotten how to cry ? "[54-em] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , patting [him]67-bonaparte on the cheek . [The boy]234-the boy looked up at [him]67-bonaparte not sullenly , not angrily . There was only a wild , fitful terror in the eyes . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte made haste to go out and shut the door , and leave [him]67-bonaparte alone in the darkness . [He]67-bonaparte [himself]67-bonaparte was afraid .

It was almost morning . [Waldo]60-waldo lay with [his]60-waldo face upon the ground at the foot of the fuel - heap . There was a round hole near the top of the door , where a knot of wood had fallen out , and a stream of grey light came in through it .

Ah , it was going to end at last . Nothing lasts forever , not even the night . How was it [he]67-bonaparte had never thought of that before ? For in all that long dark night [he]67-bonaparte had been very strong , had never been tired , never felt pain , had run on and on , up and down , up and down ; [he]67-bonaparte had not dared to stand still , and [he]67-bonaparte had not known it would end . [He]67-bonaparte had been so strong , that when [he]67-bonaparte struck [his]67-bonaparte head with all [his]67-bonaparte force upon the stone wall it did not stun [him]67-bonaparte nor pain [him]67-bonaparte only made [him]67-bonaparte laugh . That was a dreadful night . When [he]67-bonaparte clasped [his]67-bonaparte hands frantically and prayed " O [God]56-god , [[my]54-em beautiful God]4042-my beautiful god , [[my]54-em sweet God]4043-my sweet god , once , only once , let [me]54-em feel [you]67-bonaparte near [me]54-em to - night ! "[54-em] [he]67-bonaparte could not feel [Him]67-bonaparte . [He]67-bonaparte

prayed aloud , very loud , and [he]67-bonaparte got no answer ; when [he]67-bonaparte listened it was all quite quiet like when [the priests of [Baal]132-baal]1305-the priests of baal cried aloud to [[their]1305-the priests of baal god]1306-their god " Oh , [Baal]132-baal , hear [us]1305-the priests of baal ! Oh , [Baal]132-baal , hear [us]1305-the priests of baal ! "[54-em] But [Baal]132-baal was gone a - hunting .

That was a long wild night , and wild thoughts came and went in it ; but they left their marks behind [them]1307-them forever : for as years can not pass without leaving [their]1307-them traces behind [them]1307-them , neither can nights into which are forced the thoughts and sufferings of years . And now the dawn was coming , and at last [he]67-bonaparte was very tired . [He]67-bonaparte shivered , and tried to draw the shirt up over [his]67-bonaparte shoulders . They were getting stiff now . [He]67-bonaparte had never known they were cut in the night . [He]67-bonaparte looked up at the white light that came in through the hole at the top of the door and shuddered . Then [he]67-bonaparte turned [his]67-bonaparte face back to the ground , and slept again .

Some hours later [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte came toward [the fuel - house]1284-the fuel - house with a lump of bread in [his]67-bonaparte hand .

[He]67-bonaparte opened the door and peered in ; then entered , and touched [the fellow]400-the fellow with [his]67-bonaparte boot . Seeing that [he]67-bonaparte breathed heavily , though [he]67-bonaparte did not rouse , [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte threw the bread down on the ground . [He]67-bonaparte was alive , that was one thing . [He]67-bonaparte bent over [him]400-the fellow , and carefully scratched open one of the cuts with the nail of [his]67-bonaparte forefinger , examining with much interest [his]67-bonaparte last night 's work . [He]67-bonaparte would have to count [his]67-bonaparte sheep [himself]67-bonaparte that day ; [the boy]234-the boy was literally cut up . [He]67-bonaparte locked the door and went away again .

" Oh , [Lyndall]59-lyndall , "[54-em] said [Em]54-em , entering [the dining room]1311-the dining room , and bathed in tears , that afternoon , " [I]54-em have been begging [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte to let [him]67-bonaparte out , and [he]67-bonaparte wo n't . "[54-em] " The more [you]59-lyndall beg the more [he]67-bonaparte will not , "[1315-they] said [Lyndall]59-lyndall . [She]54-em was cutting out aprons on the table .

" Oh , but it 's late , and [I]59-lyndall think [they]4044-they want to kill [him]67-bonaparte , "[59-lyndall] said [Em]54-em , weeping bitterly ; and finding that no more consolation was to be

gained from [[her]54-em cousin]1312-her cousin , [she]54-em went off blubbering " [I]53-tant ' sannie wonder [you]1312-her cousin can cut out aprons when [Waldo]60-waldo is shut up like that . "[53-tant ' sannie]

For ten minutes after [she]54-em was gone [Lyndall]59-lyndall worked on quietly ; then [she]59-lyndall folded up [her]59-lyndall stuff , rolled it tightly together , and stood before the closed door of [the sitting room]1313-the sitting room with [her]59-lyndall hands closely clasped . A flush rose to [her]59-lyndall face : [she]59-lyndall opened the door quickly , and walking in , went to the nail on which the key of [the fuel - room]1314-the fuel - room hung . [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte and [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie sat there and saw [her]59-lyndall . " What do [you]59-lyndall want ? "[67-bonaparte] [they]1315-they asked together . " This key , "[53-tant ' sannie] [she]59-lyndall said , holding it up , and looking at [them]1315-they . " Do [you]59-lyndall mean [her]59-lyndall to have it ? "[59-lyndall] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie in Dutch . " Why do n't [you]59-lyndall stop [her]59-lyndall ? "[59-lyndall] asked [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte in English . " Why do n't [you]59-lyndall take it from [her]59-lyndall ? "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie .

So [they]1315-they looked at [each other]280-each other , talking , while [Lyndall]59-lyndall walked to [the fuel - house]1284-the fuel - house with the key , [her]59-lyndall underlip bitten in . " [Waldo]60-waldo , "[53-tant ' sannie] [she]59-lyndall said , as [she]59-lyndall helped [him]1318-him to stand up , and twisted [his]1318-him arm about [her]59-lyndall waist to support [him]1318-him , " [we]1315-they will not be [children]3428-children always ; [we]1315-they shall have the power too some day . "[737-the hottentot maid] [She]59-lyndall kissed [his]1318-him naked shoulder with [her]59-lyndall soft little mouth . It was all the comfort [her]59-lyndall young soul could give [him]1318-him .

[CHAPTER XIII]133-chapter xiii . [HE]1318-him MAKES LOVE .

" [HERE]3430-here , "[738-her mistress] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie to [[her]53-tant ' sannie Hottentot maid]1319-her hottentot maid , " [I]738-her mistress have been in [this house]4047-this house four years , and never been up in [the loft]205-the loft . [Fatter women]4049-fatter women than [I]738-her mistress go up ladders ; [I]738-her mistress will go up to - day and see what it is like , and put it to rights up there . [You]1319-her hottentot maid bring the little ladder and stand at the bottom . "[738-her mistress]

" There 's one would be sorry if [you]1319-her hottentot maid were to fall , "[67-bonaparte] said [the Hottentot maid]737-the hottentot maid , leering at [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte 's pipe , that lay on the table . " Hold [your]1319-her hottentot maid tongue , [jade]4050-jade , "[67-bonaparte] said [[her]53-tant ' sannie mistress]738-her mistress , trying to conceal a pleased smile , " and go fetch the ladder . "[67-bonaparte]

There was a never - used trap - door at one end

of [the sitting room]1313-the sitting room : this [the Hottentot maid]737-the hottentot maid pushed open , and setting the ladder against it , [the Boer - woman with some danger and difficulty]1324-the boer - woman with some danger and difficulty climbed into [the loft]205-the loft . Then [the Hottentot maid]737-the hottentot maid took the ladder away , as [[her]737-the hottentot maid husband]644-her husband was mending [the waggon - house]229-the waggon - house , and needed it ; but the trap - door was left open .

For a little while [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie poked about among the empty bottles and skins , and looked at the bag of peaches that [Waldo]60-waldo was supposed to have liked so ; then [she]53-tant ' sannie sat down near the trap - door beside a barrel of salt mutton . [She]53-tant ' sannie found that the pieces of meat were much too large , and took out [her]53-tant ' sannie clasp - knife to divide them . That was always the way when [one]324-one left things to [servants]3590-servants , [she]53-tant ' sannie grumbled to [herself]53-tant ' sannie : but when once [she]53-tant ' sannie was married to [[her]53-tant ' sannie husband]644-her husband [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte it would not matter whether [a sheep]1332-a sheep spoiled or no when once [[his]67-bonaparte rich aunt]1333-his rich aunt with the dropsy was dead . [She]53-tant ' sannie smiled as [she]53-tant ' sannie dived [her]53-tant ' sannie hand into the pickle water .

At that instant [[her]53-tant ' sannie niece]1334-her niece entered [the room below]1335-the room below , closely followed by [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , with [his]67-bonaparte head on one side , smiling mawkishly . Had [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie spoken at that moment the life of [Bonaparte Blenkins]67-bonaparte would have run a wholly different course ; as it was , [she]53-tant ' sannie remained silent , and [neither]1336-neither noticed the open trap - door above [their]1337-their heads . " Sit there , [[my]67-bonaparte love]4051-my love , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , motioning [Trana]128-trana into [[her]128-trana aunt]1338-her aunt 's elbow - chair , and drawing another close up in front of it , in which [he]67-bonaparte seated [himself]67-bonaparte . " There , put [your]128-trana feet upon the stove too . [[Your]128-trana aunt]4052-your aunt has gone out somewhere . Long have [I]67-bonaparte waited for this auspicious event ! "[67-bonaparte]

[Trana]128-trana , who understood [not one word of English]1339-not one word of english , sat down in the chair and wondered if this was one of the strange customs of [other lands]1340-other lands , that [an old gentleman]1341-an old gentleman may bring [his]1341-an old gentleman chair up to [yours]1342-yours , and sit with [his]1341-an old gentleman knees touching [you]1342-yours . [She]128-trana had been five days in [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte 's

company , and feared [the old man]473-the old man , and disliked [his]473-the old man nose .

" How long have [I]67-bonaparte desired this moment ! "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . " But [that aged relative of thine]4053-that aged relative of thine is always casting [her]4053-that aged relative of thine unhallowed shadow upon [us]4054-us . Look into [my]128-trana eyes , [Trana]128-trana ! "[128-trana] [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte knew that [she]128-trana comprehended not a syllable ; but [he]67-bonaparte understood that it is the eye , the tone , the action , and not at all the rational word , that touches the love - chords . [He]67-bonaparte saw [she]128-trana changed colour . " All night , "[128-trana] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , " [I]67-bonaparte lie awake ; [I]67-bonaparte see nought but [thy]4053-that aged relative of thine angelic countenance . [I]67-bonaparte open [my]67-bonaparte arms to receive [thee]4053-that aged relative of thine where art [thou]4053-that aged relative of thine , where ? [Thou]4053-that aged relative of thine art not there ! "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , suiting the action to the words , and spreading out [his]67-bonaparte arms and drawing them to [his]67-bonaparte breast . " Oh , please , [I]67-bonaparte do n't understand , "[67-bonaparte] said [Trana]128-trana , " [I]128-trana want to go away . "[128-trana]

" Yes , yes ! "[128-trana] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , leaning back in [his]67-bonaparte chair , to [her]128-trana great relief , and pressing [his]67-bonaparte

hands on [his]67-bonaparte heart , " since first [thy]4053-that aged relative of thine amethystine countenance was impressed here what have [I]128-trana not suffered , what have [I]128-trana not felt ? Oh , the pangs unspoken , burning as an ardent coal in a fiery and uncontaminated bosom ! "[128-trana] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , bending forward again .

" [Dear Lord]3527-dear lord ! "[128-trana] said [Trana]128-trana to [herself]128-trana , " how foolish [I]67-bonaparte have been ! [The old man]473-the old man has a pain in [his]473-the old man stomach , and now , as [[my]67-bonaparte aunt]4057-my aunt is out , [he]4057-my aunt has come to [me]67-bonaparte to help [him]473-the old man . "[67-bonaparte] [She]128-trana smiled kindly at [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , and pushing past [him]67-bonaparte , went to [the bedroom]1344-the bedroom , quickly returning with a bottle of red drops in [her]128-trana hand . " They are very good for "[128-trana] benaawdheití ; [[my]0-i mother]3493-my mother always drinks them , " [she]128-trana said , holding the bottle out .[128-trana]

The face in the trap - door was a fiery red . Like a tiger - cat ready to spring . Tant ' [Sannie]53-tant ' sannie crouched , with the shoulder of mutton in [her]53-tant ' sannie hand . Exactly beneath [her]53-tant ' sannie stood [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte .

[She]128-trana rose and clasped with both arms the barrel of salt meat .

" What , rose of [the desert]4058-the desert , nightingale of [the colony]4059-the colony , that with thine amorous lay whilest the lonesome night ! "[214-the boer - woman] cried [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , seizing the hand that held the " vonlicsense . "[60-waldo] " Nay , struggle not ! Fly as a stricken fawn into the arms that would embrace [thee]67-bonaparte , [thou]67-bonaparte "[67-bonaparte] Here a stream of cold pickle - water , heavy with ribs and shoulders , descending on [his]67-bonaparte head abruptly terminated [his]67-bonaparte speech . Half - blinded , [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte looked up through the drops that hung from [his]67-bonaparte eyelids , and saw the red face that looked down at [him]67-bonaparte . With one wild cry [he]67-bonaparte fled . As [he]67-bonaparte passed out at the front door a shoulder of mutton , well - directed , struck the black coat in the small of the back . " Bring the ladder ! bring the ladder ! [I]67-bonaparte will go after [him]67-bonaparte ! "[67-bonaparte] cried [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman , as [Bonaparte Blenkins]67-bonaparte wildly fled into [the fields]333-the fields .

Late in the evening of the same day [Waldo]60-waldo knelt on the floor of [[his]60-waldo cabin]954-his cabin . [He]60-waldo bathed the foot of [his]60-waldo dog which had been pierced by a thorn . The bruises on [his]60-waldo own back had had five days to heal in , and , except a little stiffness in [his]60-waldo movements , there was nothing remarkable about [the boy]234-the boy . The troubles of [the young]1350-the young are soon over ; they leave no external mark . If [you]1351-you wound the tree in its youth the bark will quickly cover the gash ; but when the tree is very old , peel the bark off , look carefully , and [you]1351-you will see the scar there still . All that is buried is not dead . [Waldo]60-waldo poured the warm milk over the little swollen foot ; [Doss]70-doss lay very quiet , with tears in [his]70-doss eyes . Then there was a tap at the door . In an instant [Doss]70-doss looked wide awake , and winked the tears out from between [his]70-doss little lids . " Come in , "[67-bonaparte] said [Waldo]60-waldo , intent on [his]60-waldo work ; and slowly and cautiously the door opened .

" Good evening , [Waldo]60-waldo , [[my]361-his master boy]3810-my boy , "[361-his master] said

[Bonaparte Blenkins]67-bonaparte in a mild voice , not venturing more than [his]60-waldo nose within the door . " How are [you]60-waldo this evening ? "[67-bonaparte]

[Doss]70-doss growled and showed [his]70-doss little teeth , and tried to rise , but [his]70-doss paw hurt [him]70-doss so , [he]70-doss whined . " [I]60-waldo 'm very tired , [Waldo]60-waldo , [[my]60-waldo boy]3810-my boy , "[60-waldo] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , plaintively . [Doss]70-doss showed [his]70-doss little white teeth again . [[His]70-doss master]361-his master went on with [his]361-his master work without looking round . There are [some people at whose hands it is best not to look]1353-some people at whose hands it is best not to look . At last [he]361-his master said , " Come in . "[60-waldo] [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte stepped cautiously a little way into [the room]215-the room , and left the door open behind [him]67-bonaparte . [He]67-bonaparte looked at [the boy]234-the boy 's supper on the table . " [Waldo]60-waldo , [I]60-waldo 've had nothing to eat all day [I]60-waldo 'm very hungry , "[60-waldo] [he]67-bonaparte said . " Eat ! "[60-waldo] said [Waldo]60-waldo after a moment , bending lower over [his]60-waldo dog .

" [You]60-waldo wo n't go and tell [her]1356-her that [I]67-bonaparte am here , will[67-bonaparte]

[you]60-waldo , [Waldo]60-waldo ? " said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte most uneasily . "[67-bonaparte] [You]60-waldo 've heard how [she]1356-her used [me]0-i , [Waldo]60-waldo ? [I]0-i 've been badly treated ; [you]60-waldo 'll know [yourself]60-waldo what it is some day when [you]60-waldo ca n't carry on a little conversation with [a lady]1357-a lady without having salt meat and pickle - water thrown at [you]60-waldo . [Waldo]60-waldo , look at [me]0-i : do [I]0-i look as [a gentleman]441-a gentleman should ? "[234-the boy]

But [the boy]234-the boy neither looked up nor answered , and [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte grew more uneasy . " [You]60-waldo would n't go and tell [her]1356-her that [I]234-the boy am [here]3430-here , would [you]60-waldo ? "[234-the boy] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , whiningly . " There 's no knowing what [she]1356-her would do to [me]67-bonaparte . [I]67-bonaparte 've such trust in [you]60-waldo , [Waldo]60-waldo ; [I]67-bonaparte 've always thought [you]60-waldo such [a promising lad]4063-a promising lad , though [you]60-waldo may n't have known it , [Waldo]60-waldo . "[67-bonaparte] " Eat , "[67-bonaparte] said [the boy]234-the boy . " [I]67-bonaparte shall say nothing . "[67-bonaparte]

[Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , who knew the truth when another spoke it , closed the door , carefully putting on the button . Then [he]67-bonaparte looked to see that the curtain of the window was closely pulled down , and seated [himself]67-bonaparte at the table . [He]67-bonaparte was soon

munching the cold meat and bread . [Waldo]60-waldo knelt on the floor , bathing the foot with hands which the dog licked lovingly . Once only [he]67-bonaparte glanced at the table , and turned away quickly .

" Ah , yes ; [I]67-bonaparte do n't wonder that [you]60-waldo ca n't look at [me]67-bonaparte , [Waldo]60-waldo , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte : " [my]1361-my condition would touch any heart . [You]60-waldo see , the water was fatty , and that has made all the sand stick to [me]1361-my ; and [my]1361-my hair , "[1361-my] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , tenderly touching the little fringe at the back of [his]60-waldo head , " is all caked over like a little plank ; [you]60-waldo would n't think it was hair at all , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , plaintively . " [I]234-the boy had to creep all along the stone walls for fear [she]1361-my 'd see [me]234-the boy , and with nothing on [my]234-the boy head but a red handkerchief , tied under [my]234-the boy chin , [Waldo]60-waldo ; and to hide in a "[234-the boy] slootí the whole day , with not a mouthful of food , [Waldo]60-waldo . And [she]1361-my gave [me]0-i such a blow , just here , " said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . [He]67-bonaparte had cleared the plate of the last morsel , when [Waldo]60-waldo rose and walked to the door .[234-the boy]

" Oh , [Waldo]60-waldo , [[my]67-bonaparte dear boy]3866-my dear boy , [you]60-waldo are not going to call [her]1361-my ? "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , rising anxiously . " [I]67-bonaparte am going to sleep in [the waggon]1041-the waggon , "[67-bonaparte] said [the boy]234-the boy , opening the door . " Oh , [we]4066-we can both sleep in this bed : there 's plenty of room . Do stay , [[my]67-bonaparte boy]3810-my boy , please . "[67-bonaparte] But [Waldo]60-waldo stepped out .

" It was such a little whip , [Waldo]60-waldo , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , following [him]60-waldo deprecatingly . " [I]67-bonaparte did n't think it would hurt [you]60-waldo so much . It was such a little whip . [I]67-bonaparte 'm sure [you]60-waldo did n't take the peaches . [You]60-waldo are n't going to call [her]234-the boy , [Waldo]60-waldo , are [you]60-waldo ? "[67-bonaparte]

But [the boy]234-the boy walked off .

[Bonaparte]67-bonaparte waited till [his]67-bonaparte figure had passed round the front of [the waggon - house]229-the waggon - house , and then slipped out . [He]67-bonaparte hid [himself]67-bonaparte round the corner , but kept peeping out to see who was coming . [He]67-bonaparte felt sure [the boy]234-the boy was gone to call [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie . [His]67-bonaparte teeth chattered with inward cold as [he]67-bonaparte looked round into the darkness and thought of the snakes that might bite [him]67-bonaparte , and the

dreadful things that might attack [him]67-bonaparte , and the dead that might arise out of [their]1366-their graves if [he]67-bonaparte slept out in [the field]301-the field all night . But more than an hour passed , and no footstep approached .

Then [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte made [his]67-bonaparte way back to [the cabin]460-the cabin . [He]67-bonaparte buttoned the door and put the table against it and , giving the dog a kick to silence [his]67-bonaparte whining when the foot throbbed , [he]67-bonaparte climbed into bed . [He]67-bonaparte did not put out the light , for fear of the ghost , but , worn out with the sorrows of the day , was soon asleep [himself]67-bonaparte . About four o'clock [Waldo]60-waldo , lying between the seats of the horse - waggon , was awakened by a gentle touch on [his]60-waldo head . Sitting up , [he]60-waldo espied [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte looking through one of the windows with a lighted candle in [his]67-bonaparte hand . " [I]60-waldo 'm about to depart , [[my]60-waldo dear boy]3866-my dear boy , before [[my]60-waldo enemies]4069-my enemies arise ; and [I]60-waldo could not leave without coming to bid [you]60-waldo farewell , "[60-waldo] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . [Waldo]60-waldo looked at [him]67-bonaparte .

" [I]67-bonaparte shall always think of [you]60-waldo with affection , "[67-bonaparte]

said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . " And there 's that old hat of [yours]60-waldo , if [you]60-waldo could let [me]67-bonaparte have it for a keepsake "[67-bonaparte]

" Take it , "[67-bonaparte] said [Waldo]60-waldo . " [I]67-bonaparte thought [you]60-waldo would say so , so [I]67-bonaparte brought it with [me]67-bonaparte , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte , putting it on . " [The Lord]3492-the lord bless [you]60-waldo , [[my]67-bonaparte dear boy]3866-my dear boy . [You]60-waldo have n't a few shillings just a trifle [you]60-waldo do n't need , have [you]60-waldo ? "[67-bonaparte] " Take the two shillings that are in the broken vase . "[67-bonaparte] " May the blessing of [[my]67-bonaparte God]3633-my god rest upon [you]60-waldo , [[my]67-bonaparte dear child]4013-my dear child , "[67-bonaparte] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte ; " may [He]3633-my god guide and bless [you]60-waldo . Give [me]1377-me [your]60-waldo hand . "[1377-me] [Waldo]60-waldo folded [his]60-waldo arms closely , and lay down . " Farewell , adieu ! "[1399-them] said [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte . " May the blessing of [[my]135-matthew God]3633-my god and [[my]135-matthew father]3420-my father 's God rest on [you]60-waldo , now and evermore . "[135-matthew] With these words the head and nose withdrew themselves , and the light vanished from the window .

After a few moments [the boy , lying in the waggon]1369-the boy , lying in the waggon , heard stealthy footsteps as [they]1370-they passed [the waggon - house]229-the waggon - house and made [their]1370-they way down [the road]888-the road . [He]1369-the boy , lying in the waggon listened as [they]1370-they grew fainter and fainter , and at last died away altogether ; and from that night the footstep of [Bonaparte Blenkins]67-bonaparte was heard no more at [the old farm]1373-the old farm . END Of PART I.

PART II .

" And it was all play , and [no one]237-no one could tell what [it]4077-it had lived and worked for . A striving , and a striving , and an ending in nothing . "[1409-the old wise people]

CHAPTER I. Times and Seasons .

[WALDO]60-waldo lay on [his]60-waldo stomach on [the sand]287-the sand . Since [he]60-waldo prayed and howled to [[his]60-waldo God]1375-his god in [the fuel - house]1284-the fuel - house three years had passed .

[They]1377-me say that in [the world to come]1378-the world to come time is not measured out by months and years . Neither is it here . [The soul]1379-the soul 's life has seasons of its own ; periods not found in any calendar , times that years and months will not scan , but which are as deftly and sharply cut off from one another as the smoothly - arranged years which [the earth]335-the earth 's motion yields [us]1381-we .

To stranger eyes these divisions are not evident ; but [each]1382-each , looking back at the little

track [his]1382-each consciousness illuminates , sees it cut into distinct portions , whose boundaries are the termination of mental states .

As [man]329-man differs from [man]329-man , so differ [these souls]1385-these souls ' years . The most material life is not devoid of them ; the story of the most spiritual is told in [them]1385-these souls . And it may chance that [some]1386-some , looking back , see the past cut out after this fashion :

[I.]1387-i. The year of infancy , where from the shadowy background of forgetfulness start out pictures of startling clearness , disconnected , but brightly coloured , and indelibly printed in the mind . Much that follows fades , but the colours of those baby - pictures are permanent . There rises , perhaps , a warm summer 's evening ; [we]1381-we are seated on the door - step ; [we]1381-we have yet the taste of the bread and milk in [our]1381-we mouth , and the red sunset is reflected in [our]1381-we basin .

Then there is a dark night , where , waking with a nameless fear , [we]1381-we run from [our]1381-we own bed to another , creep close to [some large figure]1388-some large figure , and are comforted . Then there is remembrance of the pride when , on [some one]3445-some one 's shoulder , with [our]1381-we arms around [their]3445-some one head , [we]1381-we ride to see the little pigs . Remembrance of delight in the feel and smell of the first orange [we]1381-we ever see ; of sorrow which makes [us]1381-we put up [our]1381-we lip , and cry hard , when one morning [we]1381-we run out to try and catch the dew - drops , and they melt and wet [our]1381-we little fingers ; of almighty and despairing sorrow when [we]1381-we are lost behind the kraals , and can not see [the house]206-the house anywhere . And then one picture starts out more vividly than any .

There has been a thunder - storm ; the ground , as far as the eye can reach , is covered with white hail ; the clouds are gone , and overhead a deep blue sky is showing ; far off a great

rainbow rests on [the white earth]1391-the white earth . [We]1381-we , standing in a window to look , feel the cool , unspeakably sweet wind blowing in on [us]1381-we , and a feeling of longing comes over [us]1381-we unutterable longing , [we]1381-we can not tell for what . [We]1381-we look at [the white earth]1391-the white earth , and the rainbow , and the blue sky ; and oh , [we]1381-we want it , [we]1381-we want [we]1381-we do not know what . [We]1381-we cry as though [our]1381-we heart was broken . When [one]324-one lifts [our]1381-we little body from the window [we]1381-we can not tell what ails [us]1381-we . [We]1381-we run away to play .

So looks the first year .

II . Now the pictures become continuous and connected . Material things still rule , but [the spiritual and intellectual]1394-the spiritual and intellectual take their places .

In the dark night when [we]1381-we are afraid [we]1381-we pray and shut [our]1381-we eyes . [We]1381-we press [our]1381-we fingers very hard upon the lids , and see dark spots

moving round and round , and [we]1381-we know they are heads and wings of angels sent to take care of [us]1381-we , seen dimly in the dark as [they]1395-they move round [our]1381-we bed . It is very consoling .

In the day [we]1381-we learn [our]1381-we letters , and are troubled because [we]1381-we can not see why k - n - o - w should be know , and p - s - a - l - m psalm . [They]1395-they tell [us]1381-we it is so because it is so . [We]1381-we are not satisfied ; [we]1381-we hate to learn ; [we]1381-we like better to build [little stone houses]1396-little stone houses . [We]1381-we can build [them]1396-little stone houses as [we]1381-we please , and know the reason for them .

Other joys too [we]1381-we have incomparably greater . [We]1381-we are run through with a shudder of delight when in [the red sand]1397-the red sand [we]1381-we come on one of those white wax - flowers that lie between their two green leaves flat on [the sand]287-the sand . [We]1381-we hardly dare pick them , but [we]1381-we feel compelled to do so ; and [we]1381-we smell and smell till the delight becomes almost pain . Afterwards [we]1381-we pull the green leaves softly into pieces to see the silk threads run across .

Beyond the " kopje "[56-god] grow some dull - green ,

hairy - leaved bushes . [We]1381-we are so small they meet over [our]1381-we head ; and [we]1381-we sit among [them]1399-them , and talk to [them]1399-them , and kiss [them]1399-them , and [they]1399-them love [us]1381-we back .

One day [we]1381-we sit there and look up at the blue sky , and down at [our]1381-we fat little knees ; and suddenly it strikes [us]1381-we , Who are [we]1381-we ? This [I]0-i , what is it ? [We]1381-we try to look in upon [ourselves]1381-we , and ourself beats back upon ourself . Then [we]1381-we get up in great fear and run [home]302-home as hard as [we]1381-we can . [We]1381-we ca n't tell [any one]504-any one what frightened [us]1381-we . [We]1381-we never quite lose that feeling of self again .

III . And then a new time rises . [We]1381-we are seven years old . [We]1381-we can read now read the Bible . Best of all [we]1381-we like the story of [Elijah]134-elijah in [[his]134-elijah cave at [Horeb]30-horeb]1402-his cave at horeb , and the still small voice .

One day , a notable one , [we]1381-we read on the

" kopje , "[1381-we] and discover the fifth chapter of [Matthew]135-matthew , and read it all through . Then [we]1381-we tuck the Bible under [our]1381-we arm and rush [home]302-home . [They]1404-they did n't know it was wicked to take [your]1405-your things again if [some one]3445-some one took [them]1407-them , wicked to go to law , wicked to ! [We]1381-we are quite breathless when [we]1381-we get to [the house]206-the house ; [we]1381-we tell [them]1404-they [we]1381-we have discovered a chapter [they]1404-they never heard of ; [we]1381-we tell [them]1404-they what it says . [The old wise people]1409-the old wise people tell [us]1381-we [they]1409-the old wise people knew all about it . [Our]1381-we discovery is a mare's - nest to [them]1409-the old wise people ; but to [us]1381-we it is very real . The ten commandments and the old " Thou shalt "[100-jeremiah] [we]1381-we have heard about long enough and do n't care about it ; but this new law sets [us]1381-we on fire . [We]1381-we will deny ourself . [Our]1381-we little waggon that [we]1381-we have made , [we]1381-we give to [the little Kaffirs]1410-the little kaffirs . [We]1381-we keep quiet when [they]1410-the little kaffirs throw sand at [us]1381-we feeling , oh , so happy . [We]1381-we conscientiously put the cracked tea - cup for [ourselves]1381-we at breakfast , and take the burnt roaster - cake . [We]1381-we save [our]1381-we money , and buy threepence of tobacco

for [the Hottentot maid who calls [us]1381-we names]1411-the hottentot maid who calls us names . [We]1381-we are exotically virtuous . At night [we]1381-we are profoundly religious ; even the ticking watch says , " Eternity , eternity ! hell , hell , hell ! "[100-jeremiah] and the silence talks of [God]56-god .

Occasionally , also , unpleasantly shrewd questions begin to be asked by something , [we]1381-we know not what , in [ourselves]1381-we . [We]1381-we get to know [him]56-god better afterward . [We]1381-we carry the questions to [the grown - up people]1412-the grown - up people . [They]1412-the grown - up people give [us]1381-we answers ; [we]1381-we are more or less satisfied for the time . [The grown - up people]1412-the grown - up people are very wise , and [they]1412-the grown - up people say it was kind of [God]56-god to make [hell]4026-hell , and very loving of [Him]56-god to send [men there]1415-men there ; and besides , [He]56-god could n't help [Himself]56-god , and [they]1412-the grown - up people are very wise , [we]1381-we think , so [we]1381-we believe [them]1412-the grown - up people .

IV .

Then a new time comes of which the leading feature is , that the shrewd questions are asked

louder . [We]1381-we carry them to [the grown - up people]1412-the grown - up people ; [they]1412-the grown - up people answer [us]1381-we , and [we]1381-we are not satisfied .

And now between [us]1381-we and the dear old world of the senses the spirit - world begins to peep in , and wholly clouds it over . What are the flowers to [us]1381-we ? [They]1417-they are fuel waiting for the great burning . [We]1381-we look at the walls of [the farmhouse]643-the farmhouse and the matter - of - fact sheep " kraals , "[1420-their] with the merry sunshine playing over all , and do not see it . But [we]1381-we see a great white throne , and [Him]56-god that sits on it . Around [Him]56-god stand a great multitude that [no man]339-no man can number , harpers harping with [their]1420-their harps , a thousand times ten thousand , and thousands of thousands . How white are [their]1420-their robes , washed in the blood of [the Lamb]136-the lamb ! And the music rises higher , and rends the vault of [heaven]3422-heaven with its unutterable sweetness . And [we]1381-we , as [we]1381-we listen , ever and anon , as it sinks on the sweetest , lowest note , hear a groan of the damned from below . [We]1381-we shudder in the sunlight .

" The torment , "[138-wesley] says [Jeremy Taylor]100-jeremiah , whose sermons [[our]1381-we father]4033-our father reads aloud in the evening , " comprises as many torments as the body of [man]329-man has joints , sinews , arteries , c. , being caused by that penetrating and real fire , of which this temporal fire is but a painted fire . What comparison will there be between burning for a hundred years ' space and to be burning without intermission as long as [God]56-god is [God]56-god ? "[138-wesley]

[We]1381-we remember the sermon there in the sunlight . [One]137-one comes and asks why [we]1381-we sit there nodding so moodily . Ah , [they]1420-their do not see what [we]1381-we see .

" A moment 's time , [a narrow space]4079-a narrow space , Divides [me]3496-the devil from [that heavenly place]4080-that heavenly place , Or shuts [me]3496-the devil up in [hell]4026-hell . "[3496-the devil]

So says [Wesley]138-wesley 's hymn , which [we]1381-we sing evening by evening . What matter sunshine and walls , [men]3470-men and books ?

" The things which are seen are temporal , but[3496-the devil]

the things which are not seen are eternal . " They are real .[3496-the devil]

The Bible [we]1381-we bear always in [our]1381-we breast ; its pages are [our]1381-we food ; [we]1381-we learn to repeat it ; [we]1381-we weep much , for in sunshine and in shade , in the early morning or the late evening , in [the field]301-the field or in [the house]206-the house , [the Devil]3496-the devil walks with [us]1381-we . [He]3496-the devil comes to [a real person]1427-a real person , copper - coloured face , head a little on one side , forehead knit , asking questions . Believe [me]0-i , it would be better to be followed by three deadly diseases than by [him]3496-the devil . [He]3496-the devil is never silenced , never satisfied without mercy . Though the drops of blood stand out on [your]1428-you heart [he]3496-the devil will put [his]3496-the devil question . Softly [he]3496-the devil comes up [we]1381-we are only [a wee bit child]1429-a wee bit child , mark [you]1428-you ; " Is it good of [God]56-god to make hell ? Presently [he]3496-the devil comes back .

" Do [you]1428-you love [Him]3496-the devil ? "[3496-the devil] waits a little . " Do[1381-we]

[We]1381-we say [we]1381-we try to . " But do [you]1428-you ? "[1381-we] Then [he]3496-the devil goes off . It is nothing to [him]3496-the devil if [we]1381-we go quite mad with fear at [our]1381-we own wickedness . [He]3496-the devil asks on , [the questioning Devil]1430-the questioning devil ; [he]3496-the devil cares nothing what [he]3496-the devil says . [We]1381-we long to tell [some one]3445-some one , that [they]3445-some one may share [our]1381-we pain . [We]1381-we do not yet know that the cup of affliction is made with such a narrow mouth that only one lip can drink at a time , and that [each man]1432-each man 's cup is made to match [his]1432-each man lip .

One day [we]1381-we try to tell [some one]3445-some one . Then a grave head is shaken solemnly at [us]1381-we . [We]1381-we are wicked , very wicked , [they]3445-some one say [we]1381-we ought not to have such thoughts . [God]56-god is good , very good . [We]1381-we are wicked , very wicked . That is the comfort [we]1381-we get . Wicked ! Oh , [Lord]1434-lord ! do [we]1381-we not know it ? Is it not the sense of [our]1381-we own exceeding wickedness that is drying up [our]1381-we

young heart , filling it with sand , making all life a dust - bin for [us]1381-we ?

Wicked ? [We]1381-we know it ! Too vile to live , too vile to die , too vile to creep over this , [[God]56-god 's earth]1435-god 's earth , and move among [[His]56-god believing men]1436-his believing men . This time great eyes look at [us]1381-we wondering , and lovely little lips say ,

" If it makes [you]4083-you so unhappy to think of these things , why do [you]4083-you not think of something else , and forget ? "[1381-we]

Forget ? [We]1381-we turn away and shrink into ourself . Forget ? and think of other things ? Oh , [God]56-god ! do [they]1439-they not understand that [the material world]1440-the material world is but a film , through every pore of which [[God]56-god 's awful spirit world]1441-god 's awful spirit world is shining through on [us]1381-we , [poor miserable little wretches that [we]1381-we are]1442-poor miserable little wretches that we are ? [We]1381-we keep as far from others as [we]1381-we can .

One night , [we]1381-we kneel in the window ; [every one

else]1443-every one else sleeps , but [we]1381-we kneel reading by the moonlight . It is only a chapter of [the prophets]1444-the prophets , telling how [the chosen people of God]1445-the chosen people of god shall be carried on [the Gentiles]1446-the gentiles ' shoulders . Surely [the Devil]3496-the devil might leave [us]1381-we alone ; there is not much to handle for [him]3496-the devil there . But presently [we]1381-we hear [him]3496-the devil .

" Is it right there should be [a chosen people]4084-a chosen people ? If [you]4084-a chosen people should be chosen out , would it be right , fair ? "[56-god] How can [we]1381-we answer [him]3496-the devil ? [We]1381-we were feeling so good till [he]3496-the devil came . [We]1381-we put [our]1381-we head down on the Bible and blister it with tears . Then [we]1381-we fold [our]1381-we hands over [our]1381-we head and pray , till [our]1381-we teeth grind together . Oh , that from that spirit - world , so real and yet so silent , that surrounds [us]1381-we , one word would come to guide [us]1381-we ! [We]1381-we are left alone with [this devil]1448-this devil ; [the angels]638-the angels do not come . Suddenly [we]1381-we seize the Bible , turning it round and round , and say hurriedly , " It will be [God]56-god 's voice speaking to [us]1381-we ; [His]56-god voice as though [we]1381-we heard it . "[56-god]

[We]1381-we yearn , oh , so hugrily , for a token from the inexorably silent One . [We]1381-we turn the book , put [our]1381-we finger down on a page , and bend to read by the moonlight . It is [God]56-god 's answer . [We]1381-we tremble . " Then fourteen years after [I]1455-methodists went up again to [Jerusalem]32-jerusalem with [Barnabas]139-barnabas , and took [Titus]140-titus with [me]1455-methodists also . "[1455-methodists]

For an instant [our]1381-we imagination seizes it ; [we]1381-we are twisting , twirling , trying to make an allegory . The fourteen years are fourteen months ; [we]1381-we are [Paul]127-paul and [the devil]3496-the devil is [Barnabas]139-barnabas , [Titus]140-titus is Then a sudden loathing comes to [us]1381-we : [we]1381-we are [liars]3500-liars and hypocrites , [we]1381-we are trying to deceive [ourselves]1381-we . What is [Paul]127-paul to [us]1381-we and [Jerusalem]32-jerusalem ? Who are [Barnabas]139-barnabas and [Titus]140-titus ? [We]1381-we know not [the men]1452-the men . This is no answer . Before [we]1381-we know [we]1381-we seize the book , swing it round [our]1381-we head , and fling it with all [our]1381-we might to the farthest end of [the room]215-the room . [We]1381-we put down [our]1381-we head again and weep . [Youth]141-youth and ignorance yearning for light :

is there anything else that can weep so ? It is as though the tears were drops of blood congealed beneath the eyelids ; nothing else is like those tears . After a long time , when [we]1381-we are weak with crying , and lie silent , by chance [we]1381-we knock against the wood that stops the broken pane . It falls . Upon [our]1381-we hot stiff face a sweet breath of wind blows . [We]1381-we raise [our]1381-we head , and with [our]1381-we swollen eyes look out at [the beautiful still world]1454-the beautiful still world , and the sweet night wind blows in upon [us]1381-we , holy and gentle , like a loving breath from the lips of [God]56-god . Over [us]1381-we a deep peace comes , a calm , still joy ; the tears now flow readily and softly . Oh , the unutterable gladness ! At last , at last [we]1381-we have found it ! " The peace with [God]56-god . "[1455-methodists] " The sense of sins forgiven . "[1455-methodists] All doubt vanished , [God]56-god 's voice in the soul , [the Holy Spirit]142-the holy spirit filling [us]1381-we ! [We]1381-we feel [Him]56-god ! [we]1381-we feel [Him]56-god ! Oh , [Jesus Christ]61-jesus christ ! through [you]61-jesus christ , through [you]61-jesus christ , this joy ! [We]1381-we press [our]1381-we hands upon [our]1381-we breast and look upward with adoring gladness . Soft waves of bliss break

through [us]1381-we . " The peace with [God]56-god . "[1381-we] " The sense of sins forgiven . "[1464-those know who have felt it] [Methodists]1455-methodists and [Revivalists]1456-revivalists say the words , and the mocking world shoots out its lip , and walks by smiling " Hypocrite ! "[1381-we]

There are more [fools]1457-fools and fewer hypocrites than [the wise world]1458-the wise world dreams of . [Hypocrites]143-hypocrites are rare as icebergs in [the tropics]1459-the tropics ; [fools]1457-fools common as buttercups beside a water - furrow : whether [you]61-jesus christ go this way or that [you]61-jesus christ tread on them ; [you]61-jesus christ dare not look at [your]61-jesus christ own reflection in [the water]1461-the water but [you]61-jesus christ see one . There is no ca nt phrase , rotten with age , but it was the dress of a living body ; none but at heart it signifies a real bodily or mental condition .

After hours and nights of frenzied fear of the supernatural , desire to appease the power above , a fierce quivering excitement in every inch of nerve and blood - vessel , there comes a time when nature can not

endure

longer , and the spring long bent recoils . [We]1381-we sink down emasculated . Up creeps the deadly delicious calm .

" [I]3496-the devil have blotted out as a cloud [thy]4085-thy sins , and as a thick cloud [thy]4085-thy trespasses , and will remember them no more for ever . "[3496-the devil] [We]1381-we weep with soft transporting joy . [A few]1462-a few experience this ; [many]1463-many imagine [they]1463-many experience it , one here and there lies about it . In the main , " The peace with [God]56-god ; a sense of sins forgiven , "[61-jesus christ] stands for a certain mental and physical reaction . Its reality [those know who have felt it]1464-those know who have felt it . And [we]1381-we , on that moonlight night , put down [our]1381-we head on the window , " Oh , [God]56-god ! [we]1381-we are happy , happy ; [[thy]56-god child]4086-thy child forever . Oh , thank [you]56-god , [God]56-god ! "[1486-the drunken kaffir] and [we]1381-we drop asleep . Next morning the Bible [we]1381-we kiss . [We]1381-we are [God]56-god 's forever . [We]1381-we go out to work , and it goes happily all day , happily all night ; but hardly so happily , not happily at all , the next day ; and the next night [the devil]3496-the devil asks [us]1381-we , " Where is [your]1381-we Holy Spirit ? "[1494-the poor , sleepy , half - dead devil] [We]1381-we can not tell .

So month by month , summer and winter , [the old life]1466-the old life goes on reading , praying , weeping , praying . [They]1466-the old life tell [us]1381-we [we]1381-we become utterly stupid . [We]1381-we know it . Even the multiplication table [we]1381-we learnt with so much care [we]1381-we forgot . The physical world recedes further and further from [us]1381-we . Truly [we]1381-we love not [the world]252-the world , neither the things that are in [it]252-the world . Across the bounds of sleep [our]1381-we grief follows [us]1381-we . When [we]1381-we wake in the night [we]1381-we are sitting up in bed weeping bitterly , or find [ourself]1468-ourself outside in the moonlight , dressed , and walking up and down , and wringing [our]1381-we hands , and [we]1381-we can not tell how [we]1381-we came [there]317-there . So pass two years , as [men]3470-men reckon [them]1471-them .

V. Then a new time . Before [us]1381-we there were three courses possible to go mad , to die , to sleep .

[We]1381-we take the latter course ; nature takes it for [us]1381-we . All things take rest in sleep ; the beast , bird , the very flowers close [their]3470-men eyes , and the streams are frozen in winter . All things take rest in sleep ; then why not the human reason also ? So [we]1381-we drop asleep , and in that sleep a beautiful dream rises for [us]1381-we . Though [you]1472-you hear all the dreams of [men]3470-men , [you]1472-you will hardly find a prettier one than [ours]1381-we . It ran so : In the centre of all things is a Mighty Heart , which , having begotten all things , loves [them]3470-men ; and , having born [them]3470-men into life , beats with great throbs of love towards [them]3470-men . No death for [[His]1474-his dear insects]1475-his dear insects , no hell for [[His]1474-his loved men]1476-his loved men , no burning up for [[His]1474-his dear world]1477-his dear world [His]1474-his own , [own world]1478-own world ! In the end all will be well . Do not ask [us]1381-we how [we]1381-we make [our]1381-we dream tally with facts ; the glory of a dream is this that it despises facts , and makes its own . [Our]1381-we dream saves [us]1381-we from going mad ; that is enough .

[Its]1479-its peculiar point of sweetness lay here . When the Mighty Heart 's yearning of love became too great for other expression , it became the sweet Rose of [heaven]3422-heaven , [the beloved Man God]1481-the beloved man god . [Jesus]61-jesus christ ! [[you]61-jesus christ Jesus of [our]1381-we dream]1482-you jesus of our dream ! how [we]1381-we loved [you]61-jesus christ ; no Bible tells of [you]61-jesus christ as [we]1381-we know [you]61-jesus christ . [Your]61-jesus christ sweet hands held [ours]1381-we fast ; [your]61-jesus christ sweet voice said always , " [I]1494-the poor , sleepy , half - dead devil am here , [[my]1494-the poor , sleepy , half - dead devil loved]4087-my loved one , not far off ; put [your]61-jesus christ arms about [Me]1494-the poor , sleepy , half - dead devil . "[1494-the poor , sleepy , half - dead devil] [We]1381-we found [Him]61-jesus christ in everything in those days . When [the little weary lamb [we]1381-we drive [home]302-home]1483-the little weary lamb we drive home drags [its]1483-the little weary lamb we drive home feet , [we]1381-we seize on it , and carry [it]1483-the little weary lamb we drive home with its head against [our]1381-we face . [[His]61-jesus christ little lamb]1485-his little lamb ! [We]1381-we feel [we]1381-we have got [Him]61-jesus christ . When [the drunken Kaffir]1486-the drunken kaffir lies by [the road]888-the road in the sun [we]1381-we draw [his]1486-the drunken kaffir blanket over [his]1486-the drunken kaffir head , and put green branches of milk - bush on it . [[His]61-jesus christ Kaffir]1488-his kaffir ; why should the sun hurt [him]1486-the drunken kaffir ?

In the evening , when the clouds lift themselves like gates , and the red lights shine through them , [we]1381-we cry ; for in such glory [He]1486-the drunken kaffir will come ,

and the hands that ache to touch [Him]1486-the drunken kaffir will hold [him]1486-the drunken kaffir , and [we]1381-we shall see the beautiful hair and eyes of [[our]1381-we God]1489-our god .

" Lift up [your]1486-the drunken kaffir heads , O [ye]1486-the drunken kaffir gates ; and be [ye]1486-the drunken kaffir lifted up , [ye]1486-the drunken kaffir everlasting doors , and [[our]1381-we King of glory]4088-our king of glory shall come in ! "[1499-the poor , half - swamped devil] The purple flowers , the little purple flowers are [His]1486-the drunken kaffir eyes , looking at [us]1381-we . [We]1381-we kiss them , and kneel alone on [the flat]616-the flat , rejoicing over them . And [the wilderness]903-the wilderness and [the solitary place]1492-the solitary place shall be glad for [Him]1486-the drunken kaffir , and [the desert]4058-the desert shall rejoice and blossom as a rose . If ever in [our]1381-we tearful , joyful ecstasy [the poor , sleepy , half - dead devil]1494-the poor , sleepy , half - dead devil should raise [his]1494-the poor , sleepy , half - dead devil head , [we]1381-we laugh at [him]1494-the poor , sleepy , half - dead devil . It is not [his]1494-the poor , sleepy , half - dead devil hour now . " If there should be a hell , after all ! "[1499-the poor , half - swamped devil] [he]1494-the poor , sleepy , half - dead devil mutters . " If [[your]1496-you God]4089-your god should be cruel ! If there should be [no God]3882-no god ! If [you]1496-you should find out it is all imagination ! If "[1511-the man in the pulpit]

[We]1381-we laugh at [him]1494-the poor , sleepy , half - dead devil . When [a man]242-a man sits in the warm sunshine , do [you]1496-you ask [him]242-a man for proof of it ?

[He]242-a man feels that is all . And [we]1381-we feel that is all . [We]1381-we want no proof of [[our]1381-we God]1489-our god . [We]1381-we feel , [we]1381-we feel !

Do [we]1381-we believe in [[our]1381-we God]1489-our god because the Bible tells [us]1381-we of [Him]1489-our god ? [We]1381-we believe in the Bible because [He]1489-our god tells [us]1381-we of it . [We]1381-we feel [Him]1489-our god , [we]1381-we feel [Him]1489-our god , [we]1381-we feel that is all ! And [the poor , half - swamped Devil]1499-the poor , half - swamped devil mutters " But if the day should come when [you]1381-we do not feel ? "[1511-the man in the pulpit] And [we]1381-we laugh and cry [him]1499-the poor , half - swamped devil down . " It will never come never , never , "[56-god] and [the poor Devil]1500-the poor devil slinks to sleep again , with [his]1499-the poor , half - swamped devil tail between [his]1499-the poor , half - swamped devil legs . Fierce assertion many times repeated is hard to stand against . It is most wisely met by silence . Time separates the truth from the lie . So [we]1381-we dream on .

One day [we]1381-we go to [town]1501-town and to [church]1502-church . [The townspeople]1503-the townspeople rustle in in [their]1503-the townspeople silks , and [the men]1452-the men in [their]1452-the men sleek cloth , and settle [themselves]1452-the men in [their]1452-the men pews , and the light shines in through the windows on the artificial flowers in [the

women]1505-the women 's bonnets . [We]1381-we have the same miserable feeling that [we]1381-we have in [a shop where [all the clerks]1507-all the clerks are very smart]1506-a shop where all the clerks are very smart . [We]1381-we wish [[our]1381-we Father]4033-our father had n't brought [us]1381-we to [town]1501-town , and [we]1381-we were out on [the karroo]1510-the karroo . Then [the man in the pulpit]1511-the man in the pulpit begins to preach . [His]1511-the man in the pulpit text is " [He]1511-the man in the pulpit that believeth not shall be damned . "[1525-they]

The day before [an atheist]1512-an atheist has died in [the street]1513-the street , struck by lightning . [The man in the pulpit]1511-the man in the pulpit mentions no name ; but [he]1511-the man in the pulpit talks of " The hand of [God]56-god made visible among [us]1381-we . "[1526-we] [He]1511-the man in the pulpit tells [us]1381-we how , when the white stroke fell , quivering and naked , [the soul]1379-the soul fled , robbed of [his]1379-the soul earthly filament , and lay at the footstool of [God]56-god ; how over [its]1379-the soul head has been poured out the wrath of the Mighty One , whose existence it has denied ; and , quivering and terrified , it has fled to the everlasting night .

[We]1381-we , as [we]1381-we listen , half start up ; every drop of blood in [our]1381-we body has rushed to [our]1381-we head . [He]1511-the man in the pulpit lies ! [he]1511-the man in the pulpit lies ! [he]1511-the man in the pulpit lies ! [That man in the

pulpit]1516-that man in the pulpit lies ! Will [no one]237-no one stop [him]1511-the man in the pulpit ? Have [none of [them]1519-them]1518-none of them heard do [none of [them]1519-them]1518-none of them know , that when [the poor , dark soul]1521-the poor , dark soul shut [its]1521-the poor , dark soul eyes on earth it opened them in the still light of heaven ? that there is no wrath where [God]56-god is ? that if one could once creep to [the footstool of God]1522-the footstool of god , there is everlasting peace there ? While [the atheist]1523-the atheist lay wondering and afraid , [God]56-god bent down and said , " [[My]1526-we child]4091-my child , here [I]1526-we am [I]1526-we , whom [you]4091-my child have not known ; [I]1526-we , whom [you]4091-my child have not believed in ; [I]1526-we am here . [I]1526-we sent [[My]1526-we messenger]4092-my messenger , the white sheet - lightning , to call [you]4091-my child [home]302-home . [I]1526-we am here . "[1526-we]

Then [the poor soul]1524-the poor soul turned to the light [its]1524-the poor soul weakness and pain were gone for ever . Have [they]1525-they not known , have [they]1525-they not heard , who it is rules ? " For a little moment have [I]1560-i hidden [My]1560-i face from [thee]4091-my child ; but with everlasting kindness will [I]1560-i have mercy upon [thee]4091-my child , saith [the Lord [thy]4091-my child Redeemer]4094-the lord thy redeemer . "[1560-i]

[We]1526-we mutter on to [ourselves]1526-we , till [some one]3445-some one pulls

[us]1526-we violently by the arm to remind [us]1526-we [we]1526-we are in [church]1502-church . [We]1526-we see nothing but [our]1526-we own ideas .

Presently [every one]3534-every one turns to pray . There are [six hundred souls]1530-six hundred souls lifting [themselves]1530-six hundred souls to the Everlasting Light .

Behind [us]1526-we sit [two pretty ladies]1531-two pretty ladies ; one hands [her]1532-her scent - bottle softly to the other , and [a mother]1533-a mother pulls down [[her]1533-a mother little girl]1534-her little girl 's frock . [One lady]1535-one lady drops [her]1535-one lady handkerchief ; [a gentleman]441-a gentleman picks it up ; [she]1535-one lady blushes . [The women in the choir]1537-the women in the choir turn softly the leaves of [their]1537-the women in the choir tune - books , to be ready when the praying is done . It is as though [they]1537-the women in the choir thought more of the singing than [the Everlasting Father]1538-the everlasting father . Oh , would it not be more worship of [Him]1538-the everlasting father to sit alone in [the karoo]1539-the karoo and kiss one little field flower that [He]1538-the everlasting father had made ? Is it not mockery ? Then the thought comes , " What doest [thou]4095-thou here , [Elijah]134-elijah ? "[1560-i] [We]1526-we who judge , what are [we]1526-we better than [they]1540-they ? rather worse . Is it any excuse to say [we]1526-we are but [a child and must come]1541-a child and must come ? Does [God]56-god allow any soul to step in

between the spirit [he]1538-the everlasting father made and [himself]1538-the everlasting father ? What do [we]1526-we there in [that place]1542-that place , where all the words to [us]1526-we seem lies of [the All Father]117-father , and the worship a seeming . Filled with horror , [we]1526-we turn and flee out of [the place]3955-the place . On [the pavement]1544-the pavement [we]1526-we smite [our]1526-we foot , and swear in [[our]1526-we child]1545-our child 's soul , never again to enter those places where [men]3470-men come to worship . [We]1526-we are questioned afterwards . Why was it [we]1526-we went out of [church]1502-church ?

How can [we]1526-we explain ? [we]1526-we stand silent . Then [we]1526-we are pressed further , and [we]1526-we try to tell . Upon that a head is shaken solemnly at [us]1526-we . [No one]237-no one can think it wrong to go to [the house of [the Lord]3492-the lord]1549-the house of the lord ; it is the idle excuse of [a wicked boy]1551-a wicked boy . When will [we]1526-we think seriously of [our]1526-we souls , and love going to [church]1502-church ? [We]1526-we are wicked , very wicked . And [we]1526-we [we]1526-we slink away and go alone to cry . Will it be always so ? If [we]1526-we hate and doubt , or believe and love , to [our]1526-we dearest , are [we]1526-we to seem always wicked , wicked , wicked ? Nothing else !

[We]1526-we do not yet know that in the soul 's search for truth the bitterness lies here ; the striving can not always hide itself among the thoughts ; sooner or later it will clothe itself in outward action ; then it steps in and divides between [us]1526-we and [[our]1526-we nearest]1553-our nearest . All things on [earth]653-earth have [their]1555-their price ; and for truth [we]1526-we pay the dearest . [We]1526-we barter it for love and sympathy . [The road to honour]1556-the road to honour is paved with thorns ; but on the path to truth , at every step [you]1557-your set [your]1557-your foot down on [your]1557-your own heart .

VI . Then at last a new time the time of waking : short , sharp , and not pleasant . Sleep and dreams exist on this condition that [no one]237-no one wake [the dreamer]1559-the dreamer .

And life takes [us]1526-we up between [her]1560-i finger and thumb , shakes [us]1526-we furiously , till [our]1526-we poor

nodding head is well - nigh rolled from [our]1526-we shoulders , and [she]1560-i sets [us]1526-we down a little hard on the bare earth , bruised and sore , but preternaturally wide awake .

[We]1526-we have said in [our]1526-we days of dreaming , " Injustice and wrong are a seeming ; pain is a shadow . [[Our]1526-we God]1489-our god , [He]1489-our god is real , [He]1489-our god who made all things , and [He]1489-our god only is Love . "[1560-i]

Now life takes [us]1526-we by the neck and shows [us]1526-we a few other things , new - made graves with the red sand flying about them ; eyes that [we]1526-we love with the worms eating them ; [evil men walking sleek and fat]1561-evil men walking sleek and fat , and [she]1560-i says , " What do [you]1526-we think of these ? "[1560-i] [We]1526-we dare not say " Nothing . "[3882-no god] [We]1526-we feel them ! [we]1526-we feel them ! They are very real . But [we]1526-we try to lay [our]1526-we hands about and feel that other thing [we]1526-we felt before . In the dark night in [the fuel - room]1314-the fuel - room [we]1526-we cry to [our]1526-we Beautiful dream - god : " Oh , let [us]1526-we come near [you]4097-he , and lay [our]1526-we head against [your]4097-he feet . Now in [our]1526-we hour of need be near[3882-no god]

[us]1526-we . " But [He]4097-he is not there ; [He]4097-he is gone away . [The old questioning Devil]4098-the old questioning devil is there ; but [He]4097-he is not there ; [He]4097-he is gone away .[1564-the old god that our fathers handed down to us , that we hated , and never liked]

[We]1526-we must have been awakened sooner or later . The imagination can not always triumph over reality , the desires over truth . [We]1526-we must have been awakened . If it was done a little sharply , what matter ? it was done thoroughly .

VII . And a new life begins for [us]1526-we a new time : the old looks indeed like a long hot delirium , peopled with phantasies .

Now [we]1526-we have [no God]3882-no god . [We]1526-we have had two : [the old God that [[our]1526-we fathers]1565-our fathers handed down to [us]1526-we , that [we]1526-we hated , and never liked]1564-the old god that our fathers handed down to us , that we hated , and never liked : the new one that [we]1526-we made for [ourselves]1526-we , that [we]1526-we loved ; but one day [he]1564-the old god that our fathers handed down to us , that we hated , and never liked flitted away with the feelings that gave [him]1564-the old god that our fathers handed down to us , that we hated , and never liked birth , and [we]1526-we saw what [he]1564-the old god that our fathers handed down to us , that we hated , and never liked was made

of the shadow of [our]1526-we highest ideal , crowned and throned . Now [we]1526-we have [no God]3882-no god ; [we]1526-we sit down without any .

" [The fool]4099-the fool hath said in [his]4099-the fool heart , "[1526-we] There is no God.í " It may be so . Most things said or written have been the work of [fools]1457-fools .[1526-we]

[This thing]1567-this thing is certain [he]1564-the old god that our fathers handed down to us , that we hated , and never liked is [a fool who says , " [No man hath]4102-no man hath said in [his]4099-the fool heart]4101-a fool who says , " no man hath said in his heart , There is [no God]3882-no god . "[1575-a sentient being writhing in impotent anguish]

It has been said many thousand times in hearts with profound earnestess and bitter faith . [We]1526-we do not cry and weep ; [we]1526-we sit down with great cold eyes and look at [the world]252-the world . [We]1526-we are not miserable . Why should [we]1526-we be ? [We]1526-we eat and drink , and sleep all night ; but [the dead]1569-the dead are not colder . And [we]1526-we say it slowly , but without sighing , " Yes , [we]1526-we see it now : there is [no God]3882-no god . "[1526-we]

And , [we]1526-we add , growing a little colder yet , " There is no justice . The ox dies in the yoke , beneath [its master]4105-its master 's whip ; it turns its anguish-[4108-the new man]

filled eyes on the sunlight , but there is no sign of recompense to be made it . [The black man]1570-the black man is shot like a dog , and it goes well with [the shooter]1571-the shooter . [The innocent]1572-the innocent are accused and [the accuser]1573-the accuser triumphs . If [you]1574-you will take the trouble to scratch the surface anywhere , [you]1574-you will see under the skin [a sentient being writhing in impotent anguish]1575-a sentient being writhing in impotent anguish . "[60-waldo]

And , [we]1526-we say further , and [our]1526-we heart is as the heart of the dead for coldness , " There is no orderer and no order : all things are driven about by a blind chance . "[54-em]

What a soul drinks in with [its]1576-its mother 's milk will not leave it in a day . From [our]1526-we earliest hour [we]1526-we have been taught that the thought of the heart , the shaping of the rain - cloud , the amount of wool that grows on a sheep 's back , the length of a drought , and the growing of the corn , depend on nothing that moves immutable , deep at the heart of all things ; but on the changeable will of [a changeable being]1577-a changeable being , whom [our]1526-we prayers can

alter . To [us]1526-we , from the beginning , nature has been but a poor plastic thing , to be toyed with this way or that , as [man]329-man happens to please [[his]329-man deity]1579-his deity or not ; to go to [church]1502-church or not ; to say [his]329-man prayers right or not ; to travel on a Sunday or not . Was it possible for [us]1526-we in an instant to see [Nature]144-nature as [she]144-nature is the flowing vestment of an unchanging reality ? When the soul breaks free from the arms of a superstition , bits of the claws and talons break themselves off in [him]329-man . It is not the work of a day to squeeze them out .

And so , for [us]1526-we , [the human - like driver and guider]1581-the human - like driver and guider being gone , all existence , as [we]1526-we look out at [it]1582-it with [our]1526-we chilled , wondering eyes , is an aimless rise and swell of shifting waters . In all that weltering chaos [we]1526-we can see no spot so large as [a man]242-a man 's hand on which [we]1526-we may plant [our]1526-we foot .

Whether [a man]242-a man believes in [a human - like God]1585-a human - like god or no is a small thing . It is a great and terrible when [he]242-a man looks into the mental and physical world and sees no relation between cause
