" No , [we]4588-us will work , "[60-waldo] [he]60-waldo said . [She]2467-she moved closer to [him]60-waldo and lay still , [his]60-waldo black curls touching [her]2467-she smooth little head . [Doss]70-doss , who had lain at [[his]70-doss master]361-his master 's side , climbed over the bench , and curled [himself]70-doss up in [her]2467-she lap . [She]2467-she drew [her]2467-she skirt up over [him]70-doss , and [the three]3911-the three sat motionless for a long time . " [Waldo]60-waldo , "[2467-she] [she]2467-she said , suddenly , " [they]3911-the three are laughing at [us]4588-us . "[2467-she] " Who ? "[60-waldo] [he]60-waldo asked , starting up .

" [They]3911-the three the stars ! "[60-waldo] [she]2467-she said , softly . " Do [you]60-waldo not see ? there is a little white , mocking finger pointing down at [us]4588-us from each one of [them]3911-the three ! [We]4588-us are talking of to - morrow , and to - morrow , and [our]4588-us hearts are so strong ; [we]4588-us are not thinking of something that can touch [us]4588-us softly in the dark and make [us]4588-us still forever . [They]3911-the three are laughing at [us]4588-us , [Waldo]60-waldo . "[60-waldo] [Both]750-both sat looking upward . " Do [you]2467-she ever pray ? "[60-waldo] [he]60-waldo asked [her]2467-she in a low voice . " No . "[2467-she] " [I]2467-she never do ; but [I]2467-she might when [I]2467-she look up there . [I]2467-she will tell [you]2467-she , "[2467-she] [he]60-waldo added , in a still lower voice , " where [I]156-gregory could pray . If there were a wall of rock on the edge of [a world]4589-a world , and one rock stretched out far into space , and [I]156-gregory stood alone upon [it]4590-it , alone with stars above [me]156-gregory , and stars below . [I]156-gregory would not say anything ; but the feeling would be prayer . "[156-gregory]

There was an end to [their]750-both conversation after that , and [Doss]70-doss fell asleep on [her]2467-she knee . At last the night wind grew very chilly . " Ah , "[2467-she] [she]2467-she said , shivering , and drawing the skirt about [her]2467-she shoulders , " [I]2467-she am cold . Span in the horses , and call [me]2467-she when [you]156-gregory are ready . "[2467-she] [She]2467-she slipped down and walked toward [the house]206-the house , [Doss]70-doss stiffly following [her]2467-she , not pleased at being roused . At the door [she]2467-she met [Gregory]156-gregory . " [I]156-gregory have been looking for [you]2467-she everywhere ; may [I]156-gregory not drive [you]2467-she [home]302-home ? "[156-gregory] [he]156-gregory said . " [Waldo]60-waldo drives [me]156-gregory , "[156-gregory] [she]2467-she replied , passing on ; and it appeared to [Gregory]156-gregory that [she]2467-she looked at [him]156-gregory in the old way , without seeing [him]156-gregory . But before [she]2467-she had reached the door an idea had occurred to [her]2467-she , for [she]2467-she turned . " If [you]156-gregory wish to drive [me]156-gregory [you]156-gregory may . "[156-gregory] [Gregory]156-gregory went to look for [Em]54-em , whom [he]156-gregory found pouring out coffee in [the back room]2472-the back room . [He]156-gregory put [his]156-gregory hand quickly on [her]2467-she shoulder .

" [You]2467-she must ride with [Waldo]60-waldo ; [I]156-gregory am going to drive [[your]2467-she cousin]4277-your cousin [home]302-home . "[156-gregory] " But [I]2473-you ca n't come just now , [Greg]156-gregory ; [I]2473-you promised [Tante Annie]174-tante annie to look after the things while [she]174-tante annie went to rest a little . "[2473-you] " Well , [you]2473-you can come presently , ca n't [you]2473-you ? [I]156-gregory did n't say [you]2473-you were to come now . [I]156-gregory 'm sick of this thing , "[156-gregory] said [Gregory]156-gregory , turning sharply on [his]156-gregory heel . " Why must [I]156-gregory sit up the whole night because [[your]2473-you step - mother]4594-your step - mother chooses to get married ? "[156-gregory] " Oh , it 's all right , [Greg]156-gregory , [I]2473-you only meant "[2473-you] But [he]156-gregory did not hear [her]2473-you , and [a man]242-a man had come up to have [his]242-a man cup filled . An hour after [Waldo]60-waldo came in to look for [her]2473-you , and found [her]2473-you still busy at the table . " The horses are ready , "[54-em] [he]156-gregory said ; " but if [you]2473-you would like to have one dance more [I]60-waldo will wait . "[60-waldo] [She]2473-you shook [her]2473-you head wearily . " No ; [I]54-em am quite ready . [I]54-em want to go . "[54-em]

And soon [they]2475-they were on the sandy road [the buggy]2476-the buggy had travelled an hour before . [Their]2475-they horses , with heads close together , nodding sleepily as [they]2475-they walked in the starlight , [you]2477-you might have counted the rise and fall of [their]2475-they feet in the sand ; and [Waldo]60-waldo in [his]60-waldo saddle nodded drowsily also . Only [Em]54-em was awake , and watched [the starlit road]2478-the starlit road with wide - open eyes . At last [she]54-em spoke . " [I]60-waldo wonder if [all people]4595-all people feel so old , so very old , when [they]4595-all people get to be seventeen . "[60-waldo] " Not older than before , "[60-waldo] said [Waldo]60-waldo sleepily , pulling at [his]60-waldo bridle . Presently [she]54-em said again , " [I]60-waldo wish [I]60-waldo could have been [a little child]3461-a little child always . [You]60-waldo are good then . [You]60-waldo are never selfish ; [you]60-waldo like [every one]3534-every one to have everything ; but when [you]60-waldo are grown - up there are some things [you]60-waldo like to have all to [yourself]60-waldo , [you]60-waldo do n't like [any one else]4268-any one else to have any of them . "[60-waldo]

" Yes , "[54-em] said [Waldo]60-waldo sleepily , and [she]54-em did not speak again . When [they]2479-they reached [the farm - house]211-the farm - house all was dark , for [Lyndall]59-lyndall had retired as soon as [they]2479-they got [home]302-home . [Waldo]60-waldo lifted [Em]54-em from [her]54-em saddle , and for a moment [she]54-em leaned [her]54-em head on [his]60-waldo shoulder and clung to [him]60-waldo . " [You]54-em are very tired , "[54-em] [he]60-waldo said , as [he]60-waldo walked with [her]54-em to the door ; " let [me]54-em go in and light a candle for [you]54-em . "[54-em] " No , thank [you]60-waldo ; it is all right , "[54-em] [she]54-em said . " Good night , [Waldo]60-waldo , [dear]3635-dear . "[59-lyndall] But when [she]54-em went in [she]54-em sat long alone in the dark .

CHAPTER VII . [WALDO]60-waldo GOES OUT TO [TASTE LIFE]175-taste life , AND [EM]54-em STAYS AT HOME AND TASTES [IT]2482-it .

AT nine o'clock in the evening , packing [his]60-waldo bundles for the next morning 's start , [Waldo]60-waldo looked up , and was surprised to see [Em]54-em 's yellow head peeping in at [his]60-waldo door . It was many a month since [she]54-em had been [there]317-there . [She]54-em said [she]54-em had made [him]60-waldo sandwiches for [his]60-waldo journey , and [she]54-em stayed a while to help [him]60-waldo put [his]60-waldo goods into the saddle - bags .

" [You]60-waldo can leave the old things lying about , "[54-em] [she]54-em said ; " [I]156-gregory will lock [the room]215-the room , and keep it waiting for [you]60-waldo to come back some day . "[156-gregory]

To come back some day ! Would the bird ever

return to its cage ? But [he]60-waldo thanked [her]54-em . When [she]54-em went away [he]60-waldo stood on the doorstep holding the candle till [she]54-em had almost reached [the house]206-the house . But [Em]54-em was that evening in no hurry to enter , and instead of going in at the back door , walked with lagging footsteps round the low brick wall that ran before [the house]206-the house . Opposite the open window of [the parlour]2486-the parlour [she]54-em stopped . [The little room]521-the little room , kept carefully closed in Tant ' [Sannie]53-tant ' sannie 's time , was well lighted by a paraffin lamp ; books and work lay strewn about it , and [it]521-the little room wore a bright , habitable aspect . Beside the lamp at the table in the corner sat [Lyndall]59-lyndall , the open letters and papers of the day 's post lying scattered before [her]54-em , while [she]54-em perused the columns of a newspaper . At the centre table , with [his]60-waldo arms folded on an open paper , which there was not light enough to read , sat [Gregory]156-gregory . [He]156-gregory was looking at [her]54-em . The light from the open window fell on [Em]54-em 's little face under its white kapje

as [she]54-em looked in , but [no one]237-no one glanced that way .

" Go and fetch [me]156-gregory a glass of water , "[156-gregory] [Lyndall]59-lyndall said at last . [Gregory]156-gregory went out to find it ; when [he]156-gregory put it down at [her]54-em side [she]54-em merely moved [her]54-em head in recognition , and [he]156-gregory went back to [his]156-gregory seat and [his]156-gregory old occupation . Then [Em]54-em moved slowly away from the window , and through it came in spotted , hard - winged insects , to play round the lamp , till one by one , they stuck to its glass , and fell to the foot dead . Ten o'clock struck . Then [Lyndall]59-lyndall rose , gathered up [her]59-lyndall papers and letters , and wished [Gregory]156-gregory good night . Some time after [Em]54-em entered ; [she]54-em had been sitting all the while on the loft ladder , and had drawn [her]54-em " kapje "[54-em] down very much over [her]54-em face . [Gregory]156-gregory was piecing together the bits of an envelope when [she]54-em came in .

" [I]54-em thought [you]54-em were never coming , "[54-em] [he]156-gregory said , turning round quickly , and throwing the fragments onto the floor . " [You]54-em know [I]156-gregory have been shearing all day , and it is ten o'clock already . "[156-gregory] " [I]156-gregory 'm sorry . [I]156-gregory did not think [you]156-gregory would be going so soon , "[156-gregory] [she]54-em said in a low voice . " [I]156-gregory ca n't hear what [you]156-gregory say . What makes [you]156-gregory mumble so ? Well , good night , [Em]54-em . "[156-gregory] [He]156-gregory stooped down hastily to kiss [her]54-em . " [I]54-em want to talk to [you]54-em , [Gregory]156-gregory . "[54-em] " Well , make haste , "[54-em] [he]156-gregory said pettishly . " [I]156-gregory 'm awfully tired . [I]156-gregory 've been sitting [here]3430-here all the evening . Why could n't [you]54-em come and talk before ? "[156-gregory] " [I]54-em will not keep [you]156-gregory long , "[54-em] [she]54-em answered very steadily now . " [I]2489-i think , [Gregory]156-gregory , it would be better if [you]156-gregory and [I]2489-i were never to be married . "[2489-i]

" Good heavens ! [Em]54-em , what do [you]156-gregory mean ? [I]54-em thought [you]156-gregory were so fond of [me]54-em ? [You]156-gregory always professed to be . What on earth have [you]156-gregory taken into [your]156-gregory head now ? "[54-em]

" [I]2489-i think it would be better , "[2489-i] [she]54-em said , folding [her]54-em hands over each other , very much as though [she]54-em were praying .

" Better , [Em]54-em ! What do [you]156-gregory mean ? Even [a woman]540-a woman ca n't take a freak all about nothing ! [You]156-gregory must have some reason for it , and [I]2489-i 'm sure [I]2489-i 've done nothing to offend [you]156-gregory . [I]2489-i wrote only to - day to [[my]2489-i sister]4518-my sister to tell [her]4518-my sister to come up next month to [our]4604-our wedding , and [I]2489-i 've been as affectionate and happy as possible . Come what 's the matter ? "[2489-i]

[He]2489-i put [his]2489-i arm half round [her]54-em shoulder , very loosely . " [I]54-em think it would be better , "[54-em] [she]54-em answered , slowly . " Oh , well , "[2489-i] [he]2489-i said , drawing [himself]2489-i up , " if [you]54-em wo n't enter into explanations [you]54-em wo n't ; and [I]2490-i 'm not [the man to beg and pray not to [any woman]4606-any woman]4605-the man to beg and pray not to any woman , and [you]54-em know that ! If [you]54-em do n't want to marry [me]2490-i [I]2490-i ca n't oblige [you]54-em to , of course . "[2490-i]

[She]54-em stood quite still before [him]2489-i .

" [[You]54-em women]4607-you women never do know [your]54-em own minds for two days together ; and of course [you]54-em know the state of [your]54-em own feelings best ; but it 's very strange . Have [you]54-em really made up [your]54-em mind , [Em]54-em ? "[2490-i]

" Yes . "[2490-i] " Well , [I]2490-i 'm very sorry . [I]2490-i 'm sure [I]2490-i 've not been in anything to blame . [A man]242-a man ca n't always be billing and cooing ; but , as [you]54-em say , if [your]54-em feeling for [me]2490-i has changed , it 's much better [you]54-em should n't marry [me]2490-i . There 's nothing so foolish as to marry [some one [you]54-em do n't love]4609-some one you do n't love ; and [I]2490-i only wish for [your]54-em happiness , [I]2490-i 'm sure . [I]2490-i daresay [you]54-em 'll find [some one]3445-some one can make [you]54-em much happier than [I]2490-i could ; [the first person]4611-the first person [we]4612-we love is seldom [the right one]4613-the right one . [You]54-em are very young ; it 's quite natural [you]54-em should change . "[2490-i] [She]2490-i said nothing .

" Things often seem hard at the time , but[54-em]

[Providence]176-providence makes them turn out for the best in the end , " said [Gregory]156-gregory . "[54-em] [You]2490-i 'll let [me]0-i kiss [you]2490-i , [Em]54-em , just for old friendship 's sake . " [He]0-i stooped down . "[54-em] [You]2490-i must look upon [me]0-i as [a dear brother]2491-a dear brother , as [a cousin]2492-a cousin at least ; as long as [I]0-i am on [the farm]260-the farm [I]0-i shall always be glad to help [you]2490-i , [Em]54-em . "[60-waldo]

Soon after the brown pony was cantering along the footpath to [the daub - and - wattle house]2411-the daub - and - wattle house , and [[his]0-i master]361-his master as [he]0-i rode whistled [John Speriwig]104-john and the Thorn Kloof schottische .

The sun had not yet touched the outstretched arms of the prickly pear upon the kopje , and [the early cocks and hens]2496-the early cocks and hens still strutted about stiffly after the night 's roost , when [Waldo]60-waldo stood before [the waggon - house]229-the waggon - house saddling the grey mare . Every now and then [he]60-waldo glanced up at the old familiar objects : they had a new aspect that morning . Even the cocks , seen in the light of

parting , had a peculiar interest , and [he]60-waldo listened with conscious attention while one crowed clear and loud as it stood on the pigsty wall . [He]60-waldo wished good morning softly to [the Kaffir - woman who was coming up from [the huts]1999-the huts to light the fire]2498-the kaffir - woman who was coming up from the huts to light the fire . [He]60-waldo was leaving [them]2500-them all to that old life , and from [his]60-waldo height [he]60-waldo looked down on [them]2500-them pityingly . So [they]2500-them would keep on crowing , and coming to light fires , when for [him]60-waldo that old colourless existence was but a dream .

[He]60-waldo went into [the house]206-the house to say good - bye to [Em]54-em , and then [he]60-waldo walked to the door of [[Lyndall]59-lyndall 's room]2502-lyndall 's room to wake [her]54-em ; but [she]54-em was up , and standing in the doorway . " So [you]60-waldo are ready , "[60-waldo] [she]54-em said . [Waldo]60-waldo looked at [her]54-em with sudden heaviness ; the exhilaration died out of [his]60-waldo heart . [Her]54-em grey dressing - gown hung close about [her]54-em , and below its edge the little bare feet were resting on the threshold .

" [I]60-waldo wonder when [we]4614-we shall meet again , [Waldo]60-waldo . What [you]60-waldo will be , and what [I]60-waldo ? "[60-waldo] " Will [you]54-em write to [me]60-waldo ? "[60-waldo] [he]60-waldo asked of [her]54-em . " Yes ; and if [I]60-waldo should not , [you]54-em can still remember , wherever [you]54-em are , that [you]54-em are not alone . "[60-waldo] " [I]2503-i have left Doss for [you]54-em , "[2503-i] [he]60-waldo said . " Will [you]54-em not miss [him]4615-him ? "[54-em] " No ; [I]54-em want [you]54-em to have [him]4615-him . [He]4615-him loves [you]54-em better than [he]4615-him loves [me]54-em . "[54-em] " Thank [you]54-em . "[54-em] [They]2503-i stood quiet . " Good - bye ! "[160-kopje] [she]54-em said , putting [her]54-em little hand in [his]60-waldo , and [he]60-waldo turned away ; but when [he]60-waldo reached the door [she]54-em called to [him]60-waldo : " Come back , [I]156-gregory want to kiss [you]60-waldo . "[156-gregory] [She]54-em drew [his]60-waldo face down to [hers]54-em , and held it with both hands , and kissed it on the forehead and mouth . " Good - bye , [dear]3635-dear ! "[60-waldo] When [he]60-waldo looked back [the little figure with its beautiful eyes]2504-the little figure with its beautiful eyes was standing in the doorway still .

[CHAPTER VIII]177-chapter viii . [THE KOPJE]160-kopje .

" GOOD morning ! "[60-waldo]

[Em]54-em , who was in [the storeroom]2505-the storeroom measuring [the Kaffir]110-kaffir 's rations , looked up and saw [[her]54-em former lover]2506-her former lover standing betwixt [her]54-em and the sunshine . For some days after that evening on which [he]60-waldo had ridden [home]302-home whistling [he]60-waldo had shunned [her]54-em . [She]54-em might wish to enter into explanations , and [he]60-waldo , [Gregory Rose]156-gregory , was not [the man]372-the man for that kind of thing . If [a woman]540-a woman had once thrown [him]60-waldo overboard [she]54-em must take the consequences , and stand by [them]2510-them . When , however , [she]54-em showed no inclination to revert to the past , and shunned [him]60-waldo more than [he]60-waldo shunned [her]54-em , [Gregory]156-gregory softened .

" [You]54-em must let [me]60-waldo call [you]54-em [Em]54-em still , and be like [a brother]4617-a brother to [you]54-em till [I]60-waldo go , "[60-waldo] [he]156-gregory said ; and [Em]54-em thanked [him]60-waldo so humbly that [he]60-waldo wished [she]54-em had n't . It was n't so easy after that to think [himself]156-gregory [an injured man]2511-an injured man . On that morning [he]60-waldo stood some time in the doorway switching [his]60-waldo whip , and moving rather restlessly from one leg to the other .

" [I]60-waldo think [I]60-waldo 'll just take a walk up to [the camps]3869-the camps and see how [your]54-em birds are getting on . Now [Waldo]60-waldo 's gone [you]54-em 've [no one to see after things]4619-no one to see after things . Nice morning , is n't it ? "[60-waldo] Then [he]60-waldo added suddenly , " [I]54-em 'll just go round to [the house]206-the house and get a drink of water first ; "[54-em] and somewhat awkwardly walked off . [He]60-waldo might have found water in [the kitchen]798-the kitchen , but [he]60-waldo never glanced toward the buckets . In [the front room]1096-the front room a monkey and two tumblers stood on the centre table ; but [he]60-waldo merely looked round , peeped into [the parlour]2486-the parlour , looked round again , and then walked out at the

front door , and found [himself]60-waldo again at [the store - room]807-the store - room without having satisfied [his]60-waldo thirst . " Awfully nice morning this , "[156-gregory] [he]60-waldo said , trying to pose [himself]60-waldo in a graceful and indifferent attitude against the door . " It is n't hot and it is n't cold . It 's awfully nice . "[156-gregory]

" Yes , "[54-em] said [Em]54-em . " [[Your]54-em cousin]4277-your cousin , now , "[156-gregory] said [Gregory]156-gregory in an aimless sort of way " [I]156-gregory suppose [she]4277-your cousin 's shut up in [[her]4277-your cousin room]1009-her room writing letters . "[156-gregory] " No , "[156-gregory] said [Em]54-em . " Gone for a drive , [I]156-gregory expect ? Nice morning for a drive . "[156-gregory] " No . "[54-em] " Gone to see the ostriches , [I]156-gregory suppose ? "[156-gregory] " No . "[156-gregory] After a little silence [Em]54-em added , " [I]54-em saw [her]4277-your cousin go by the kraals to [the kopje]1008-the kopje . "[54-em] [Gregory]156-gregory crossed and uncrossed [his]156-gregory legs .

" Well , [I]156-gregory think [I]156-gregory 'll just go and have a look about , "[156-gregory] [he]156-gregory said , " and see how things are getting[156-gregory]

on before [I]0-i go to [the camps]3869-the camps . Good - bye ; so long . "[156-gregory]

[Em]54-em left for a while the bags [she]54-em was folding and went to the window , the same through which , years before , [Bonaparte]67-bonaparte had watched [the slouching figure]2517-the slouching figure cross [the yard]927-the yard . [Gregory]156-gregory walked to [the pigsty]2519-the pigsty first , and contemplated the pigs for a few seconds ; then turned round , and stood looking fixedly at the wall of [the fuel - house]1284-the fuel - house as though [he]156-gregory thought it wanted repairing ; then [he]156-gregory started off suddenly with the evident intention of going to [the ostrich - camps]218-the ostrich - camps ; then paused , hesitated , and finally walked off in the direction of [the " kopje]3418-the " kopje . "[156-gregory] Then [Em]54-em went back to the corner , and folded more sacks .

On the other side of [the " kopje "]3412-the " kopje "[156-gregory] [Gregory]156-gregory caught sight of a white tail waving among the stones , and a succession of short , frantic barks told where [Doss]70-doss was engaged in howling

implor- imploringly

ingly to a lizard who had crept between two stones , and who had not the slightest intention of re - sunning [himself]156-gregory at that particular moment .

[[The dog]1133-the dog 's mistress]2523-the dog 's mistress sat higher up , under the shelving rock , [her]2523-the dog 's mistress face bent over a volume of plays upon [her]2523-the dog 's mistress knee . As [Gregory]156-gregory mounted the stones [she]2523-the dog 's mistress started violently and looked up ; then resumed [her]2523-the dog 's mistress book . " [I]156-gregory hope [I]156-gregory am not troubling [you]2523-the dog 's mistress , "[156-gregory] said [Gregory]156-gregory as [he]156-gregory reached [her]2523-the dog 's mistress side . " If [I]156-gregory am [I]156-gregory will go away . [I]156-gregory just "[156-gregory] " No ; [you]156-gregory may stay . "[156-gregory] " [I]156-gregory fear [I]156-gregory startled [you]156-gregory . "[156-gregory] " Yes ; [your]156-gregory step was firmer than it generally is . [I]156-gregory thought it was that of [some one else]859-some one else . "[156-gregory] " Who could it be but [me]156-gregory ? "[156-gregory] asked [Gregory]156-gregory , seating [himself]156-gregory on a stone at [her]2523-the dog 's mistress feet . " Do [you]2523-the dog 's mistress suppose [you]2523-the dog 's mistress are [the only man who would find anything to attract [him]156-gregory to this "[156-gregory] kopjeí]4627-the only man who would find anything to attract him to this " kopjeí ? "[156-gregory]

" Oh , no , "[156-gregory] said [Gregory]156-gregory . [He]156-gregory was not going to argue that point with [her]2523-the dog 's mistress , nor any other ; but [no old Boer]2524-no old boer was likely to take the trouble of climbing the " kopje , "[2523-the dog 's mistress] and who else was there ? [She]2523-the dog 's mistress continued the study of [her]2523-the dog 's mistress book . " [Miss Lyndall]59-lyndall , "[156-gregory] [he]156-gregory said at last , " [I]156-gregory do n't know why it is [you]2523-the dog 's mistress never talk to [me]156-gregory . "[156-gregory] " [We]4628-we had a long conversation yesterday , "[2525-she] [she]2523-the dog 's mistress said , without looking up . " Yes ; but [you]2523-the dog 's mistress ask [me]156-gregory questions about sheep and oxen . [I]156-gregory do n't call that talking . [You]2523-the dog 's mistress used to talk to [Waldo]60-waldo , now , "[156-gregory] [he]156-gregory said , in an aggrieved tone of voice . " [I]156-gregory 've heard [you]2523-the dog 's mistress when [I]156-gregory came in , and then [you]2523-the dog 's mistress 've just left off . [You]2523-the dog 's mistress treated [me]156-gregory like that from the first day ; and [you]2523-the dog 's mistress could n't tell from just looking at [me]156-gregory that [I]156-gregory could n't talk about the things [you]2523-the dog 's mistress like . [I]156-gregory 'm sure [I]156-gregory know as much about such things as [Waldo]60-waldo does , "[156-gregory] said [Gregory]156-gregory , in exceeding bitterness of spirit .

" [I]2525-she do not know which things [you]2523-the dog 's mistress refer to . If [you]2523-the dog 's mistress will enlighten [me]2525-she [I]2525-she am quite prepared to speak of them , "[2525-she] [she]2525-she said , reading as [she]2525-she spoke . " Oh , [you]2523-the dog 's mistress never used to ask [Waldo]60-waldo like that , "[2525-she] said [Gregory]156-gregory , in a more sorely aggrieved tone than ever . " [You]2523-the dog 's mistress used just to begin . "[2526-his]

" Well , let [me]156-gregory see , "[156-gregory] [she]2525-she said , closing [her]2525-she book and folding [her]2525-she hands on it . " There goes [a Kaffir]110-kaffir ; [he]110-kaffir has nothing on but a blanket ; [he]110-kaffir is [a splendid fellow six feet high]4629-a splendid fellow six feet high , with a magnificent pair of legs . In [his]110-kaffir leather bag [he]110-kaffir is going to get [his]110-kaffir rations , and [I]2526-his suppose to kick [[his]110-kaffir wife]3738-his wife with [his]110-kaffir beautiful legs when [he]110-kaffir gets [home]302-home . [He]110-kaffir has a right to ; [he]110-kaffir bought [her]3738-his wife for two oxen . There is a lean dog going after [him]110-kaffir , to whom [I]2526-his suppose [he]110-kaffir never gives more than a bone from which [he]110-kaffir has sucked the marrow ; but [his]110-kaffir dog loves [him]110-kaffir , as [[his]110-kaffir wife]3738-his wife does . There is something of [the master]4633-the master about [him]2526-his in[2526-his]

spite of [his]2526-his blackness and wool . See how [he]2526-his brandishes [his]2526-his stick and holds up [his]2526-his head ! "[2526-his]

" Oh , but are n't [you]2527-you making fun ? "[156-gregory] said [Gregory]156-gregory , looking doubtfully from [her]2527-you to the Kaffir herd , who rounded the " kopje . "[156-gregory] " No ; [I]156-gregory am very serious . [He]2526-his is the most interesting and intelligent thing [I]156-gregory can see just now , except , perhaps , [Doss]70-doss . [He]2526-his is profoundly suggestive . Will [his]2526-his race melt away in the heat of a collision with a higher ? Are [the men of the future]4634-the men of the future to see [his]2526-his bones only in museums a vestige of one link that spanned between the dog and [the white man]4635-the white man ? [He]2526-his wakes thoughts that run far out into the future and back into the past . "[156-gregory] [Gregory]156-gregory was not quite sure how to take these remarks . Being about [a Kaffir]110-kaffir , they appeared to be of the nature of a joke ; but being seriously spoken , they appeared earnest ; so [he]156-gregory half laughed and half not , to be on the safe side .

" [I]2529-i 've often thought so [myself]2529-i . It 's funny [we]4636-we should both think the same ; [I]2529-i knew [we]4636-we should if once [we]4636-we talked . But there are other things love , now , "[2529-i] [he]156-gregory added . " [I]2529-i wonder if [we]4636-we would think alike about that . [I]2529-i wrote an essay on love once ; [the master]4633-the master said it was the best [I]2529-i ever wrote , and [I]2529-i can remember the first sentence still "[2529-i] Love is something that [you]2528-you feel in [your]2528-you heart.í " "[156-gregory] That was a trenchant remark . Ca n't [you]156-gregory remember any more ? " "[2529-i] No , " said [Gregory]156-gregory , regretfully ; "[2529-i] [I]0-i 've forgotten the rest . But tell [me]0-i what do [you]156-gregory think about love ? " A look , half of abstraction , half amusement , played on [her]2529-i lips .[724-a god]

" [I]2539-i do n't know much about love , "[2539-i] [she]2529-i said , " and [I]2539-i do not like to talk of things [I]2539-i do not understand ; but [I]2539-i have heard two opinions . Some say [the devil]3496-the devil carried the seed from [hell]4026-hell[2539-i]

and planted it on [the earth]335-the earth to plague [men]3470-men and make [them]3470-men sin ; and [some]1386-some say , that when all the plants in [the garden of Eden]2533-the garden of eden were pulled up by the roots , one bush that [the angels]638-the angels planted was left growing , and it spread its seed over [the whole earth]1210-the whole earth , and its name is love . [I]0-i do not know which is right perhaps both . There are different species that go under the same name . There is a love that begins in the head , and goes down to the heart , and grows slowly ; but it lasts till death , and asks less than it gives . There is another love , that blots out wisdom , that is sweet with the sweetness of life and bitter with the bitterness of death , lasting for an hour ; but it is worth having lived a whole life for that hour . [I]0-i can not tell , perhaps [the old monks]2536-the old monks were right when [they]2536-the old monks tried to root love out ; perhaps [the poets]2537-the poets are right when [they]2537-the poets try to water it . It is a blood - red flower , with the colour of

sin ; but there is always the scent of [a god]724-a god about it . "[2539-i]

[Gregory]156-gregory would have made a remark ; but [she]2539-i said , without noticing , " There are as many kinds of loves as there are flowers . [Everlastings that never wither]4640-everlastings that never wither ; Speedwells that wait for the wind to fan [them]2540-them out of life ; blood - red mountain - lilies that pour their voluptuous sweetness out for one day , and lie in the dust at night . There is no flower has the charm of all [the Speedwell]178-the speedwell 's purity , the Everlasting 's strength , the mountain - lily 's warmth ; but who knows whether there is no love that holds all friendship , passion , worship ![156-gregory]

" Such a love , "[156-gregory] [she]2539-i said , in [her]2539-i sweetest voice , " will fall on the surface of strong , cold , selfish life as the sunlight falls on a torpid winter world ; there , where the trees are bare , and the ground frozen , till it rings to the step like iron , and the water is solid , and the air is sharp[156-gregory]

as a two - edged knife that cuts the unwary . But when its sun shines on it , through its whole dead crust a throbbing yearning wakes : the trees feel [him]0-i , and every knot and bud swell , aching to open to [him]0-i . The brown seeds , who have slept deep under the ground , feel [him]0-i , and [he]0-i gives [them]2540-them strength , till they break through the frozen earth , and lift two tiny , trembling green hands in love to [him]0-i . And [he]0-i touches the water , till down to its depths it feels [him]0-i and melts , and it flows , and the things , strange sweet things that were locked up in it , it sings as it runs , for love of [him]0-i . Each plant tries to bear at least one fragrant little flower for [him]0-i ; and [the world]252-the world that was dead lives , and the heart that was dead and self - centred throbs , with an upward , outward yearning , and it has become that which it seemed impossible ever to become . There , does that satisfy [you]0-i ? " [she]59-lyndall asked , looking down[156-gregory]

at [Gregory]156-gregory . " Is that how [you]0-i like [me]59-lyndall to talk ? "[59-lyndall]

" Oh , yes , "[156-gregory] said [Gregory]156-gregory , " that is what [I]156-gregory have already thought . [We]4641-we have the same thoughts about everything . How strange ! "[156-gregory] " Very , "[59-lyndall] said [Lyndall]59-lyndall , working with [her]59-lyndall little toe at a stone in [the ground before [her]59-lyndall]2542-the ground before her . [Gregory]156-gregory felt [he]156-gregory must sustain the conversation . The only thing [he]156-gregory could think of was to recite a piece of poetry . [He]156-gregory knew [he]156-gregory had learnt many about love ; but the only thing that would come into [his]156-gregory mind now , was the " Battle of [Hohenlinden]44-hohenlinden , í and "[156-gregory] Not a drum was heard , í neither of which seemed to bear directly on the subject on hand .

But unexpected relief came to [him]156-gregory from [Doss]70-doss , who , too deeply lost in contemplation of [his]70-doss crevice , was surprised by the sudden descent of the stone [Lyndall]59-lyndall 's foot had loosened , which , rolling against [his]70-doss little front paw , carried away

a piece of white skin . [Doss]70-doss stood on three legs , holding up the paw with an expression of extreme self - commiseration ; [he]70-doss then proceeded to hop slowly upward in search of sympathy .

" [You]59-lyndall have hurt that dog , "[156-gregory] said [Gregory]156-gregory . " Have [I]156-gregory ? "[156-gregory] [she]59-lyndall replied indifferently , and re - opened the book , as though to resume [her]59-lyndall study of the play . " [He]70-doss 's [a nasty , snappish little cur]4642-a nasty , snappish little cur ! "[2543-he] said [Gregory]156-gregory , calculating from [her]59-lyndall manner that the remark would be endorsed . " [He]70-doss snapped at [my]59-lyndall horse 's tail yesterday , and nearly made it throw [me]59-lyndall . [I]59-lyndall wonder [[his]70-doss master]361-his master did n't take [him]70-doss , instead of leaving [him]70-doss [here]3430-here to be a nuisance to [all of [us]4645-all of us]4645-all of us ! "[59-lyndall] [Lyndall]59-lyndall seemed absorbed in [her]59-lyndall play ; but [he]156-gregory ventured another remark .

" Do [you]156-gregory think now , [Miss Lyndall]59-lyndall , that [he]70-doss 'll ever have anything in [the world]252-the world that [German]73-the german . [I]2543-he mean money enough to support [a wife]3519-a wife on , and[2543-he]

all that sort of thing ? [I]0-i do n't . [He]2543-he 's what [I]0-i call soft . "[156-gregory]

[She]59-lyndall was spreading [her]59-lyndall skirt out softly with [her]59-lyndall left hand for the dog to lie down on it .

" [I]59-lyndall think [I]59-lyndall should be rather astonished if [he]2543-he ever became [a respectable member of society]4648-a respectable member of society , "[59-lyndall] [she]59-lyndall said . " Yes ; [I]2543-he do n't expect anything of [him]2543-he either , "[2543-he] said [Gregory]156-gregory , zealously .

carry carve

a statue that [one]324-one might look at for half an hour without wanting to look at something else , [I]0-i should not be surprised . [He]2543-he may do some little thing of

that kind perhaps , when [he]2543-he has done fermenting and the sediment has all gone to the bottom . "[156-gregory]

[Gregory]156-gregory felt that what [she]59-lyndall said was not wholly intended as blame . " Well , [I]156-gregory do n't know , "[156-gregory] [he]156-gregory said sulkily ; " to [me]59-lyndall [he]2543-he looks like [a fool]709-a fool . [He]2543-he works hard enough , but it 's always as though [he]2543-he did n't know what [he]2543-he was doing . "[59-lyndall] [Lyndall]59-lyndall was softly touching the little sore foot as [she]59-lyndall read , and [Doss]70-doss , to show [he]156-gregory liked it , licked [her]59-lyndall hand . " But , [Miss Lyndall]59-lyndall , "[59-lyndall] persisted [Gregory]156-gregory , " what do [you]59-lyndall really think of [him]2543-he ? "[156-gregory]

[any one]504-any one 's caring for it , and one day suddenly breaks out into yellow blossoms . "[156-gregory]

" And what do [you]59-lyndall think [I]156-gregory am like ? "[156-gregory] asked [Gregory]156-gregory , hopefully . [Lyndall]59-lyndall looked up from [her]59-lyndall book . " Like a little tin duck floating on a dish of water , that comes after a piece of bread stuck on a needle , and the more the needle pricks it the more it comes on . "[59-lyndall]

" Oh , [you]59-lyndall are making fun of [me]156-gregory now , [you]59-lyndall really are ! "[156-gregory] said [Gregory]156-gregory feeling wretched . " [You]59-lyndall are making fun , are n't [you]59-lyndall , now ? "[59-lyndall]

" Partly . It is always diverting to make comparisons . "[2551-she] " Yes ; but [you]59-lyndall do n't compare [me]156-gregory to anything nice , and [you]59-lyndall do [other people]4289-other people . What is [Em]54-em like , now ? "[156-gregory]

" The accompaniment of a song . [She]2551-she fills up the gaps in [other people]4289-other people 's lives , and is always number two ; but [I]156-gregory think [she]2551-she is like many[156-gregory]

accompaniments a great deal better than the song [she]2551-she is to accompany . "[156-gregory]

" [She]2551-she is not half so good as [you]59-lyndall are ! "[156-gregory] said [Gregory]156-gregory , with a burst of uncontrollable ardour . " [She]2551-she is so much better than [I]156-gregory , that [her]2551-she little finger has more goodness in it than [my]156-gregory whole body . "[156-gregory] " [You]59-lyndall are like [an angel]4348-an angel , "[156-gregory] [he]156-gregory said , the blood rushing to [his]156-gregory head and face . " Yes , probably ; [angels]4656-angels are of many orders . "[2552-you] " [You]59-lyndall are the one being that [I]2552-you love ! "[2552-you] said [Gregory]156-gregory quivering ; " [I]2553-you thought [I]2553-you loved before , but [I]2553-you know now ! Do not be angry with [me]2553-you . [I]2553-you know [you]59-lyndall could never like [me]2553-you ; but , if [I]2553-you might but always be near [you]59-lyndall to serve [you]59-lyndall , [I]2553-you would be utterly , utterly happy . [I]2553-you would ask nothing in return ! If [you]59-lyndall could only take everything [I]2553-you have and use it ; [I]2553-you want nothing but to see [you]59-lyndall . "[2553-you]

" How do [you]2553-you know , "[2553-you] [she]2552-you said slowly , " that [I]2553-you would not be willing to marry [you]2553-you if [you]2553-you asked [me]2553-you ? "[2553-you] [He]2553-you started , and turned [his]2553-you burning face to [her]2552-you . " [You]2552-you are very cruel ; [you]2552-you are ridiculing [me]2553-you , "[2553-you] [he]2553-you said . " No , [I]2555-i am not , [Gregory]156-gregory . What [I]2555-i am saying is plain , matter - of - fact business . "[2555-i] [He]2553-you looked up . Was it contempt , loathing , pity , that moved in the eyes above ? [He]2553-you could not tell ; but [he]2553-you stooped over the little foot and kissed it . [She]2552-you smiled . " Do [you]2552-you really mean it ? "[2554-us] [he]2553-you whispered .

" Yes . [You]2553-you wish to be near [me]2553-you , and to serve [me]2553-you , and to have nothing in return ? [you]2553-you shall have what [you]2553-you wish . [I]2553-you believe [you]2553-you love [me]2553-you ; [I]2553-you[2553-you]

too could love so , that to lie under the foot of the thing [I]0-i loved would be more heaven than to lie in the breast of another . Come ! let [us]2554-us go . Carry the dog , " [she]2553-you added ; "[2553-you] [he]2555-i will not bite [you]2553-you if [I]0-i put [him]2555-i in [your]2553-you arms . So do not let [his]2555-i foot hang down . "[2553-you]

[They]2554-us descended the " kopje . "[2553-you] At the bottom , [he]2553-you whispered , " Would [you]2553-you not take [my]2553-you arm ? the path is very rough . "[2553-you] [She]2553-you rested [her]2553-you fingers lightly on it . " [I]2553-you would try to make everything beautiful for [you]2553-you , "[2553-you] [he]2553-you said ; " but now there is not time . "[2553-you]

" It does not matter . [I]2553-you may yet change [my]2553-you mind about marrying [you]2553-you before the time comes . Mark [you]2553-you ! "[2553-you] [she]2553-you said , turning round on [him]2553-you ; " [I]59-lyndall remember [your]2553-you words : [You]2553-you will give everything , and expect nothing . The knowledge that [you]2553-you are serving [me]59-lyndall is to be [your]2553-you reward ; and [you]2553-you will have that . [You]2553-you will serve [me]59-lyndall , and greatly .[59-lyndall]

The reasons [I]0-i have for marrying [you]2553-you [I]0-i need not inform [you]2553-you of now ; [you]2553-you will probably discover some of them before long . "[59-lyndall]

" [I]59-lyndall only want to be of some use to [you]0-i , "[59-lyndall] [he]2553-you said . It seemed to [Gregory]156-gregory that there were pulses in the soles of [his]2553-you feet , and the ground shimmered as on a summer 's day . [They]2556-they walked round the foot of the kopje , and past [the Kaffir huts]2557-the kaffir huts . [An old Kaffir maid]2558-an old kaffir maid knelt at the door of [one grinding mealies]2559-one grinding mealies . That [she]2558-an old kaffir maid should see [him]2553-you walking so made [his]2553-you heart beat so fast that the hand on [his]2553-you arm felt its pulsation . It seemed that [she]2558-an old kaffir maid must envy [him]2553-you . Just then [Em]54-em looked out again at the back window and saw [them]2560-them coming . [She]54-em cried bitterly all the while [she]54-em sorted the skins . But that night when [Lyndall]59-lyndall had blown [her]59-lyndall candle out , and half turned round to sleep , the door of [[Em]54-em 's bed - room]2561-em 's bed - room opened .

" [I]59-lyndall want to say good night to [you]2553-you , [Lyndall]59-lyndall , "[59-lyndall]

[she]59-lyndall said , coming to the bedside and kneeling down .

" [I]3445-some one thought [you]2553-you were asleep , "[3445-some one] [Lyndall]59-lyndall replied . " Yes , [I]59-lyndall have been asleep ; but [I]59-lyndall had such a vivid dream , "[59-lyndall] [she]59-lyndall said , holding the other 's hands , " and that woke [me]3445-some one . [I]3445-some one never had so vivid a dream before . "[3445-some one] It seemed [I]0-i was [a little girl]2562-a little girl again , and [I]0-i came somewhere into [a large room]2563-a large room . On a bed in the corner there was something lying dressed in white , and its little eyes were shut , and its little face was like wax . [I]0-i thought it was a doll , and [I]0-i ran forward to take it ; but [some one]3445-some one held up [her]3445-some one finger and said , " Hush ! it is a little dead baby.í And [I]59-lyndall said , "[59-lyndall] Oh , [I]0-i must go and call [Lyndall]59-lyndall , that [she]3445-some one may look at it also.í " And [they]4657-they put [their]4657-they faces close down to [my]59-lyndall ear and whispered , "[59-lyndall] It is [Lyndall]59-lyndall 's baby.í

" And [I]0-i said , "[0-i] [She]3445-some one can not be grown up yet ;

[she]3445-some one is only [a little girl]2562-a little girl ! Where is she?í And [I]0-i went to look for [you]2566-you , but [I]0-i could not find [you]2566-you .

" And when [I]3635-dear came to [some people who were dressed in black]4658-some people who were dressed in black , [I]3635-dear asked [them]4658-some people who were dressed in black where [you]2566-you were , and [they]4658-some people who were dressed in black looked down at [their]4658-some people who were dressed in black black clothes , and shook [their]4658-some people who were dressed in black heads , and said nothing ; and [I]3635-dear could not find [you]2566-you anywhere . And then [I]3635-dear woke . "[3635-dear] [Lyndall]59-lyndall , " [she]3635-dear said , putting [her]3635-dear face down upon the hands [she]3635-dear held , "[59-lyndall] it made [me]0-i think about that time when [we]2567-we were [little girls]3727-little girls and used to play together , when [I]0-i loved [you]59-lyndall better than anything else in [the world]252-the world . It is n't [any one]504-any one 's fault that [they]504-any one love [you]59-lyndall ; [they]504-any one ca n't help it . And it is n't [your]59-lyndall fault ; [you]59-lyndall do n't make [them]504-any one love [you]59-lyndall . [I]0-i know it . " "[59-lyndall] Thank [you]59-lyndall , [dear]3635-dear , " [Lyndall]59-lyndall said . "[2579-her] It is nice to be loved , but it would be better to be good . "[2579-her]

Then [they]2572-their wished good night , and [Em]54-em went back to [[her]54-em room]1009-her room . Long after [Lyndall]59-lyndall lay in the dark thinking , thinking , thinking ; and as [she]59-lyndall turned round wearily to sleep [she]59-lyndall muttered , " There are some wiser in [their]2572-their sleeping than in [their]2572-their waking . "[405-a stranger]

CHAPTER IX . [LYNDALL]59-lyndall 'S [STRANGER]179-stranger .

A FIRE is burning in [the unused hearth of [the cabin]460-the cabin]2574-the unused hearth of the cabin . The fuel blazes up , and lights the black rafters , and warms the faded red lions on the quilt , and fills [the little room]521-the little room with a glow of warmth and light made brighter by contrast , for outside the night is chill and misty .

Before [the open fire - place]2577-the open fire - place sits [a stranger]405-a stranger , [his]405-a stranger keen blue eyes studying the fire from beneath delicately - pencilled , drooping eyelids . One white hand plays thoughtfully with a heavy flaxen moustache ; yet once [he]405-a stranger starts , and for an instant the languid lids raise themselves : there is a keen , intent look upon the face as [he]405-a stranger listens

for something . Then [he]405-a stranger leans back in [his]405-a stranger chair , fills [his]405-a stranger glass from the silver flask in [his]405-a stranger bag , and resumes [his]405-a stranger old posture .

Presently the door opens noiselessly . [It]2579-her is [Lyndall]59-lyndall , followed by [Doss]70-doss . Quietly as [she]2579-her enters , [he]405-a stranger hears [her]2579-her , and turns . " [I]405-a stranger thought [you]2579-her were not coming . "[405-a stranger] " [I]405-a stranger waited till all had gone to bed . [I]405-a stranger could not come before . "[405-a stranger] [She]2579-her removed the shawl that enveloped [her]2579-her , and [the stranger]418-the stranger rose to offer [her]2579-her [his]405-a stranger chair ; but [she]2579-her took [her]2579-her seat on a low pile of sacks before the window . " [I]405-a stranger hardly see why [I]405-a stranger should be outlawed after this fashion , "[405-a stranger] [he]405-a stranger said , re - seating [himself]405-a stranger and drawing [his]405-a stranger chair a little nearer to [her]2579-her ; " these are hardly the quarters one expects to find after travelling a hundred miles in answer to an invitation . "[405-a stranger] " [I]405-a stranger said , "[405-a stranger] Come if [you]405-a stranger wish.í "[405-a stranger]

" And [I]405-a stranger did wish . [You]405-a stranger give [me]405-a stranger a cold reception . "[405-a stranger] " [I]2581-you could not take [you]405-a stranger to [the house]206-the house . Questions would be asked which [I]2581-you could not answer without prevarication . "[2581-you] " [Your]2579-her conscience is growing to have a certain virgin tenderness , "[2581-you] [he]405-a stranger said , in a low , melodious voice . " [I]405-a stranger have no conscience . [I]405-a stranger spoke one deliberate lie this evening . [I]405-a stranger said [the man who had come]4660-the man who had come looked rough , [we]4661-we had best not have [him]4660-the man who had come in [the house]206-the house ; therefore [I]405-a stranger brought [him]4660-the man who had come [here]3430-here . It was a deliberate lie , and [I]405-a stranger hate lies . [I]405-a stranger tell [them]4664-them if [I]405-a stranger must , but [they]4664-them hurt [me]405-a stranger . "[405-a stranger] " Well , [you]2582-you do not tell lies to [yourself]2582-you , at all events . [You]2582-you are candid , so far . "[2583-this fellow you talk of marrying] [She]2581-you interrupted [him]2582-you . " [You]2582-you got [my]405-a stranger short letter ? "[405-a stranger]

" Yes ; that is why [I]2581-you come . [You]2581-you sent a very[2581-you]

foolish reply ; [you]2581-you must take it back . Who is [this fellow [you]2581-you talk of marrying]2583-this fellow you talk of marrying ? "[2583-this fellow you talk of marrying]

" [A young farmer]2412-a young farmer . "[405-a stranger] " Lives [here]3430-here ? "[405-a stranger] " [A fool]709-a fool . "[2583-this fellow you talk of marrying] " And [you]2582-you would rather marry [him]2412-a young farmer than [me]2581-you ? "[2581-you] " Yes ; because [you]2582-you are [not one]3950-not one . "[2581-you] " That is a novel reason for refusing to marry [a man]242-a man , "[2581-you] [he]2583-this fellow you talk of marrying said , leaning [his]2583-this fellow you talk of marrying elbow on the table and watching [her]2581-you keenly .

" It is a wise one , "[341-her companion] [she]2581-you said shortly . " If [I]341-her companion marry [him]2412-a young farmer [I]341-her companion shall shake [him]2412-a young farmer off [my]341-her companion hand when it suits [me]341-her companion . [you]2581-you ask [me]0-i what [you]2581-you might and what [you]2581-you might not do ? "[341-her companion]

[[Her]2581-you companion]341-her companion raised the moustache with a caressing movement from [his]341-her companion lip and smiled . It was not a question that stood in need of any answer . " What have [you]2581-you done with the ring [I]2581-you gave [you]2581-you ? "[2581-you] [he]341-her companion said . " Sometimes [I]2581-you wear it ; then [I]2581-you take it off and wish to throw it into the fire ; the next day [I]2581-you put it on again , and sometimes [I]2581-you kiss it . "[2581-you] " So [you]2581-you do love [me]2585-i a little ? "[2585-i] " If [you]341-her companion were not something more to [me]2585-i than [any other man in [the world]252-the world]4673-any other man in the world , do [you]341-her companion think "[2585-i] [she]2581-you paused . " [I]2585-i love [you]341-her companion when [I]2585-i see [you]341-her companion ; but when [you]341-her companion are away from [me]2585-i [I]2585-i hate [you]341-her companion . "[2585-i] " Then [I]2585-i fear [I]2585-i must be singularly invisible at the present moment , "[2585-i] [he]2585-i said . " Possibly if [you]2581-you were to look less fixedly into the fire [you]2581-you might perceive [me]2581-you . "[2581-you]

[He]2585-i moved [his]2585-i chair slightly , so as to come between [her]2581-you and the firelight . [She]2581-you raised [her]2581-you eyes to [his]2585-i face . " If [you]2581-you do love [me]2586-he , "[2586-he] [he]2585-i asked [her]2581-you , " why will [you]2581-you not marry [me]2586-he ? "[2586-he] " Because , if [I]0-i had been married to [you]2581-you for a year [I]0-i should have come to [my]0-i senses and seen that [your]2581-you hands and [your]2581-you voice are like the hands and the voice of [any other man]917-any other man . [I]0-i can not quite see that now . But it is all madness . [You]2581-you call into activity one part of [my]0-i nature ; there is a higher part that [you]2581-you know nothing of , that [you]2581-you never touch . If [I]0-i married [you]2581-you , afterwards it would arise and assert itself , and [I]0-i should hate [you]2581-you always , as [I]0-i do now sometimes . "[0-i]

" [I]2586-he like [you]2581-you when [you]2581-you grow metaphysical and analytical , "[2586-he] [he]2586-he said , leaning [his]2586-he face upon [his]2586-he hand . " Go a little further in [your]2587-you analysis , say , "[2586-he] [I]0-i love [you]2587-you with the right ventricle of [my]0-i heart , but not the left , and with the left auricle

of [my]0-i heart , but not the right ; and this being the case , [my]0-i affection for [you]2587-you is not of a duly elevated , intellectual and spiritual nature.í [I]0-i like [you]2587-you when [you]2587-you get philosophical . "[2596-herself]

[She]2587-you looked quietly at [him]2586-he ; [he]2586-he was trying to turn [her]2587-you own weapons against [her]2587-you .

" [You]2587-you are acting foolishly , [Lyndall]59-lyndall , "[2596-herself] [he]2586-he said , suddenly changing [his]2586-he manner , and speaking almost earnestly , " most foolishly . [You]2587-you are acting like [a little child]3461-a little child ; [I]2590-you am surprised at [you]2587-you . It is all very well to have ideals and theories ; but [you]2587-you know as well as [any one]504-any one can that they must not be carried into the practical world . [I]2590-you love [you]2587-you . [I]2590-you do not pretend that it is in any high , superhuman sense ; [I]2590-you do not say that [I]2590-you should like [you]2587-you as well if [you]2587-you were ugly and deformed , or that [I]2590-you should continue to prize [you]2587-you whatever [your]2587-you treatment of [me]2590-you might be , or to love [you]2587-you though [you]2587-you were [a spirit without any body at all]4678-a spirit without any body at all . That is sentimentality for [beardless boys]4679-beardless boys .[2590-you]

[Every one]3534-every one not [a mere child]2589-a mere child and [you]2590-you are not [a child]224-a child , except in years knows what love between [a man]242-a man and [a woman]540-a woman means . " Yes go on . Do not grow sorry for [me]418-the stranger . At least [we]2597-we two may speak the truth to [one another]4337-one another . " Then [she]418-the stranger added after a pause ,[418-the stranger]

" [I]418-the stranger believe [you]2590-you do love [me]418-the stranger , as much as [you]2590-you possibly could love anything ; and [I]418-the stranger believe that when [you]2590-you ask [me]418-the stranger to marry [you]2590-you , [you]2590-you are performing the most generous act [you]2590-you ever have performed in the course of [your]2590-you life , or ever will ; but , at the same time , if [I]418-the stranger had required [your]2590-you[418-the stranger]

generosity , it would not have been shown [me]0-i . If , when [I]0-i got [your]2590-you letter a month ago , hinting at [your]2590-you willingness to marry [me]0-i , [I]0-i had at once written , imploring [you]2590-you to come , [you]2590-you would have read the letter . " Poor little Devil!í [you]2590-you would have said , and torn it up . "[418-the stranger] [The stranger]418-the stranger smiled . " But because [I]418-the stranger declined [your]418-the stranger proposal , and wrote that in three weeks [I]418-the stranger should be married to [another]4138-another , then what [you]418-the stranger call love woke up . [[Your]2590-you man]4681-your man 's love is [a child]224-a child 's love for butterflies . [You]2590-you follow till [you]2590-you have the thing , and break it . If [you]2590-you have broken one wing , and the thing flies still , then [you]2590-you love it more than ever , and follow till [you]2590-you break both ; then [you]2590-you are satisfied when it lies still on the ground . "[418-the stranger]

" [You]418-the stranger are profoundly wise in the ways of [the world]252-the world ; [you]418-the stranger have seen far into life , "[418-the stranger] [he]418-the stranger said . [He]418-the stranger might as well have sneered at the firelight . " [I]418-the stranger have seen enough to tell [me]418-the stranger that [you]418-the stranger love [me]418-the stranger because [you]418-the stranger can not bear to be resisted , and want to master [me]418-the stranger . [You]418-the stranger liked [me]418-the stranger at first because [I]418-the stranger treated [you]418-the stranger and [all men]2192-all men with indifference . [You]418-the stranger resolved to have [me]418-the stranger because [I]418-the stranger seemed unattainable . This is all [your]418-the stranger love means . "[418-the stranger] [He]418-the stranger felt a strong inclination to stoop down and kiss the little lip that defied [him]418-the stranger ; but [he]418-the stranger restrained [himself]418-the stranger . [He]418-the stranger said quietly , " Well , since [you]418-the stranger will not marry [me]418-the stranger , may [I]418-the stranger inquire what [your]418-the stranger intentions are , the plan [you]418-the stranger wrote of . "[418-the stranger] " [I]2600-she said , "[2600-she] Come if [you]418-the stranger wish.í If [you]418-the stranger agree to it , well ; if not , [I]0-i marry on Monday . " "[2600-she] Well ? " [She]2600-she was still looking beyond [him]418-the stranger at the fire .[2600-she]

" [I]2601-he can not marry [you]418-the stranger , "[2601-he] [she]2600-she said slowly , " because [I]2601-he can not be tied ; but if [you]418-the stranger wish , [you]418-the stranger may take [me]2601-he away with [you]418-the stranger , and take care of [me]2601-he ; then when [we]4685-we do not love any more [we]4685-we can say good - bye . "[2600-she] " Oh , [[my]2601-he darling]4263-my darling , "[2601-he] [he]2601-he said , bending tenderly , and holding [his]2601-he hand out to [her]2600-she , " why will [you]2600-she not give [yourself]2600-she entirely to [me]2600-she ? But [I]2603-i will go with [you]2601-he . "[2603-i] " When ? "[2601-he]

" To - morrow . [I]2601-he have told [them]2602-them that before daylight [I]2601-he go to [the next farm]3819-the next farm . [I]2601-he will write from [the town]612-the town and tell [them]2602-them the facts . [I]2601-he do not[2601-he]

want [them]2602-them to trouble [me]0-i ; [I]0-i want to shake [myself]0-i free of these old surroundings ; [I]0-i want [them]2602-them to lose sight of [me]0-i . [You]2603-i can understand that is necessary for [me]0-i . "[2601-he]

[He]2601-he seemed lost in consideration ; then [he]2601-he said ,

" It is better to have [you]2604-her on those conditions than not at all . If [you]2604-her will have it , let it be so . "[2604-her]

[He]2601-he sat looking at [her]2604-her . On [her]2604-her face was the weary look that rested there so often now when [she]2604-her sat alone . Two months had not passed since [they]2605-they parted ; but the time had set its mark on [her]2604-her . [He]2601-he looked at [her]2604-her carefully , from the brown , smooth head to the little crossed feet on the floor . A worn look had grown over the little face , and it made its charm for [him]2601-he stronger . For pain and time , which trace deep lines and write a story on a human face , have a strangely different effect on one face and another .

The face that is only fair , even very fair , [they]2606-they [mar and flaw]2607-mar and flaw ; but to the face whose beauty is the harmony between that which speaks from within and the form through which it speaks , power is added by all that causes [the outer man]2608-the outer man to bear more deeply the impress of the inner . [The pretty woman]2609-the pretty woman fades with the roses on [her]2609-the pretty woman cheeks , and the girlhood that lasts an hour ; [the beautiful woman]2610-the beautiful woman finds [her]2610-the beautiful woman fulness of bloom only when a past has written itself on [her]2610-the beautiful woman , and [her]2610-the beautiful woman power is then most irresistible when it seems going .

From under [their]2605-they half - closed lids the keen eyes looked down at [her]2604-her . [Her]2604-her shoulders were bent ; for a moment [the little figure]2611-the little figure had forgotten its queenly bearing , and drooped wearily ; the wide , dark eyes watched the fire very softly . It certainly was not in [her]2604-her power to resist [him]2601-he , nor any strength in [her]2604-her that made [his]2601-he own at that moment grow soft as [he]2601-he looked at [her]2604-her .

[He]2601-he touched one little hand that rested on [her]2604-her knee . " [Poor little thing]4694-poor little thing ! "[2604-her] [he]2601-he said ; " [you]4694-poor little thing are only [a child]224-a child . "[2601-he] [She]2604-her did not draw [her]2604-her hand away from [his]2601-he , and looked up at [him]2601-he . " [You]2601-he are very tired ? "[2601-he] " Yes . "[2601-he] [She]2604-her looked into [his]2601-he eyes as [a little child]3461-a little child might whom a long day 's play had saddened . [He]2601-he lifted [her]2604-her gently up , and sat [her]2604-her on [his]2601-he knee . " [Poor little thing]4694-poor little thing ! "[2601-he] [he]2601-he said . [She]2604-her turned [her]2604-her face to [his]2601-he shoulder , and buried it against [his]2601-he neck ; [he]2601-he wound [his]2601-he strong arm about [her]2604-her , and held [her]2604-her close to [him]2601-he . When [she]2604-her had sat for a long while , [he]2601-he drew with [his]2601-he hand the face down , and held it against [his]2601-he arm . [He]2601-he kissed it , and then put it back in its old resting - place .

" Do n't [you]2604-her want to talk to [me]2604-her ? "[2604-her] " No . "[2613-they] " Have [you]2604-her forgotten the night in [the avenue]4697-the avenue ? "[2604-her] [He]2601-he could feel that [she]2604-her shook [her]2604-her head . " Do [you]2604-her want to be quiet now ? "[418-the stranger] " Yes . "[2604-her] [They]2613-they sat quite still , excepting that only sometimes [he]2601-he raised [her]2604-her fingers softly to [his]2601-he mouth . [Doss]70-doss , who had been asleep in the corner , waking suddenly , planted [himself]70-doss before [them]2613-they , [his]70-doss wiry legs moving nervously , [his]70-doss yellow eyes filled with anxiety . [He]2601-he was not at all sure that [she]2604-her was not being retained in [her]2604-her present position against [her]2604-her will , and was not a little relieved when [she]2604-her sat up and held out [her]2604-her hand for the shawl . " [I]2604-her must go , "[2604-her] [she]2604-her said . [The stranger]418-the stranger wrapped the shawl very carefully about [her]2604-her .

" Keep it close around [your]2604-her face , [Lyndall]59-lyndall ; it is very damp outside . Shall [I]2604-her walk with [you]2604-her to [the house]206-the house ? "[2604-her] " No . Lie down and rest ; [I]1161-his mistress will come and wake [you]2604-her at three o'clock . "[1161-his mistress] [She]2604-her lifted [her]2604-her face that [he]2601-he might kiss it , and , when [he]2601-he had kissed it once , [she]2604-her still held it that [he]2601-he might kiss it again . Then [he]2601-he let [her]2604-her out . [He]2601-he had seated [himself]2601-he at the fire - place , when [she]2604-her re - opened the door . " Have [you]2601-he forgotten anything ? "[1161-his mistress] " No . "[1161-his mistress] [She]2604-her gave one long , lingering look at [the old room]2615-the old room . When [she]2604-her was gone , and the door shut , [the stranger]418-the stranger filled [his]418-the stranger glass , and sat at the table sipping it thoughtfully .

The night outside was misty and damp ; the faint moonlight , trying to force its way through the thick air , made darkly visible the outlines of [the buildings]2617-the buildings . The stones and walls were moist ,

and now and then a drop , slowly collecting , fell from the eaves to the ground . [Doss]70-doss , not liking the change from [the cabin]460-the cabin 's warmth , ran quickly to the kitchen door - step ; but [[his]2601-he mistress]1161-his mistress walked slowly past [him]2601-he , and took [her]1161-his mistress way up the winding foot - path that ran beside the stone wall of [the camps]3869-the camps . When [she]1161-his mistress came to the end of [the last camp]2621-the last camp , [she]1161-his mistress threaded [her]1161-his mistress way among the stones and bushes till [she]1161-his mistress reached [[the German]281-the german 's grave]2623-the german 's grave . Why [she]1161-his mistress had come [there]317-there [she]1161-his mistress hardly knew ; [she]1161-his mistress stood looking down . Suddenly [she]1161-his mistress bent and put one hand on the face of a wet stone .

" [I]1161-his mistress shall never come to [you]4699-you again , "[1161-his mistress] [she]1161-his mistress said . Then [she]1161-his mistress knelt on the ground , and leaned [her]1161-his mistress face upon the stones .

" [Dear old man]1024-dear old man , [good old man]4701-good old man , [I]0-i am so tired ! "[0-i] [she]1161-his mistress said for [we]2625-we will come to the dead to tell secrets [we]2625-we would never have told to [the living]2626-the living . " [I]237-no one am so tired . There is light , there[237-no one]

is warmth , " [she]1161-his mistress wailed ; "[2629-she] why am [I]0-i alone , so hard , so cold ? [I]0-i am so weary of [myself]0-i ! It is eating [my]0-i soul to its core , self , self , self ! [I]0-i can not bear this life ! [I]0-i can not breathe , [I]0-i can not live ! Will nothing free [me]0-i from [myself]0-i ? " [She]1161-his mistress pressed [her]1161-his mistress cheek against the wooden post . "[2629-she] [I]0-i want to love ! [I]0-i want something great and pure to lift [me]0-i to itself ! [Dear old man]1024-dear old man , [I]0-i can not bear it any more ! [I]0-i am so cold , so hard , so hard ; will [no one]237-no one help [me]0-i ? "[2629-she]

The water gathered slowly on [her]2629-she shawl , and fell on to the wet stones ; but [she]2629-she lay there crying bitterly . For so [the living soul]2630-the living soul will cry to the dead , and the creature to [its God]2631-its god ; and of all this crying there comes nothing . The lifting up of the hands brings no salvation ; redemption is from within , and neither from [God]56-god nor [man]329-man ; it is wrought out by the soul itself , with suffering and through time .

[Doss]70-doss , on the kitchen door - step , shivered , and

wondered where [[his]70-doss mistress]1161-his mistress stayed so long ; and once , sitting sadly there in the damp , [he]70-doss had dropped asleep , and dreamed that [old Otto]66-old otto gave [him]70-doss a piece of bread , and patted [him]70-doss on the head , and when [he]70-doss woke [his]70-doss teeth chattered , and [he]70-doss moved to another stone to see if it was drier . At last [he]70-doss heard [[his]70-doss mistress]1161-his mistress 's step , and [they]2635-they went into [the house]206-the house together . [She]2629-she lit a candle , and walked to [[the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman 's bed - room]2638-the boer - woman 's bed - room . On a nail under [the lady in pink]2639-the lady in pink hung the key of the wardrobe . [She]2629-she took it down and opened the great press . From a little drawer [she]2629-she took fifty pounds all [she]2629-she had in [the world]252-the world , relocked the door , and turned to hang up the key . The marks of tears were still on [her]2629-she face , but [she]2629-she smiled .

" Fifty pounds for [a lover]1160-a lover ! A noble reward ! "[2644-the large , dark eyes from the glass] [she]2629-she said , and opened the wardrobe and returned the notes to the drawer .

Once in [[her]2629-she own room]2013-her own room , [she]2629-she arranged the

few articles [she]2629-she intended to take to - morrow , burnt [her]2629-she old letters , and then went back to [the front - room]2239-the front - room to look at the time . There were two hours yet before [she]2629-she must call [him]2643-him . [She]2629-she sat down at the dressing - table to wait , and leaned [her]2629-she elbows on it , and buried [her]2629-she face in [her]2629-she hands . The glass reflected the little brown head with its even parting , and the tiny hands on which it rested . Presently [she]2629-she looked up . [The large , dark eyes from the glass]2644-the large , dark eyes from the glass looked back at [her]2629-she . [She]2629-she looked deep into them .

" [We]4703-we are all alone , [you]2643-him and [I]2646-i , "[2646-i] [she]2629-she whispered ; " [no one]237-no one helps [us]4703-we , [no one]237-no one understands [us]4703-we ; but [we]4703-we will help [ourselves]4703-we . "[2629-she] The eyes looked back at [her]2629-she . There was a world of assurance in their still depths . So [they]2644-the large , dark eyes from the glass had looked at [her]2629-she ever since [she]2629-she could remember , when it was but [a small child]2645-a small child 's face above a blue pinafore [they]2644-the large , dark eyes from the glass had looked from . " [We]2647-we shall never be quite alone ,[2629-she]

[you]2646-i and [I]0-i , " [she]2629-she said ; "[2629-she] [we]2647-we shall always be together , as [we]2647-we were when [we]2647-we were little . "[156-gregory]

The beautiful eyes looked into the depths of [her]2629-she soul . " [We]4703-we are not afraid ; [we]4703-we will help [ourselves]4703-we ! "[54-em] [she]2629-she said . [She]2629-she stretched out [her]2629-she hand and pressed it over them on the glass . " [Dear eyes]4706-dear eyes ! [we]4703-we will never be quite alone till [they]4706-dear eyes part [us]4703-we ; till then ! "[54-em]

CHAPTER X. [GREGORY ROSE]156-gregory HAS AN IDEA .

[GREGORY ROSE]156-gregory was in [the loft]205-the loft putting [it]2649-it neat . Outside the rain poured ; a six months ' drought had broken , and [the thirsty plain]2650-the thirsty plain was drenched with water . What it could not swallow ran off in mad rivulets to the great " sloot , "[54-em] that now foamed like an angry river across [the flat]616-the flat . Even [the little furrow between [the farmhouse]643-the farmhouse and [the kraals]3975-the kraals]2652-the little furrow between the farmhouse and the kraals was now [a stream]2655-a stream , knee - deep , which almost bore away [the Kaffir - women who crossed [it]2652-the little furrow between the farmhouse and the kraals]2656-the kaffir - women who crossed it . It had rained for twenty - four hours , and still the rain poured on . [The fowls]2657-the fowls had collected [a melancholy crowd]2658-a melancholy crowd in and about [the waggon - house]229-the waggon - house , and [the

solitary gander , who alone had survived the six months ' want of water]2660-the solitary gander , who alone had survived the six months ' want of water , walked hither and thither , printing [his]2660-the solitary gander , who alone had survived the six months ' want of water webbed foot - marks on the mud , to have them washed out the next instant by the pelting rain , which at eleven o'clock still beat on the walls and [roofs]2661-roofs with unabated ardour .

[Gregory]156-gregory , as [he]156-gregory worked in [the loft]205-the loft , took no notice of it beyond stuffing a sack into the broken pane to keep it out ; and , in spite of the pelt and patter , [Em]54-em 's clear voice might be heard through the open trap - door from [the dining room]1311-the dining room , where [she]54-em sat at work , singing the " Blue Waterí[54-em]

" And take [me]156-gregory away , And take [me]156-gregory away , And take [me]156-gregory away , To [the Blue Water]46-the blue water "[156-gregory]

that quaint , childish song of [the people]1595-the people , that has a world of sweetness , and sad , vague yearning when sung over and over dreamily by [a woman]540-a woman 's voice as [she]540-a woman sits alone at [her]540-a woman work .

But [Gregory]156-gregory heard neither that nor yet the loud laughter of [the Kaffir maids]1998-the kaffir maids , that every now and again broke through from [the kitchen]798-the kitchen , where [they]1998-the kaffir maids joked and worked . Of late [Gregory]156-gregory had grown strangely impervious to the sounds and sights about [him]156-gregory . [His]156-gregory lease had run out , but [Em]54-em had said , " Do not renew it ; [I]156-gregory need one to help [me]156-gregory ; just stay on . "[156-gregory] And , [she]54-em had added , " [You]156-gregory must not remain in [[your]156-gregory own little house]4707-your own little house ; live with [me]156-gregory ; [you]156-gregory can look after [my]156-gregory ostriches better so . "[156-gregory]

And [Gregory]156-gregory did not thank [her]54-em . What difference did it make to [him]156-gregory , paying rent or not , living [there]317-there or not ; it was all one . But yet [he]156-gregory came . [Em]54-em wished that [he]156-gregory would still sometimes talk of the strength of [the master - right of man]2669-the master - right of man ; but [Gregory]156-gregory was as [one smitten on the cheek - bone]2670-one smitten on the cheek - bone . [She]54-em might do what [she]54-em pleased , [he]156-gregory would find no fault , had no word to say . [He]156-gregory had forgotten that it is [man]329-man 's right to rule . On that

rainy morning [he]156-gregory had lighted [his]156-gregory pipe at the kitchen fire , and when breakfast was over stood in the front door watching the water rush down [the road]888-the road till the pipe died out in [his]156-gregory mouth . [Em]54-em saw [she]54-em must do something for [him]156-gregory , and found [him]156-gregory a large calico duster . [He]156-gregory had sometimes talked of putting [the loft]205-the loft neat , and to - day [she]54-em could find nothing else for [him]156-gregory to do . So [she]54-em had the ladder put to the trap - door that [he]156-gregory need not go out in the wet , and [Gregory]156-gregory with the broom and duster mounted to [the loft]205-the loft . Once at work [he]156-gregory worked hard . [He]156-gregory dusted down the very rafters , and cleaned the broken candle moulds and bent forks that had stuck in the thatch for twenty years . [He]156-gregory placed the black bottles neatly in rows on an old box in the corner , and piled the skins on one another , and sorted the rubbish in all the boxes ; and at eleven o'clock [his]156-gregory work was almost done . [He]156-gregory seated [himself]156-gregory on the packing - case which had

once held [Waldo]60-waldo 's books , and proceeded to examine the contents of another which [he]156-gregory had not yet looked at . It was carelessly nailed down . [He]156-gregory loosened one plank , and began to lift out various articles of female attire old - fashioned caps , aprons , dresses with long pointed bodies such as [he]156-gregory remembered to have seen [[his]156-gregory mother]439-his mother wear when [he]156-gregory was [a little child]3461-a little child . [He]156-gregory shook them out carefully to see there were no moths , and then sat down to fold them up again one by one . They had belonged to [[Em]54-em 's mother]2677-em 's mother , and the box , as packed at [her]2677-em 's mother death , had stood untouched and forgotten these long years . [She]2677-em 's mother must have been [a tall woman]2678-a tall woman , [that mother of [Em]54-em 's]2679-that mother of em 's , for when [he]156-gregory stood up to shake out a dress the neck was on a level with [his]156-gregory , and the skirt touched the ground . [Gregory]156-gregory laid a night - cap out on [his]156-gregory knee , and began rolling up the strings ; but presently [his]156-gregory fingers moved slower and slower , then [his]156-gregory chin rested on [his]156-gregory breast , and

finally the imploring blue eyes were fixed on the frill abstractedly . When [Em]54-em 's voice called to [him]156-gregory from the foot of the ladder [he]156-gregory started , and threw the nightcap behind [him]156-gregory .

[She]54-em was only come to tell [him]156-gregory that [his]156-gregory cup of soup was ready ; and , when [he]156-gregory could hear that [she]54-em was gone , [he]156-gregory picked up the night - cap again , and a great brown sun-"kapje "[156-gregory] just such a " kapje "[156-gregory] and such a dress as one of those [he]156-gregory remembered to have seen [a sister - of - mercy]2680-a sister - of - mercy wear . [Gregory]156-gregory 's mind was very full of thought . [He]156-gregory took down a fragment of an old looking - glass from behind a beam , and put the " kapje "[54-em] on . [His]156-gregory beard looked somewhat grotesque under it ; [he]156-gregory put up [his]156-gregory hand to hide it that was better . The blue eyes looked out with the mild gentleness that became eyes looking out from under a " kapje . "[54-em] Next [he]156-gregory took the brown dress , and , looking round furtively , slipped it over [his]156-gregory head . [He]156-gregory had just got [his]156-gregory arms in the sleeves , and was

trying to hook up the back , when an increase in the patter of the rain at the window made [him]156-gregory drag it off hastily . When [he]156-gregory perceived there was [no one]237-no one coming [he]156-gregory tumbled the things back into the box , and , covering it carefully , went down the ladder .

[Em]54-em was still at [her]54-em work , trying to adjust a new needle in the machine . [Gregory]156-gregory drank [his]156-gregory soup , and then sat before [her]54-em , an awful and mysterious look in [his]156-gregory eyes . " [I]156-gregory am going to [town]1501-town to - morrow , "[156-gregory] [he]156-gregory said . " [I]54-em 'm almost afraid [you]156-gregory wo n't be able to go , "[54-em] said [Em]54-em , who was intent on [her]54-em needle ; " [I]2682-i do n't think it is going to leave off to - day . "[2682-i] " [I]0-i am going , "[0-i] said [Gregory]156-gregory . [Em]54-em looked up . " But the "[54-em] slootsí are as full as rivers ; [you]156-gregory can not go . [We]2682-i can wait for the post , " [she]54-em said . "[54-em] [I]0-i am not going for the post , " said [Gregory]156-gregory , impressively .[156-gregory]

[Em]54-em looked for explanation ; none came . " When will [you]156-gregory be back ? "[156-gregory] " [I]156-gregory am not coming back . "[156-gregory] " Are [you]156-gregory going to [[your]156-gregory friends]4709-your friends ? "[54-em] [Gregory]156-gregory waited , then caught [her]54-em by the wrist . " Look here , [Em]54-em , "[54-em] [he]156-gregory said between [his]156-gregory teeth , " [I]54-em ca n't stand it any more . [I]54-em am going to [her]59-lyndall . "[54-em] Since that day , when [he]156-gregory had come [home]302-home and found [Lyndall]59-lyndall gone , [he]156-gregory had never talked of [her]59-lyndall ; but [Em]54-em knew who it was who needed to be spoken of by no name . [She]54-em said , when [he]156-gregory had released [her]54-em hand , " But [you]156-gregory do not know where [she]59-lyndall is ? "[54-em] " Yes , [I]54-em do . [She]59-lyndall was in [Bloemfontein]47-bloemfontein when [I]54-em heard last . [I]54-em will go [there]317-there , and [I]54-em will find out where [she]59-lyndall went then , and then , and then ! [I]54-em will have [her]59-lyndall . "[54-em]

[Em]54-em turned the wheel quickly , and the ill - adjusted needle sprung into twenty fragments . " [Gregory]156-gregory , "[2684-he] [she]54-em said , " [she]59-lyndall does not want [us]4711-us ; [she]59-lyndall told [us]4711-us so clearly in the letter [she]59-lyndall wrote . "[54-em] A flush rose on [her]54-em face as [she]54-em spoke . " It will only be pain to [you]156-gregory , [Gregory]156-gregory . Will [she]59-lyndall like to have [you]156-gregory near [her]59-lyndall ? "[2684-he] There was an answer [he]2684-he might have made , but it was [his]2684-he secret , and [he]2684-he did not choose to share it . [He]2684-he said only , " [I]2684-he am going . "[2684-he] " Will [you]2684-he be gone long , [Gregory]156-gregory ? "[2684-he] " [I]2684-he do not know ; perhaps [I]2684-he shall never come back . Do what [you]2684-he please with [my]2684-he things . [I]2684-he can not stay [here]3430-here ! "[2684-he] [He]2684-he rose from [his]2684-he seat .
