[The Mozambiquer]185-the mozambiquer only showed [her]185-the mozambiquer white teeth good - naturedly for answer , and went out , and [the landlady]2978-the landlady followed [her]185-the mozambiquer . [Gregory]156-gregory , glad to be alone , watched the sunshine as it came over the fuchsias in the window , and ran up and down on the panelled door in the corner . [The Mozambiquer]185-the mozambiquer had closed it loosely behind [her]185-the mozambiquer , and presently something touched it inside . It moved a little , then it was still , then moved again ; then through the gap a small nose appeared , and a yellow ear overlapping one eye ; then the whole head obtruded , placed itself critically on one side , wrinkled its nose disapprovingly at [Gregory]156-gregory , and withdrew . Through the half - open door came a faint scent of toilet vinegar , and [the room]215-the room was dark and still . Presently [the landlady]2978-the landlady came back .

" Left the door open , "[156-gregory] [she]2978-the landlady said , bustling to shut it ; " but [a darkey]4841-a darkey will be [a darkey]4841-a darkey , and never carries a head on [its]4841-a darkey shoulders like[156-gregory]

[other folks]4210-other folks . Not ill , [I]0-i hope [sir]3573-sir , " [she]2978-the landlady said , looking at [Gregory]156-gregory when [she]2978-the landlady had shut the bed - room door .[156-gregory]

" No , "[156-gregory] said [Gregory]156-gregory , " no . "[3579-the mother] [The landlady]2978-the landlady began putting the things together . " Who , "[3579-the mother] asked [Gregory]156-gregory , " is in [that room]4843-that room ? "[3026-masters]

Glad to have a little innocent piece of gossip to relate , and [some one willing to hear it]2995-some one willing to hear it , [the landlady]2978-the landlady made the most of a little story as [she]2978-the landlady cleared the table . Six months before [a lady]1357-a lady had come alone to [the hotel]2976-the hotel in a waggon , with only [a coloured leader]2999-a coloured leader and [driver]3000-driver . Eight days after [a little baby had been born]3001-a little baby had been born . If [Gregory]156-gregory stood up and looked out at the window [he]156-gregory would see a blue gum - tree in [the grave - yard]3002-the grave - yard ; close by [it]3002-the grave - yard was [a little grave]3003-a little grave . [The baby]4494-the baby was buried there . A tiny thing , only lived two hours , and [the mother]3579-the mother [herself]3579-the mother almost went with [it]3006-it . After a while [she]3579-the mother was better ; but one day [she]3579-the mother got

up out of bed , dressed [herself]3579-the mother without saying a word to [any one]504-any one , and went out . It was a drizzly day ; a little time after [some one]3445-some one saw [her]3579-the mother sitting on the wet ground under the blue gum - tree , with the rain dripping from [her]3579-the mother hat and shawl . [They]3445-some one went to fetch [her]3579-the mother , but [she]3579-the mother would not come until [she]3579-the mother chose . When [she]3579-the mother did [she]3579-the mother had gone to bed and had not risen again from it ; never would , [the doctor]4524-the doctor said .

[She]3579-the mother was very patient , [poor thing]3010-poor thing . When [you]3011-you went in to ask [her]3579-the mother how [she]3579-the mother was [she]3579-the mother said always " Better , "[156-gregory] or " Nearly well ! "[156-gregory] and lay still in [the darkened room]3012-the darkened room , and never troubled [any one]504-any one . [The Mozambiquer]2987-the mozambiquer took care of [her]3579-the mother , and [she]3579-the mother would not allow [any one else]4268-any one else to touch [her]3579-the mother ; would not so much as allow [any one else]4268-any one else to see [her]3579-the mother foot uncovered . [She]3579-the mother was strange in many ways , but [she]3579-the mother paid well , [poor thing]3010-poor thing ; and now [the Mozambiquer]2987-the mozambiquer was going , and [she]3579-the mother would have to take up with [some one else]859-some one else .

[The landlady]2978-the landlady prattled on pleasantly , and now carried away the tray with the breakfast - things . When [she]3579-the mother was gone [Gregory]156-gregory leaned [his]156-gregory head on [his]156-gregory hands , but [he]156-gregory did not think long .

Before dinner [he]156-gregory had ridden out of [the town]612-the town to where on a rise a number of [transport - waggons]3022-transport - waggons were out - spanned . [The Dutchman driver of one]3023-the dutchman driver of one wondered at [the stranger]418-the stranger 's eagerness to free [himself]3023-the dutchman driver of one of [[his]3023-the dutchman driver of one horses]3025-his horses . Stolen perhaps ; but it was worth [his]3023-the dutchman driver of one while to buy [them]3025-his horses at so low a price . So the horses changed [masters]3026-masters , and [Gregory]156-gregory walked off with [his]156-gregory saddle - bags slung across [his]156-gregory arm . Once out of sight of [the waggons]3027-the waggons [he]156-gregory struck out of [the road]888-the road and walked across [the " veld]4844-the " veld , "[156-gregory] the dry , flowering grasses waving everywhere about [him]156-gregory ; half way across [the plain]196-the plain [he]156-gregory came to [a deep gully]3030-a deep gully which the rain torrents had washed out , but which was now dry . [Gregory]156-gregory sprung down into [its]3030-a deep gully red bed . [It]3030-a deep gully was a safe place , and quiet . When [he]156-gregory had looked about [him]156-gregory [he]156-gregory sat

down under the shade of an overhanging bank and fanned [himself]156-gregory with [his]156-gregory hat , for the afternoon was hot , and [he]156-gregory had walked fast . At [his]156-gregory feet the dusty ants ran about , and [the high red bank before [him]156-gregory]3031-the high red bank before him was covered by a network of roots and fibres washed bare by the rains . Above [his]156-gregory head rose the clear blue African sky ; at [his]156-gregory side were the saddle - bags full of [women]1671-women 's clothing . [Gregory]156-gregory looked up half plaintively into the blue sky .

" Am [I]3039-a rather tall woman , am [I]3039-a rather tall woman [Gregory Nazianzen Rose]156-gregory ? "[3039-a rather tall woman] [he]156-gregory said .

It was also strange , [he]156-gregory sitting there in that " sloot "[3044-her] in [that up - country plain]3033-that up - country plain ! strange as the fantastic , changing shapes in a summer cloud . At last , tired out , [he]156-gregory fell asleep , with [his]156-gregory head against [the bank]4445-the bank . When [he]156-gregory woke the shadow had stretched across the " sloot , "[2978-the landlady] and the sun was on the edge of [the plain]196-the plain . Now [he]156-gregory must be up and doing . [He]156-gregory drew from [his]156-gregory breast pocket a little sixpenny looking - glass , and

hung it on one of the roots that stuck out from [the bank]4445-the bank . Then [he]156-gregory dressed [himself]156-gregory in one of the old - fashioned gowns and a great pinked out collar . Then [he]156-gregory took out a razor . Tuft by tuft the soft brown beard fell down into the sand , and the little ants took it to line [their]3037-their nests with . Then the glass showed a face surrounded by a frilled cap , white as [a woman]540-a woman 's , with a little mouth , a very short upper lip , and a receding chin .

Presently [a rather tall woman]3039-a rather tall woman 's figure was making its way across the " veld . "[2978-the landlady] As it passed a hollowed - out ant - heap [it]3040-it knelt down , and stuffed in the saddle - bags with [the man]372-the man 's clothing , closing up the ant - hill with bits of ground to look as natural as possible . Like [a sinner]3042-a sinner hiding [his]3042-a sinner deed of sin , [Gregory]156-gregory started once and looked round , but yet there was [no one]237-no one near save a " meerkat , "[2978-the landlady] who had lifted [herself]3044-her out of [her]3044-her hole and sat on [her]3044-her hind legs

watching . [He]156-gregory did not like that even [she]3044-her should see , and when [he]156-gregory rose [she]3044-her dived away into [[her]3044-her hole]3045-her hole . Then [he]156-gregory walked on leisurely , that the dusk might have reached [the village streets]3046-the village streets before [he]156-gregory walked [there]317-there . [The first house]3048-the first house was [the smith]3049-the smith 's , and before the open door [two idle urchins]3050-two idle urchins lolled . As [he]156-gregory hurried up [the street]1513-the street in the gathering gloom [he]156-gregory heard [them]3050-two idle urchins laugh long and loudly behind [him]156-gregory . [He]156-gregory glanced round fearingly , and would almost have fled , but that the strange skirts clung about [his]156-gregory legs . And after all it was only a spark that had alighted on the head of one , and not the strange figure [they]3050-two idle urchins laughed at .

The door of [the hotel]2976-the hotel stood wide open , and the light fell out into [the street]1513-the street . [He]156-gregory knocked , and [the landlady]2978-the landlady came . [She]2978-the landlady peered out to look for [the cart that had brought [the traveller]3056-the traveller]3055-the cart that had brought the traveller ; but [Gregory]156-gregory 's heart was brave now [he]156-gregory was so near [the quiet room]3057-the quiet room . [He]156-gregory told [her]2978-the landlady [he]156-gregory had come

with the transport waggons that stood outside [the town]612-the town .

[He]156-gregory had walked in , and wanted [lodgings]3059-lodgings for the night . It was a deliberate lie , glibly told ; [he]156-gregory would have told fifty , though [the recording angel]3060-the recording angel had stood in [the next room]221-the next room with [his]3060-the recording angel pen dipped in the ink . What was it to [him]156-gregory ? [He]156-gregory remembered that [she]2978-the landlady lay there saying always , " [I]2978-the landlady am better . "[2978-the landlady]

[The landlady]2978-the landlady put [his]156-gregory supper in [the little parlour where [he]156-gregory had sat in the morning]3063-the little parlour where he had sat in the morning . When it was on the table [she]2978-the landlady sat down in the rocking - chair , as [her]2978-the landlady fashion was , to knit and talk , that [she]2978-the landlady might gather news for [[her]2978-the landlady customers]3064-her customers in [the tap - room]2970-the tap - room . In the white face under the queer , deep - fringed cap [she]2978-the landlady saw nothing of [the morning 's traveller]3066-the morning 's traveller . [The newcomer]3067-the newcomer was communicative . [She]3067-the newcomer was [a nurse]4807-a nurse by profession , [she]2978-the landlady said ; had come to [the Transvaal]48-the transvaal hearing that [good nurses]3069-good nurses were needed [there]317-there . [She]3067-the newcomer had

not yet found work . [The landlady]2978-the landlady did not perhaps know whether there would be any for [her]3067-the newcomer in [that town]2887-that town ?

[The landlady]2978-the landlady put down [her]2978-the landlady knitting and smote [her]2978-the landlady fat hands together . If it was n't the very finger of [God]56-god 's Providence , as though [you]3074-you saw it hanging out of the sky , [she]2978-the landlady said . Here was [a lady sick and needing a new nurse]3075-a lady sick and needing a new nurse that very day , and not able to get one to [her]3075-a lady sick and needing a new nurse mind , and now well , if it was n't enough to convert [all [the atheists]3077-the atheists and free - thinkers in [the Transvaal]4687-the transvaal]3076-all the atheists and free - thinkers in the transvaal , [she]2978-the landlady did n't know ! Then [the landlady]2978-the landlady proceeded to detail facts . " [I]693-the woman 'm sure [you]3074-you will suit [her]3075-a lady sick and needing a new nurse , "[693-the woman] [she]2978-the landlady added ; " [you]3074-you 're just [the kind]4845-the kind . [She]3075-a lady sick and needing a new nurse has heaps of money to pay [you]3074-you with ; has everything that money can buy . [She]3075-a lady sick and needing a new nurse is asleep now , but [I]693-the woman 'll take [you]3074-you in to look at [her]3075-a lady sick and needing a new nurse . "[693-the woman]

[The landlady]2978-the landlady opened the door of [the next room]221-the next room , and [Gregory]156-gregory followed [her]2978-the landlady . A table stood

near the bed , and a lamp burning low stood on it ; the bed was a great four - poster with white curtains , and the quilt was of rich crimson satin . But [Gregory]156-gregory stood just inside the door with [his]156-gregory head bent low , and saw no further .

" Come nearer ! [I]2978-the landlady 'll turn the lamp up a bit , that [you]3074-you can have a look at [her]3075-a lady sick and needing a new nurse . A pretty thing , is n't it ? "[2978-the landlady] said [the landlady]2978-the landlady . Near the foot of the bed was a dent in the crimson quilt , and out of it [Doss]70-doss 's small head and bright eyes looked knowingly . Then [Gregory]156-gregory looked up at what lay on the cushion . [A little white , white face , transparent as an angel]3083-a little white , white face , transparent as an angel 's with a cloth bound round the forehead , and with soft hair tossed about on the pillow .

" [We]4846-we had to cut it off , "[156-gregory] said [the woman]693-the woman ,

touching it with [her]693-the woman fore - finger . " Soft as silk , like a wax doll 's . "[2978-the landlady]

But [Gregory]156-gregory 's heart was bleeding . " Never get up again , [the doctor]4524-the doctor says , "[59-lyndall] said [the landlady]2978-the landlady . [Gregory]156-gregory uttered one word . In an instant the beautiful eyes opened widely , looked round [the room]215-the room and into the dark corners . " Who is [here]3430-here ? Whom did [I]59-lyndall hear speak ? "[59-lyndall] [Gregory]156-gregory had sunk back behind the curtain ; [the landlady]2978-the landlady drew it aside , and pulled [him]156-gregory forward . " Only [this lady]4849-this lady , [ma'am a nurse by profession]4850-ma'am a nurse by profession . [She]4849-this lady is willing to stay and take care of [you]156-gregory , if [you]156-gregory can come to terms with [her]4849-this lady . "[2978-the landlady] [Lyndall]59-lyndall raised [herself]59-lyndall on [her]59-lyndall elbow , and cast one keen scrutinizing glance over [him]156-gregory . " Have [I]2978-the landlady never seen [you]156-gregory before ? "[2978-the landlady] [she]59-lyndall asked . " No . "[59-lyndall] [She]59-lyndall fell back wearily .

" Perhaps [you]156-gregory would like to arrange the terms between [yourselves]156-gregory , "[59-lyndall] said [the landlady]2978-the landlady . " Here is a chair . [I]59-lyndall will be back presently . "[59-lyndall] [Gregory]156-gregory sat down , with bent head and quick breath . [She]59-lyndall did not speak , and lay with half - closed eyes , seeming to have forgotten [him]156-gregory . " Will [you]156-gregory turn the lamp down a little ? "[59-lyndall] [she]59-lyndall said at last ; " [I]59-lyndall can not bear the light . "[59-lyndall] Then [his]156-gregory heart grew braver in the shadow , and [he]156-gregory spoke . Nursing was to [him]156-gregory , [he]156-gregory said , a pleasure . [He]156-gregory wanted no money : if [She]59-lyndall stopped [him]156-gregory . " [I]59-lyndall take no service for which [I]59-lyndall do not pay , "[59-lyndall] [she]59-lyndall said . " What [I]59-lyndall gave to [[my]59-lyndall last nurse]4851-my last nurse [I]59-lyndall will give to [you]156-gregory ; if [you]156-gregory do not like it [you]156-gregory may go . "[59-lyndall] And [Gregory]156-gregory muttered humbly , [he]156-gregory would take it .

Afterward [she]59-lyndall tried to turn [herself]59-lyndall . [He]156-gregory lifted [her]59-lyndall . Ah ! such a shrunken little body , [he]156-gregory

could feel its weakness as [he]156-gregory touched it . [His]156-gregory hands were to [him]156-gregory glorified for that service .

" Thank [you]156-gregory ! that is so nice . [Other people]4289-other people hurt [me]4524-the doctor when [they]4289-other people touch [me]4524-the doctor , "[4524-the doctor] [she]59-lyndall said . " Thank [you]156-gregory ! "[59-lyndall] Then after a little while [she]59-lyndall repeated humbly , " Thank [you]156-gregory ; [they]4289-other people hurt [me]156-gregory so . "[156-gregory]

[Gregory]156-gregory sat down trembling . [His]156-gregory little ewe - lamb , could [he]156-gregory hurt [her]59-lyndall ?

[The doctor]4524-the doctor said of [Gregory]156-gregory four days after , " [She]59-lyndall is [the most experienced nurse [I]59-lyndall ever came in contact with]4853-the most experienced nurse i ever came in contact with . "[59-lyndall] [Gregory]156-gregory , standing in [the passage]3090-the passage , heard it and laughed in [his]156-gregory heart . What need had [he]156-gregory of experience ? Experience teaches [us]3091-us in a millennium what passion teaches [us]3091-us in an hour . [A Kaffir]110-kaffir studies all [his]110-kaffir life the discerning of distant sounds ; but [he]110-kaffir will never hear [my]0-i step , when [[my]0-i love]4051-my love hears it , coming to [her]4051-my love window in the dark over the short grass .

At first [Gregory]156-gregory 's heart was sore when

day by day the body grew lighter , and the mouth [he]156-gregory fed took less ; but afterward [he]156-gregory grew accustomed to it , and was happy . For passion has one cry , one only " Oh , to touch [thee]4051-my love , [Beloved]167-beloved sister ! "[59-lyndall]

In [that quiet room]3093-that quiet room [Lyndall]59-lyndall lay on the bed with the dog at [her]59-lyndall feet , and [Gregory]156-gregory sat in [his]156-gregory dark corner watching . [She]59-lyndall seldom slept , and through those long , long days [she]59-lyndall would lie watching the round streak of sunlight that came through the knot in the shutter , or the massive lion 's paw on which the wardrobe rested . What thoughts were in those eyes ? [Gregory]156-gregory wondered ; [he]156-gregory dared not ask .

Sometimes [Doss]70-doss where [he]156-gregory lay on [her]59-lyndall feet would dream that [they]3094-they two were in [the cart]2314-the cart , tearing over the " veld , "[59-lyndall] with the black horses snorting , and the wind in [their]3094-they faces ; and [he]156-gregory would start up in [his]156-gregory sleep and bark aloud . Then

awaking , [he]156-gregory would lick [[his]156-gregory mistress]1161-his mistress 's hand almost remorsefully , and slink quietly down into [[his]156-gregory place]3097-his place .

[Gregory]156-gregory thought [she]59-lyndall had no pain , [she]59-lyndall never groaned ; only sometimes , when the light was near [her]59-lyndall , [he]156-gregory thought [he]156-gregory could see contractions about [her]59-lyndall lips and eyebrows . [He]156-gregory slept on the sofa outside [her]59-lyndall door . One night [he]156-gregory thought [he]156-gregory heard a sound , and , opening it softly , [he]156-gregory looked in . [She]59-lyndall was crying out aloud , as if [she]59-lyndall and [her]59-lyndall pain were alone in [the world]252-the world . The light fell on the red quilt , and the little hands that were clasped over the head . The wide - open eyes were looking up , and the heavy drops fell slowly from them . " [I]59-lyndall can not bear any more , not any more , "[59-lyndall] [she]59-lyndall said in a deep voice . " Oh , [God]56-god , [God]56-god ! have [I]156-gregory not borne in silence ? Have [I]156-gregory not endured these long , long months ? But now , now , oh , [God]56-god , [I]156-gregory can not ! "[156-gregory]

[Gregory]156-gregory knelt in the door - way listening . " [I]156-gregory do not ask for wisdom , not human love , not work , not knowledge , not for all things [I]156-gregory have longed for , "[156-gregory] [she]59-lyndall cried ; " only a little freedom from pain ! Only one little hour without pain ! "[59-lyndall] [She]59-lyndall sat up , and bit the little hand [Gregory]156-gregory loved . [He]156-gregory crept away to the front door , and stood looking out at the quiet starlight . When [he]156-gregory came back [she]59-lyndall was lying in [her]59-lyndall usual posture , the quiet eyes looking at the lion 's claw . [He]156-gregory came close to the bed . " [You]59-lyndall have much pain to - night ? "[156-gregory] [he]156-gregory asked [her]59-lyndall . " No , not much . "[3100-they] " Can [I]2978-the landlady do anything for [you]59-lyndall ? "[2978-the landlady] " No , nothing . "[2978-the landlady]

[She]59-lyndall still drew [her]59-lyndall lips quivering together , and motioned with [her]59-lyndall fingers toward the dog who

lay sleeping at [her]59-lyndall feet . [Gregory]156-gregory lifted [him]156-gregory and laid [him]156-gregory at [her]59-lyndall side . [She]59-lyndall made [Gregory]156-gregory turn open the bosom of [her]59-lyndall night - dress , that the dog might put [his]156-gregory black muzzle between [her]59-lyndall breasts . [She]59-lyndall crossed [her]59-lyndall arms over [him]156-gregory . [Gregory]156-gregory left [them]3099-them lying there together .

Next day , when [they]3100-they asked [her]59-lyndall how [she]59-lyndall was , [she]59-lyndall answered " Better . "[3102-the little doctor , egged on and on] " [Some one]3445-some one ought to tell [her]59-lyndall , "[2978-the landlady] said [the landlady]2978-the landlady ; " [we]3100-they ca n't let [her]59-lyndall soul go out into eternity not knowing , especially when [I]113-wondering do n't think it was all right about [the child]3411-the child . [You]156-gregory ought to go and tell [her]59-lyndall , [Doctor]4856-doctor . "[113-wondering] So , [the little doctor , egged on and on]3102-the little doctor , egged on and on , went in at last . " The next time [you]2978-the landlady have any devil 's work to do , do it [yourself]2978-the landlady , "[2978-the landlady] [he]3102-the little doctor , egged on and on said , and [he]3102-the little doctor , egged on and on shook [his]3102-the little doctor , egged on and on fist in [her]2978-the landlady face again , and went away swearing .

When [Gregory]156-gregory went into [the bed - room]2407-the bed - room [he]156-gregory

only found [her]2978-the landlady moved , [her]2978-the landlady body curled up , and drawn close to the wall . [He]156-gregory dared not disturb [her]2978-the landlady . At last , after a long time , [she]2978-the landlady turned .

" Bring [me]2978-the landlady food , "[2978-the landlady] [she]2978-the landlady said , " [I]2978-the landlady want to eat . Two eggs , and toast , and meat two large slices of toast , please . "[2978-the landlady] [Wondering]113-wondering , [Gregory]156-gregory brought a tray with all that [she]2978-the landlady had asked for . " Sit [me]2978-the landlady up , and put it close to [me]2978-the landlady , "[2978-the landlady] [she]2978-the landlady said ; " [I]2978-the landlady am going to eat it all . "[2978-the landlady] [She]2978-the landlady tried to draw the things near [her]2978-the landlady with [her]2978-the landlady fingers , and re - arranged the plates . [She]2978-the landlady cut the toast into long strips , broke open both eggs , put a tiny morsel of bread into [her]2978-the landlady own mouth , and fed the dog .

" Is it twelve o'clock yet ? "[156-gregory] [she]2978-the landlady said , fingering the meat ; " [I]2978-the landlady think [I]2978-the landlady do not generally eat so early . Put it away , please , carefully , no , do not take it away , on the side table . When the clock strikes twelve [I]2978-the landlady will eat it . "[2978-the landlady]

[She]2978-the landlady lay down trembling . After a little while [she]2978-the landlady said , " Give [me]2978-the landlady [my]2978-the landlady clothes . Put them on that chair . [My]2978-the landlady collars are in the little box , [my]2978-the landlady boots behind the door . " Put it nearer , "[2978-the landlady] [she]2978-the landlady said , " [I]2978-the landlady can not see it ; "[2978-the landlady] and [she]2978-the landlady lay watching the clothes , with [her]2978-the landlady hand under [her]2978-the landlady cheek . " Now open the shutter wide , "[2978-the landlady] [she]2978-the landlady said ; " [I]2978-the landlady am going to read . "[2978-the landlady] The old , old tone was again in the sweet voice . [He]156-gregory opened the shutter , and raised [her]2978-the landlady up among the pillows .

" Now bring [my]2978-the landlady books to [me]2978-the landlady , "[2978-the landlady] [she]2978-the landlady said ,

motioning eagerly with [her]2978-the landlady fingers ; " the large book , and the reviews and the plays ; [I]2978-the landlady want them all . "[2978-the landlady]

[He]156-gregory piled them round [her]2978-the landlady on the bed ; [she]2978-the landlady drew them greedily closer , [her]2978-the landlady eyes very bright , though [her]2978-the landlady face was white . " Now the big one off the drawers . No , [you]156-gregory need not help [me]2978-the landlady to hold [my]2978-the landlady book , "[2978-the landlady] [she]2978-the landlady said ; " [I]2978-the landlady can hold it for [myself]2978-the landlady . "[2978-the landlady] [Gregory]156-gregory went back to [his]156-gregory corner , and for a little time the restless turning of many leaves was to be heard . " Will [you]156-gregory open the window , "[156-gregory] [she]2978-the landlady said , almost querulously , " and throw this book out ? It is so utterly foolish . [I]2978-the landlady thought it was a nice book ; but the words are merely strung together , they make no sense . Yes so ! "[2978-the landlady] [she]2978-the landlady said with approval , seeing [him]156-gregory fling it out into [the street]1513-the street . " [I]2978-the landlady must have been very foolish when [I]2978-the landlady thought that book nice . "[2978-the landlady]

Then [she]2978-the landlady turned to read , and leaned [her]2978-the landlady little elbows resolutely on the great volume , and knit [her]2978-the landlady brows . This was Shakespeare it must mean something . " [I]2978-the landlady wish [you]156-gregory would take a handkerchief and tie it tight round [my]2978-the landlady head , it aches so . "[2978-the landlady] [He]156-gregory had not been long in [his]156-gregory seat when [he]156-gregory saw drops fall from beneath the hands that shaded the eyes , on to the page . " [I]156-gregory am not accustomed to so much light , it makes [my]156-gregory head swim a little , "[156-gregory] [she]2978-the landlady said . " Go out and close the shutter . "[156-gregory] When [he]156-gregory came back , [she]2978-the landlady lay shrivelled up among the pillows . [He]156-gregory heard no sound of weeping , but the shoulders shook .

When [Gregory]156-gregory went to [his]156-gregory sofa that night , [she]2978-the landlady told [him]156-gregory to wake [her]2978-the landlady early , for [she]2978-the landlady must be up before breakfast . Nevertheless , when morning came , [she]2978-the landlady said it was a little cold , and lay all day watching [her]2978-the landlady clothes upon the chair . Still

[she]2978-the landlady sent for [her]2978-the landlady oxen in [the country]4733-the country ; [they]3108-they would start on Monday .

In the afternoon [she]2978-the landlady told [him]156-gregory to open the window wide , and draw the bed near it . It was a leaden afternoon , the dull rain - clouds rested close to the roofs of [the houses]4806-the houses , and [the little street]3110-the little street was silent and deserted . Now and then a gust of wind eddying round caught up the dried leaves , whirled them hither and thither under the trees , and dropped them again into the gutter ; then all was quiet . [She]2978-the landlady lay looking out . Presently the bell of [the church]656-the church began to toll , and up [the village street]3112-the village street came a long procession . [They]3113-they were carrying [an old man]4141-an old man to [his]4141-an old man last resting - place . [She]2978-the landlady followed [them]3113-they with [her]2978-the landlady eyes till [they]3113-they turned in among the trees at the gate . " Who was that ? "[2978-the landlady] [she]2978-the landlady asked . " [An old man]4141-an old man , "[2978-the landlady] [he]156-gregory answered , " [a very old man]4858-a very old man ; [they]3113-they say [he]4141-an old man was ninety - four ; but [his]4141-an old man name [I]156-gregory do not know . "[156-gregory]

[She]2978-the landlady mused a while , looking out with fixed eyes . " That is why the bell rang so cheerfully , "[2978-the landlady] [she]2978-the landlady said . " When [the old]4859-the old die it is well ; [they]4859-the old have had [their]4859-the old time . It is when [the young]1350-the young die that the bells weep drops of blood . "[2978-the landlady] " But the old love life ? "[2978-the landlady] [he]156-gregory said ; for it was sweet to hear [her]2978-the landlady speak . [She]2978-the landlady raised [herself]2978-the landlady on [her]2978-the landlady elbow .

" [They]4859-the old love life , [they]4859-the old do not want to die , "[3116-they] [she]2978-the landlady answered , " but what of that ? [They]4859-the old have had [their]4859-the old time . [They]4859-the old knew that [a man]242-a man 's life is three - score years and ten ; [they]4859-the old should have made [their]4859-the old plans accordingly ! But [the young]1350-the young , "[2978-the landlady] [she]2978-the landlady said , " [the young]1350-the young , cut down , cruelly , when [they]1350-the young have not seen , when [they]1350-the young have not known , when [they]1350-the young have not found it is for [them]1350-the young that the bells weep blood . [I]2978-the landlady heard in the ringing it was [an old man]4141-an old man . When [the old die]4865-the old die Listen to the bell ! it is laughing "[2978-the landlady] It is right , it is right ; [he]3115-he

has had [his]3115-he time.í [They]3116-they can not ring so for [the young]1350-the young . "[2978-the landlady]

[She]2978-the landlady fell back exhausted ; the hot light died from [her]2978-the landlady eyes , and [she]2978-the landlady lay looking out into [the street]1513-the street . [By - and - bye stragglers from the funeral]3119-by - and - bye stragglers from the funeral began to come back and disappear here and there among [the houses]4806-the houses ; then all was quiet , and the night began to settle down upon [the village street]3112-the village street . When [the room]215-the room was quite dark , so that [they]3123-they could not see [each other]280-each other 's faces , [she]2978-the landlady said , " It will rain to - night ; "[2978-the landlady] and moved restlessly on the pillows . " How terrible when the rain falls down on [you]3125-you drop by drop ! "[2978-the landlady] [He]3125-you wondered what [she]2978-the landlady meant . [She]2978-the landlady moved again . " Will [you]3125-you presently take [my]2978-the landlady cloak the new grey cloak from behind the door and go with it . [You]3125-you will find a little grave at the foot of the tall blue gum - tree ; the water drips off the long , pointed leaves ; [you]3125-you must cover it up with that . "[2978-the landlady]

[Gregory]156-gregory assented , and there was silence again . It was the first time [she]2978-the landlady had ever spoken of [[her]2978-the landlady child]3126-her child . " It was so small , "[2978-the landlady] [she]2978-the landlady said ; " it lived such a little while only three hours . [They]4866-they laid it close by [me]2978-the landlady , but [I]2978-the landlady never saw it ; [I]2978-the landlady could feel it by [me]2978-the landlady . "[2978-the landlady] [She]2978-the landlady waited ; " [Its]3126-her child feet were so cold ; [I]2978-the landlady took them in [my]2978-the landlady hand to make them warm , and [my]2978-the landlady hand closed right over [them]3126-her child they were so little . "[2978-the landlady] There was a tremor in the voice . " It crept close to [me]3133-you ; it wanted to drink , it wanted to be warm . "[3133-you] [She]2978-the landlady moved [her]2978-the landlady hand : " [I]3133-you did not love it ; [its father]4814-its father was not [[my]3133-you prince]4868-my prince ; [I]3133-you did not care for it ; but it was so little . "[3133-you] Uneasily [she]2978-the landlady moved upon [her]2978-the landlady pillows . " [They]4869-they might have kissed it , one of [them]4869-they , before [they]4869-they put it in . It never did [any one]504-any one any harm in all [its]3445-some one little life . [They]4869-they might have kissed it . "[3134-the man with the languid eyelids] [Gregory]156-gregory thought [he]156-gregory felt rather than heard [some one]3445-some one sobbing in [the room]215-the room .

Late on in the evening , when the shutter was closed and the lamp lighted , and the rain - drops beat on the roof , [he]156-gregory took the cloak from behind the door and went away with it . On [his]156-gregory way back [he]156-gregory called at [the village post - office]3129-the village post - office and brought back a letter . In [the hall]3130-the hall [he]156-gregory stood reading the address . How could [he]156-gregory fail to know whose hand had written it ? Had [he]156-gregory not long ago studied those characters on the torn fragments of paper in [the old parlour]3131-the old parlour ? A burning pain was at [Gregory]156-gregory 's heart . If now , now at the last , one should come , should step in between ! [He]156-gregory carried the letter into [the bed - room]2407-the bed - room and gave it to [her]3133-you . When [she]3133-you had read it , " Give [me]3135-my [my]3135-my desk , "[3135-my] [she]3133-you said ; " open it before [me]3135-my . "[3135-my]

Then [Gregory]156-gregory sat down in the lamp - light on the other side of the curtain , and heard the pencil move on the paper . When [he]156-gregory looked round the curtain [she]3133-you was lying on the pillow with a flushed face , the hand writing quickly .

The open letter lay at [her]3133-you side ; [she]3133-you glanced at it with soft eyes . [The man with the languid eyelids]3134-the man with the languid eyelids must have been strangely moved before [his]3134-the man with the languid eyelids hand set down those words : " Let [me]3135-my come back to [you]3133-you ! [[My]3135-my darling]4263-my darling , let [me]3135-my put [my]3135-my hand round [you]3133-you , and guard [you]3133-you from all [the world]252-the world . As [[my]3135-my wife]3448-my wife [they]4874-they shall never touch [you]3133-you . [I]3135-my have learnt to love [you]3133-you more wisely , more tenderly , than of old ; [you]3133-you shall have perfect freedom . [Lyndall]59-lyndall , [grand little woman]4875-grand little woman , for [your]3133-you own sake be [[my]3135-my wife]3448-my wife ![3135-my]

" Why did [you]3133-you send that money back to [me]3142-a nobler woman ? [You]3133-you are cruel to [me]3142-a nobler woman ; it is not rightly done . "[3142-a nobler woman] [She]3135-my rolled the little red pencil softly between [her]3135-my fingers , and [her]3135-my face grew very soft . Yet

" It can not be , "[3136-she] [she]3135-my wrote ; " [I]3136-she thank [you]3133-you much for the love [you]3133-you have shown [me]3136-she ; but [I]3136-she can not listen . [You]3136-she will call [me]3136-she mad , foolish [the world]252-the world would do so ; but [I]3136-she know what [I]3136-she need and the kind of path [I]3136-she must[3136-she]

walk in . [I]0-i can not marry [you]3136-she . [I]0-i will always love [you]3136-she for the sake of what lay by [me]0-i those three hours ; [we]3137-we may be [friends]4331-friends , but there it ends . [I]0-i must know , see , suffer , taste of life ; [I]0-i can not be bound to one whom [I]0-i love as [I]0-i love [you]3136-she . [I]0-i am not afraid of [the world]252-the world [I]0-i will fight [the world]252-the world . One day perhaps it may be far off [I]0-i shall find what [I]0-i have wanted all [my]0-i life ; something nobler , stronger than [I]0-i , before which [I]0-i can kneel down . [You]3136-she lose nothing by not having [me]0-i now ; [I]0-i am [a weak , selfish , erring woman]3141-a weak , selfish , erring woman . One day [I]0-i shall find something to worship , and then [I]0-i shall be [a nobler woman]3142-a nobler woman "[3136-she]

" [Nurse]4878-nurse , "[156-gregory] [she]3136-she said ; " take [my]3136-she desk away ; [I]3136-she am suddenly so sleepy ; [I]3136-she will write more to - morrow . "[3136-she] [She]3136-she turned [her]3136-she face to the pillow ; it was the sudden drowsiness of great weakness . [She]3136-she had dropped asleep in a moment , and [Gregory]156-gregory moved the desk softly , and then sat in the chair watching . Hour after hour passed , but

[he]156-gregory had no wish for rest , and sat on , hearing the rain cease , and the still night settle down everywhere . At a quarter - past twelve [he]156-gregory rose , and took a last look at the bed where [she]3136-she lay sleeping so peacefully ; then [he]156-gregory turned to go to [his]156-gregory couch . Before [he]156-gregory had reached the door [she]3136-she had started up and was calling [him]156-gregory back .

" [You]156-gregory are sure [you]156-gregory have put it up ? "[3136-she] [she]3136-she said , with a look of blank terror at the window . " It will not fall open in the night , the shutter [you]156-gregory are sure ? "[3136-she] [He]156-gregory comforted [her]3136-she . Yes , it was tightly fastened . " Even if it is shut , "[3136-she] [she]3136-she said , in a whisper , " [you]156-gregory can not keep it out ! [You]156-gregory feel it coming in at four o'clock , creeping , creeping , up , up ; deadly cold ! "[156-gregory] [She]3136-she shuddered . [He]156-gregory thought [she]3136-she was wandering , and laid [her]3136-she little trembling body down among the blankets . " [I]3136-she dreamed just now that it was not put up , "[3136-she] [she]3136-she said , looking into [his]156-gregory eyes ; " and it crept right in and [I]3136-she was alone with it . "[3136-she]

" What do [you]3136-she fear ? "[156-gregory] [he]156-gregory asked tenderly . " The Gray Dawn , "[3136-she] [she]3136-she said , glancing round at the window . " [I]3136-she was never afraid of anything , never when [I]3136-she was [a little child]3461-a little child , but [I]3136-she have always been afraid of that . [You]156-gregory will not let it come in to [me]3136-she ? "[3136-she] " No , no ; [I]156-gregory will stay with [you]3136-she , "[156-gregory] [he]156-gregory continued . But [she]3136-she was growing calmer . " No ; [you]156-gregory must go to bed . [I]3136-she only awoke with a start ; [you]156-gregory must be tired . [I]3136-she am childish , that is all ; "[3136-she] but [she]3136-she shivered again . [He]156-gregory sat down beside [her]3136-she , after some time [she]3136-she said : " Will [you]156-gregory not rub [my]3136-she feet ? "[3136-she] [He]156-gregory knelt down at the foot of the bed and took the tiny foot in [his]156-gregory hand ; it was swollen and unsightly now , but as [he]156-gregory touched it [he]156-gregory bent down and covered it with kisses .

" It makes it better when [you]3136-she kiss it ; thank [you]3136-she . What makes [you]3143-you all love [me]3136-she so ? "[3136-she] Then dreamily [she]3136-she muttered to [herself]3136-she : " Not utterly[3147-it]

bad , not quite bad what makes [them]3143-you all love [me]0-i so ? "[3136-she]

Rubbing , rubbing softly , with [his]156-gregory cheek pressed against the little foot , [Gregory]156-gregory dropped to sleep at last . How long [he]156-gregory knelt there [he]156-gregory could not tell , but when [he]156-gregory started up awake [she]3136-she was not looking at [him]156-gregory . The eyes were fixed on the far corner , gazing wide and intent , with an unearthly light .

[He]156-gregory looked round fearfully . What did [she]3136-she see [there]317-there ? [[God]56-god 's angels]3145-god 's angels come to call [her]3136-she ? Something fearful ? [He]156-gregory saw only the purple curtain with the shadows that fell from it . Softly [he]156-gregory whispered , asking what [she]3136-she saw there .

And [she]3136-she said : " [I]3136-she see the vision of a poor weak life , striving after good . It was not cut short , and in the end it learnt , through tears and much pain , that holiness is an infinite compassion for [others]4156-others ; that greatness is to take the common things of life and walk grandly[3136-she]

among [them]3146-them ; that happiness is a great love and much serving . It was not cut short ; and it loved what [it]3147-it had learnt it loved ! "[3136-she]

Was that all [she]3136-she saw in [the corner]3148-the corner ? [Gregory]156-gregory told [the landlady]2978-the landlady the next morning that [she]3136-she had been wandering all night . Nevertheless , when [he]156-gregory came in to give [her]3136-she [her]3136-she breakfast , [she]3136-she was sitting up against the pillows , looking as [he]156-gregory had not seen [her]3136-she look before . " Put it close to [me]3136-she , "[3136-she] [she]3136-she said , " and when [I]3136-she have had breakfast [I]3136-she am going to dress . "[3136-she] [She]3136-she finished all [he]156-gregory had brought [her]3136-she eagerly . " [I]3136-she am sitting up quite by [myself]3136-she , "[3136-she] [she]3136-she said . " Give [me]3136-she [his]156-gregory meat ; "[3136-she] and [she]3136-she fed the dog [herself]3136-she , cutting [his]156-gregory food small for [him]156-gregory . [She]3136-she moved to the side of the bed .

" Now bring the chair near and dress [me]3136-she . It is being in [this room]3873-this room so long , and looking at that miserable little bit of sunshine that comes in through the shutter that is making [me]3136-she so ill .[3136-she]

Always that lion 's paw ! " [she]3136-she said , with a look of disgust at it . "[3136-she] Come , dress [me]0-i . " [Gregory]156-gregory knelt on the floor before [her]3136-she , and tried to draw on one stocking , but the little swollen foot refused to be covered .[3136-she]

" It is very funny that [I]3136-she should have grown so fat since [I]3136-she have been so ill , "[3136-she] [she]3136-she said , peering down curiously . " Perhaps it is want of exercise ? How nice it looks ! "[3151-you]

" No , "[3151-you] [she]3136-she said , seeing the soft gown [he]156-gregory had prepared for [her]3136-she , " [I]3152-she will not put that on . Get one of [my]3152-she white dresses the one with the pink[3152-she]

bows . [I]0-i do not even want to think [I]0-i have been ill . It is thinking and thinking of things that makes them real , " [she]3136-she said . "[3152-she] When [you]3151-you draw [your]3151-you mind together , and resolve that a thing shall not be , it gives way before [you]3151-you ; it is not . Everything is possible if one is resolved , " [she]3136-she said . [She]3136-she drew in [her]3136-she little lips together , and [Gregory]156-gregory obeyed [her]3136-she ; [she]3136-she was so small and slight now it was like dressing a small doll . [He]156-gregory would have lifted [her]3136-she down from the bed when [he]156-gregory had finished , but [she]3152-she pushed [him]156-gregory from [her]3136-she , laughing very softly . It was the first time [she]3152-she had laughed in those long , dreary months .[3152-she]

" No , no ; [I]3152-she can get down [myself]3152-she , "[3152-she] [she]3152-she said , slipping cautiously on to the floor . " [You]3153-you see !
