[He]3153-you raised it , and stood holding it . [She]3152-she looked into the glass on the opposite wall . [Such a

queenly little figure in its pink and white]3154-such a queenly little figure in its pink and white . [Such a transparent little face , refined by suffering into an almost angel - like beauty]3155-such a transparent little face , refined by suffering into an almost angel - like beauty . The face looked at [her]3152-she , [she]3152-she looked back , laughing softly . [Doss]70-doss , quivering with excitement , ran round [her]3152-she , barking . [She]3152-she took one step toward the door , balancing [herself]3152-she with outstretched hands .

" [I]156-gregory am nearly there , "[156-gregory] [she]3152-she said . Then [she]3152-she groped blindly . " Oh , [I]156-gregory can not see ! [I]156-gregory can not see ! Where am [I]156-gregory ? "[156-gregory] [she]3152-she cried . When [Gregory]156-gregory reached [her]3152-she [she]3152-she had fallen with [her]3152-she face against the sharp foot of [the wardrobe]3156-the wardrobe and cut [her]3152-she forehead . Very tenderly [he]156-gregory raised the little crushed heap of clothes and flesh , and laid it on the bed . [Doss]70-doss climbed up , and sat looking down at it . Very softly [Gregory]156-gregory 's hands disrobed [her]3152-she .

" [You]3152-she will be stronger to - morrow , and then [we]4882-we[156-gregory]

shall try again , " [he]156-gregory said , but [she]3152-she neither looked at [him]156-gregory nor stirred .[3152-she]

When [he]156-gregory had undressed [her]3152-she , and laid [her]3152-she in bed , [Doss]70-doss stretched [himself]70-doss across [her]3152-she feet and lay , whining softly . So [she]3152-she lay all that morning , and all that afternoon . Again and again [Gregory]156-gregory crept close to the bedside and looked at [her]3152-she ; but [she]3152-she did not speak to [him]156-gregory . Was it stupor or was it sleep that shone under those half - closed eyelids . [Gregory]156-gregory could not tell . At last in the evening [he]156-gregory bent over [her]3152-she . " [The oxen]1034-the oxen have come , "[4524-the doctor] [he]156-gregory said ; " [we]4884-we can start to - morrow if [you]3152-she like . Shall [I]4524-the doctor get the waggon ready ? "[4524-the doctor] Twice [he]156-gregory repeated [his]156-gregory question . Then [she]3152-she looked up at [him]156-gregory , and [Gregory]156-gregory saw that all hope had died out of the beautiful eyes . It was not stupor that shone there , it was despair . " Let [us]4884-we go , "[4524-the doctor] [she]3152-she said .

" It makes no difference , "[3152-she] said [the doctor]4524-the doctor ; " staying or going ; it is close now . "[3152-she] So the next day [Gregory]156-gregory carried [her]3152-she out in [his]156-gregory arms to the waggon which stood " inspanned "[3152-she] before the door . As [he]156-gregory laid [her]3152-she down on the " kartel "[156-gregory] [she]3152-she looked far out across [the plain]196-the plain . For the first time [she]3152-she had spoken that day . " [That blue mountain]4885-that blue mountain , "[156-gregory] [she]3152-she said , " far away ; let [us]4886-us stop when [we]4886-us get to [it]4885-that blue mountain , not before . "[540-a woman] [She]3152-she closed [her]3152-she eyes again . [He]156-gregory drew the sails down before and behind , and the waggon rolled away slowly .

Very silently the great waggon rolled along [the grass - covered plain]3159-the grass - covered plain . [The driver on the front box]3160-the driver on the front box did not clap [his]3160-the driver on the front box whip or call to [[his]3160-the driver on the front box oxen]3161-his oxen , and [Gregory]156-gregory sat beside [him]3160-the driver on the front box with folded arms . Behind [them]3162-they , in the closed waggon , [she]3152-she lay with the dog at [her]3152-she feet , very quiet with folded hands . [He]156-gregory , [Gregory]156-gregory , dared not be in [there]317-there . Like [Hagar]109-hagar , when [she]3152-she laid [her]3152-she treasure down in [the wilderness]903-the wilderness ,

[he]156-gregory sat afar off ; " For [Hagar]109-hagar said , Let [me]59-lyndall not see the death of [the child]3411-the child . "[59-lyndall]

Evening came , and yet [the blue mountain]3165-the blue mountain was not reached , and all the next day [they]3162-they rode on slowly , but still it was far off . Only at evening [they]3162-they reached [it]3165-the blue mountain ; not blue now , but low and brown , covered with long waving grasses and rough stones . [They]3162-they drew the waggon up close to its foot for the night . It was [a sheltered , warm spot]3166-a sheltered , warm spot .

When the dark night had come , when [the tired oxen]3167-the tired oxen were tied to the wheels , and [the driver]3168-the driver and [leader]3169-leader had rolled [themselves]3167-the tired oxen in [their]3167-the tired oxen blankets before the fire , and gone to sleep , then [Gregory]156-gregory fastened down the sails of the waggon securely ; fixed a long candle near the head of the bed , and lay down [himself]156-gregory on the floor of the waggon near the back . [He]156-gregory leaned [his]156-gregory head against the " kartel , "[59-lyndall] and listened to the chewing of [the tired oxen]3167-the tired oxen , and to the crackling of the fire ,

till , overpowered by weariness [he]156-gregory fell into a heavy sleep . Then all was very still in the waggon . The dog slept on [[his]156-gregory mistress]1161-his mistress 's feet , and only two mosquitoes , creeping in through a gap in the front sail , buzzed drearily round .

The night was grown very old when from a long , peaceful sleep [Lyndall]59-lyndall awoke . The candle burnt at [her]59-lyndall head , the dog lay on [her]59-lyndall feet ; but [he]156-gregory shivered ; it seemed as though [his]156-gregory resting - place was growing cold . [She]59-lyndall lay with folded hands , looking upwards ; and [she]59-lyndall heard the oxen chewing , and [she]59-lyndall saw the two mosquitoes buzzing drearily round and round , and [her]59-lyndall thoughts , [her]59-lyndall thoughts ran far back into the past .

On [her]59-lyndall mind through those months of anguish a mist had rested ; it was rolled together now , and [the old clear intellect]3172-the old clear intellect awoke from its long torpor . [It]3172-the old clear intellect looked back into the past ; it saw the present ; there was no future now . [The old strong soul]3173-the old strong soul gathered itself

together for the last time ; [it]3173-the old strong soul knew where it stood .

Slowly raising [herself]59-lyndall on [her]59-lyndall elbow , [she]59-lyndall took from the sail a glass that hung pinned there . [Her]59-lyndall fingers were stiff and cold . [She]59-lyndall put the pillow on [her]59-lyndall breast , and stood the glass against it . Then the white face on the pillow looked into the white face in the glass . [They]3174-we had looked at [each other]280-each other often so before . [It]3176-it had been [a child]224-a child 's face once , looking out above [its]3176-it blue pinafore ; it had been [a woman]540-a woman 's face , with a dim shadow in the eyes , and a deep assurance . " [We]3174-we are not afraid , [you]4888-you and [I]3203-the strong man ; [we]3174-we will fight [the world]252-the world and conquer . "[3203-the strong man] Now to - night it had come to this . [The dying eyes on the pillow]3179-the dying eyes on the pillow looked into the dying eyes in the glass ; [they]3179-the dying eyes on the pillow knew that [their]3179-the dying eyes on the pillow hour had come . [She]59-lyndall raised one hand and pressed the stiff fingers against the glass . They were growing very stiff . [She]59-lyndall tried to speak to it , but [she]59-lyndall would never speak again . Only ,

the wonderful yearning light was in the eyes still . The body was dead now , but the soul , clear and unclouded , looked forth .

Then slowly , without a sound , the beautiful eyes closed . The dead face that the glass reflected was a thing of marvellous beauty and tranquillity . The Grey Dawn crept in over it and saw it lying there . Had [she]59-lyndall found what [she]59-lyndall sought for something to worship ? Had [she]59-lyndall ceased from being ? Who shall tell [us]3180-us ? There is a veil of terrible mist over the face of the Hereafter .

CHAPTER XIII . DREAMS .

" TELL [me]3203-the strong man what [a soul]4532-a soul desires , and [I]3203-the strong man will tell [you]4891-you what it is . "[3203-the strong man] So runs the phrase .

" Tell [me]3203-the strong man what [a man]242-a man dreams , and [I]3203-the strong man will tell [you]4891-you what [he]242-a man loves . "[3203-the strong man] That also has its truth . For , ever from the earliest childhood to the latest age , day by day , and step by step , the busy waking life is followed and reflected by the life of dreams waking dreams , sleeping dreams . Weird , misty , and distorted as the inverted image of a mirage , or [a figure seen through the mountain mist]3181-a figure seen through the mountain mist , they are still the reflections of a reality .

On the night when [Gregory]156-gregory told [his]156-gregory story ,

[Waldo]60-waldo sat alone before the fire , [his]60-waldo untasted supper before [him]60-waldo . [He]60-waldo was weary after [his]60-waldo day 's work too weary to eat . [He]60-waldo put the plate down on the floor for [Doss]70-doss , who licked it clean , and then went back to [his]70-doss corner . After a time [the master]4633-the master threw [himself]4633-the master across the foot of the bed without undressing , and fell asleep there . [He]60-waldo slept so long that the candle burnt itself out , and [the room]215-the room was in darkness . But [he]60-waldo dreamed a lovely dream as [he]60-waldo lay there .

In [his]60-waldo dream , to [his]60-waldo right rose [high mountains]3184-high mountains , [their]3184-high mountains tops crowned with snow , [their]3184-high mountains sides clothed with bush and bathed in the sunshine . At [their]3184-high mountains feet was [the sea]3425-the sea , blue and breezy , bluer than [any earthly sea]3186-any earthly sea , like [the sea [he]60-waldo had dreamed of in [his]60-waldo boyhood]3187-the sea he had dreamed of in his boyhood . In [the narrow forest that ran between [the mountains]1764-the mountains and [the sea]3425-the sea]3188-the narrow forest that ran between the mountains and the sea the air was rich that the scent of the honey - creeper that hung from dark green bushes , and through the velvety grass little streams ran purling down into [the

sea]3425-the sea . [He]60-waldo sat on a high square rock among the bushes , and [Lyndall]59-lyndall sat by [him]60-waldo and sang to [him]60-waldo . [She]59-lyndall was only [a small child , with a blue pinafore , and a grave , grave , little face]3192-a small child , with a blue pinafore , and a grave , grave , little face . [He]60-waldo was looking up at [the mountains]1764-the mountains , then suddenly when [he]60-waldo looked round [she]59-lyndall was gone . [He]60-waldo slipped down from [his]60-waldo rock , and went to look for [her]59-lyndall , but [he]60-waldo found only [her]59-lyndall little footmarks ; [he]60-waldo found them on the bright green grass , and in the moist sand , and there where the little streams ran purling down into [the sea]3425-the sea . In and out , in and out , and among the bushes where the honey - creeper hung , [he]60-waldo went looking for [her]59-lyndall . At last , far off , in the sunshine , [he]60-waldo saw [her]59-lyndall gathering shells upon [the sand]287-the sand . [She]59-lyndall was not [a child]224-a child now , but [a woman]540-a woman , and the sun shone on [her]59-lyndall soft brown hair , and in [her]59-lyndall white dress [she]59-lyndall put the shells [she]59-lyndall gathered . [She]59-lyndall was stooping , but when [she]59-lyndall heard [his]60-waldo step [she]59-lyndall stood up , holding [her]59-lyndall skirt close about [her]59-lyndall , and waited for [his]60-waldo coming . One hand [she]59-lyndall put

in [his]60-waldo , and together [they]3198-they walked on over the glittering sand and pink sea - shells : and [they]3198-they heard the leaves talking , and [they]3198-they heard the waters babbling on [their]3198-they way to [the sea]3425-the sea , and [they]3198-they heard [the sea]3425-the sea singing to itself , singing , singing .

At last [they]3198-they came to a place where was [a long reach of pure white sand]3201-a long reach of pure white sand ; there [she]59-lyndall stood still , and dropped on to the sand one by one the shells that [she]59-lyndall had gathered . Then [she]59-lyndall looked up into [his]60-waldo face with [her]59-lyndall beautiful eyes . [She]59-lyndall said nothing ; but [she]59-lyndall lifted one hand and laid it softly on [his]60-waldo forehead ; the other [she]59-lyndall laid on [his]60-waldo heart . With a cry of suppressed agony [Waldo]60-waldo sprung from the bed , flung open the upper half of the door , and leaned out , breathing heavily . [Great God]56-god ! it might be only a dream , but the pain was very real , as though a knife ran through [his]60-waldo heart , as though [some treacherous murderer]3202-some treacherous murderer crept on [him]60-waldo in the dark ! [The strong man]3203-the strong man drew [his]3203-the strong man breath like [a frightened woman]3204-a frightened woman .

" Only a dream , but the pain was very real , "[3203-the strong man] [he]3203-the strong man muttered , as [he]3203-the strong man pressed [his]3203-the strong man right hand upon [his]3203-the strong man breast . Then [he]3203-the strong man folded [his]3203-the strong man arms on the door , and stood looking out into the starlight .

The dream was with [him]3203-the strong man still ; [the woman who was [[his]3203-the strong man friend]949-his friend]3205-the woman who was his friend was not separated from [him]3203-the strong man by years only that very night [he]3203-the strong man had seen [her]3205-the woman who was his friend . [He]3203-the strong man looked up into the night sky that all [his]3203-the strong man life long had mingled itself with [his]3203-the strong man existence . There were a thousand faces that [he]3203-the strong man loved looking down at [him]3203-the strong man , a thousand stars in [their]3207-they glory , in crowns , and circles , and solitary grandeur . To [the man]372-the man [they]3207-they were not less dear than to [the boy]234-the boy [they]3207-they had been not less mysterious ; yet [he]3203-the strong man looked up at [them]3207-they and shuddered ; at last turned away from [them]3207-they with horror . Such countless multitudes stretching out far into space , and yet not in one of them all was [she]3205-the woman who was his friend ! Though [he]3203-the strong man searched through them all , to the farthest ,

faintest point of light , nowhere should [he]3203-the strong man ever say , " [She]3205-the woman who was his friend is here ! "[3203-the strong man] To - morrow 's sun would rise and gild [[the world]252-the world 's mountains]3211-the world 's mountains , and shine into [[its]3211-the world 's mountains thousand valleys]3212-its thousand valleys ; it would set and the stars creep out again . Year after year , century after century , the old changes of nature would go on , day and night , summer and winter , seed - time and harvest ; but in none of them all would [she]3205-the woman who was his friend have part !

[He]3203-the strong man shut the door to keep out [their]3207-they hideous shining , and because the dark was intolerable lit a

csndle candle

, and paced [the little room]521-the little room , faster and faster yet . [He]3203-the strong man saw before [him]3203-the strong man the long ages of eternity that would roll on , on , on , and never bring [her]3205-the woman who was his friend . [She]3205-the woman who was his friend would exist no more . A dark mist filled [the little room]521-the little room .

" Oh , little hand ! oh , little voice ! oh , little form ! "[56-god] [he]3203-the strong man cried ; " oh , little soul that walked with [mine]3203-the strong man ! oh , little soul , that looked so fearlessly down into the depths , do [you]3205-the woman who was his friend exist no more for[3203-the strong man]

ever for all time ? " [He]3203-the strong man cried more bitterly : "[3218-the christian] It is for this hour this that [men blind reason]3215-men blind reason , and crush out thought ! For this hour this , this [they]3207-they barter truth and knowledge , take any lie , any creed , so it does not whisper to [them]3207-they of the dead that [they]3207-they are dead ! Ah , [God]56-god ! [God]56-god ! [God]56-god ! for a Here - after ! "[3221-his]

Pain made [his]3203-the strong man soul weak ; it cried for the old faith . They are the tears that fall into the new - made grave that cement the power of [the priest]3216-the priest . For the cry of [the soul that loves and loses]3217-the soul that loves and loses is this , only this : " Bridge over Death ; blend the Here with the Here - after ; cause [the mortal]4893-the mortal to robe [himself]4893-the mortal in immortality ; let [me]60-waldo not say of [[my]60-waldo Dead]4894-my dead that it is dead ! [I]60-waldo will believe all else , bear all else , endure all else ! "[60-waldo] Muttering to [himself]3203-the strong man , [Waldo]60-waldo walked with bent head , the mist in [his]3203-the strong man eyes .

To the soul 's wild cry for its own there are many answers . [He]3203-the strong man began to think of them .

Was not there one of them all from which [he]3203-the strong man might suck one drop of comfort ?

" [You]3219-you shall see [her]3220-her again , "[3222-the nineteenth century christian] says [the Christian]3218-the christian , the true Bible Christian . Yes ; [you]3219-you shall see [her]3220-her again . " And [I]3222-the nineteenth century christian saw the dead , great and small , stand before [God]56-god . And the books were opened , and [the dead]1569-the dead were judged from those things which were written in the books . [And whosoever was not found written in the book of life]4896-and whosoever was not found written in the book of life was cast into [the lake of fire]4897-the lake of fire , which is the second death . í Yes ; [you]3219-you shall see [her]3220-her again . [She]3220-her died so with [her]3220-her knee unbent , with [her]3220-her hand unraised , with a prayer unuttered , in the pride of [her]3220-her intellect and the strength of [her]3220-her youth . [She]3220-her loved and [she]3220-her was loved ; but [she]3220-her said no prayer to [God]56-god ; [she]3220-her cried for no mercy ; [she]3220-her repented of no sin . Yes ; [you]3219-you shall see [her]3220-her again . "[3222-the nineteenth century christian]

In [his]3221-his bitterness [Waldo]60-waldo laughed low : " Ha , [I]3222-the nineteenth century christian have long ceased to hearken to [your]3222-the nineteenth century christian hellish voice . "[3222-the nineteenth century christian]

But yet another speaks . " [You]3219-you shall see [her]3220-her again , "[60-waldo] said [the nineteenth century Christian]3222-the nineteenth century christian , deep into whose soul modern unbelief and thought have crept , though [he]3222-the nineteenth century christian knows it not . [He]3222-the nineteenth century christian it is who uses [his]3222-the nineteenth century christian Bible as [the pearl - fishers]3223-the pearl - fishers use [their]3223-the pearl - fishers shells , sorting out gems from refuse ; [he]3222-the nineteenth century christian sets [his]3222-the nineteenth century christian pearls after [his]3222-the nineteenth century christian own fashion , and [he]3222-the nineteenth century christian sets them well . " Do not fear , "[56-god] [he]3222-the nineteenth century christian says , " hell and judgment are not . [God]56-god is love . [I]56-god know that beyond this blue sky above [us]4898-us is a love as widespreading over all . [The All - Father]4899-the all - father will show [her]3220-her to [you]3219-you again ; not spirit only the little hands , the little feet [you]3219-you loved , [you]3219-you shall lie down and kiss [them]4900-them if [you]3219-you will . [Christ]61-jesus christ arose , and did eat and drink , so shall [she]3220-her arise . [The dead]1569-the dead , all the dead , raised incorruptible ! [God]56-god is love . [You]3219-you shall see [her]3220-her again . "[56-god]

It is a heavenly song , this of [the nineteenth century Christian]3222-the nineteenth century christian . [A man]242-a man might dry [his]242-a man tears

to listen to it , but for this one thing , [Waldo]60-waldo muttered to [himself]60-waldo confusedly ;

" The thing [I]504-any one loved was [a woman proud and young]4902-a woman proud and young ; it had [a mother]1533-a mother once , who , dying , kissed [[her]1533-a mother little baby]4904-her little baby , and prayed [God]56-god that [she]1533-a mother might see [it]4904-her little baby again . If [it]4904-her little baby had lived [the loved thing]4905-the loved thing would itself have had [a son]4906-a son , who , when [he]4906-a son closed the weary eyes and smoothed the wrinkled forehead of [[his]4906-a son mother]439-his mother , would have prayed [God]56-god to see that old face smile again in the Here - after . To [the son]4908-the son heaven will be no heaven if the sweet worn face is not in one of the choirs ; [he]4906-a son will look for it through the phalanx of [[God]56-god 's glorified angels]4909-god 's glorified angels ; and [the youth]2240-the youth will look for [the maid]222-the maid , and [the mother]3579-the mother for [the baby]4494-the baby . "[504-any one] And whose then shall [she]3226-her be at the resurrection of the dead?í " "[56-god] Ah , [God]56-god ! ah , [God]56-god ! a beautiful dream , " [he]4908-the son cried ; "[3229-the hungry man] but can [any one]504-any one dream it not sleeping ? " [Waldo]60-waldo paced on , moaning in agony and longing . [He]60-waldo heard [the Transcendentalist]187-the transcendentalist 's high answer .[3229-the hungry man]

" What have [you]60-waldo to do with flesh , the gross and miserable garment in which spirit hides itself ? [You]60-waldo shall see [her]3226-her again . But the hand , the foot , the forehead [you]60-waldo loved , [you]60-waldo shall see no more . The loves , the fears , the frailties that are born with the flesh , with the flesh [they]4909-god 's glorified angels shall die . Let [them]4909-god 's glorified angels die ! There is that in [man that can not die a seed]4914-man that can not die a seed , [a germ an embryo , a spiritual essence]4915-a germ an embryo , a spiritual essence . Higher than [she]3226-her was on [earth]653-earth , as the tree is higher than the seed , [the man than the embryo]4917-the man than the embryo , so shall [you]60-waldo behold [her]3226-her ; changed , glorified ! "[3229-the hungry man]

High words , ringing well ; they are the offering of jewels to the hungry , of gold to [the man who dies for bread]3228-the man who dies for bread . Bread is corruptible , gold is incorruptible ; bread is light , gold is heavy ; bread is common , gold is rare ; but [the hungry man]3229-the hungry man will barter all [your]3230-your mines for one morsel of bread . Around [[God]56-god 's throne]3231-god 's throne there may be choirs and [companies of angels]3232-companies of angels , [cherubim

and seraphim]3233-cherubim and seraphim , rising tier above tier , but not for one of [them]3234-them all does [the soul]1379-the soul cry aloud . Only perhaps for [a little human woman full of sin]3236-a little human woman full of sin , that it once loved .

" Change is death , change is death , "[3229-the hungry man] [he]3229-the hungry man cried . " [I]3229-the hungry man want [no angel]4918-no angel , only [she]3226-her ; [no holier]4919-no holier and no better , with all [her]3226-her sins upon [her]3226-her , so give [her]3226-her [me]3229-the hungry man or give [me]3229-the hungry man nothing ! "[3229-the hungry man]

And , truly , does not the heart love its own with the strongest passion for [their]3237-their very frailties ? Heaven might keep [[its]3238-its angels]3239-its angels if [men]3470-men were but left to [men]3470-men .

" Change is death , "[60-waldo] [he]3229-the hungry man cried , " change is death ! Who dares to say the body never dies , because it turns again to grass and flowers ? And yet [they]4920-they dare to say the spirit never dies , because in space some strange unearthly being may have sprung up upon its ruins . Leave [me]60-waldo ! Leave [me]60-waldo ! "[60-waldo] [he]3229-the hungry man cried in frantic bitterness . " Give [me]0-i back what [I]0-i have lost , or give [me]0-i nothing ! "[0-i]

For the soul 's fierce cry for immortality is this this only : Return to [me]0-i after death the thing as it was before . Leave [me]0-i in the Here - after the being that [I]0-i am to - day . Rob [me]0-i of the thoughts , the feelings , the desires that are [my]0-i life , and [you]3242-you have left nothing to take . [Your]3242-you immortality is annihilation , [your]3242-you Here - after is a lie . [Waldo]60-waldo flung open the door , and walked out into the starlight , [his]60-waldo pain - stricken thoughts ever driving [him]60-waldo on as [he]60-waldo paced there .

" There must be a Here - after because [man]329-man longs for it ? "[60-waldo] [he]60-waldo whispered . " Is not all life from the cradle to the grave one long yearning for that which [we]4922-we never touch ? There must be a Here - after because [we]4922-we can not think of any end to life . Can [we]4922-we think of a beginning ? Is it easier to say "[60-waldo] [I]0-i was notí than to say " [I]60-waldo shall not beí ? And yet , where were [we]4922-we ninety years ago ? Dreams , dreams ![60-waldo]

Ah , all dreams and lies ! [No ground]3243-no ground anywhere . "[60-waldo]

[He]60-waldo went back into [the cabin]460-the cabin and walked [there]317-there . Hour after hour passed , and [he]60-waldo was thinking dreaming .

For , mark [you]3242-you , [men]3470-men will dream ; the most that can be asked of [them]3470-men is but that the dream be not in too glaring discord with the thing [they]3470-men know . [He]60-waldo walked with bent head .

" All dies , all dies ! "[60-waldo] [he]60-waldo muttered ; " the roses are red with the matter that once reddened the cheek of [the child]3411-the child ; the flowers bloom the fairest on the last year 's battle - ground ; the work of death 's finger cunningly wreathed over is at the heart of all things , even of [the living]2626-the living . [Death]115-death 's finger is everywhere . The rocks are built up of a life that was . Bodies , thoughts , and loves die : from where springs that whisper to the tiny soul of [man]329-man , "[60-waldo] [You]60-waldo shall not dieí ? Ah , is there no truth of which this dream is shadow ? "[3254-he]

[He]60-waldo fell into perfect silence . And , at last , as [he]60-waldo walked there with [his]60-waldo bent head , [his]60-waldo soul passed down the steps of contemplation into [that vast land where there is always peace]3247-that vast land where there is always peace ; [that land where [the soul]1379-the soul , gazing long , loses all consciousness of [its]1379-the soul little self]3248-that land where the soul , gazing long , loses all consciousness of its little self , and almost feels [its]1379-the soul hand on the old mystery of Universal Unity that surrounds it . " No death , no death , "[53-tant ' sannie] [he]60-waldo muttered ; " there is that which never dies which abides . It is but [the individual that perishes , the whole remains]4926-the individual that perishes , the whole remains . It is [the organism that vanishes]4927-the organism that vanishes , the atoms are there . It is but [the man that dies]4928-the man that dies , the Universal Whole of which [he]4928-the man that dies is part reworks [him]4928-the man that dies into its inmost self . Ah , what matter [that man]3552-that man 's day be short ! that the sunrise sees [him]4928-the man that dies , and the sunset sees [[his]4928-the man that dies grave]4930-his grave ; that of which [he]4928-the man that dies is but the breath has breathed [him]4928-the man that dies forth and drawn [him]4928-the man that dies back again . That abides [we]4931-we abide . "[53-tant ' sannie]

For [the little soul that cries aloud for

con- continued

tinued personal existence for itself and [its beloved]3251-its beloved]3250-the little soul that cries aloud for con- continued tinued personal existence for itself and its beloved , there is no help . For [the soul which knows itself no more as a unit , but as a part of the Universal Unity of which [the Beloved]167-beloved sister also is a part]3252-the soul which knows itself no more as a unit , but as a part of the universal unity of which the beloved also is a part ; which feels within [itself]1379-the soul [the throb of the Universal Life]3253-the throb of the universal life ; for that soul there is no death .

" Let [us]4931-we die , [beloved]4932-beloved , [you]4932-beloved and [I]53-tant ' sannie , that [we]4931-we may pass on forever through [the Universal Life]49-the universal life ! "[53-tant ' sannie] In that deep world of contemplation all fierce desires die out , and peace comes down . [He]3254-he , [Waldo]60-waldo , as [he]3254-he walked there , saw no more [the world that was about [him]3254-he]3255-the world that was about him ; cried out no more for the thing that [he]3254-he had lost . [His]3254-he soul rested . Was it only [John]104-john , think [you]3256-you , who saw the heavens open ? [The dreamers]3257-the dreamers see it every day .

Long years before [the father]782-the father had walked [there]317-there , and seen [quires of angels]3260-quires of angels , and [a prince of peace]3261-a prince of peace like unto [men]3470-men , but clothed in immortality . [The son]4908-the son 's knowledge was not as [the father]782-the father 's ,

therefore the dream was new - tinted , but the sweetness was all there , the infinite peace , that [men]3470-men find not in [the little cankered kingdom of the tangible]3266-the little cankered kingdom of the tangible . The bars of the real are set close about [us]3267-we ; [we]3267-we can not open [our]3267-we wings but they are struck against them , and drop bleeding . But , when [we]3267-we glide between the bars into [the great unknown beyond]3268-the great unknown beyond , [we]3267-we may sail forever in the glorious blue , seeing nothing but [our]3267-we own shadows .

So age succeeds age , and dream succeeds dream , and of the joy of [the dreamer]1559-the dreamer [no man]339-no man knoweth but [he]1559-the dreamer who dreameth . [[Our]3267-we fathers]1565-our fathers had [their]1565-our fathers dream ; [we]3267-we have [ours]3267-we ; [the generation that follows]3272-the generation that follows will have its own . Without dreams and phantoms [man]329-man can not exist .

CHAPTER XIV . WALDO GOES OUT TO SIT IN [THE SUNSHINE]50-the sunshine .

IT had been a princely day . The long morning had melted slowly into a rich afternoon . Rains had covered [the karroo]1510-the karroo with a heavy coat of green that hid [the red earth everywhere]3275-the red earth everywhere . In the very chinks of the stone walls dark green leaves hung out , and beauty and growth had crept even into the beds of the sandy furrows , and lined them with weeds . On the broken sod walls of [the old pigsty chick - weeds]3276-the old pigsty chick - weeds flourished , and ice - plants lifted their transparent leaves . [Waldo]60-waldo was at work in [the waggon - house]229-the waggon - house again . [He]60-waldo was making [a kitchen]3278-a kitchen - table for [Em]54-em . As the long curls gathered in heaps before [his]60-waldo plane , [he]60-waldo

paused for an instant now and again to throw one down to [a small naked nigger , who had crept from [its mother who stood churning in the sunshine , and had crawled into [the waggon - house]229-the waggon - house]3280-its mother who stood churning in the sunshine , and had crawled into the waggon - house]3279-a small naked nigger , who had crept from its mother who stood churning in the sunshine , and had crawled into the waggon - house . From time to time [the little animal]3282-the little animal lifted [its]3282-the little animal fat hand as it expected a fresh shower of curls ; till [Doss]70-doss , jealous of [[his]70-doss master]361-his master 's noticing [any other small creature but [himself]70-doss]3284-any other small creature but himself , would catch the curl in [his]70-doss mouth and roll the little Kaffir over in the saw - dust , much to that small animal 's contentment . It was too lazy an afternoon to be really ill - natured , so [Doss]70-doss satisfied [himself]70-doss with snapping at [the little nigger]3285-the little nigger 's fingers , and sitting on [him]70-doss till [he]70-doss laughed . [Waldo]60-waldo , as [he]60-waldo worked , glanced down at [them]3286-them now and then , and smiled ; but [he]60-waldo never looked out across [the plain]196-the plain . [He]60-waldo was conscious without looking of [that broad green earth]3288-that broad green earth ; it made [his]60-waldo work pleasant to [him]60-waldo . Near the shadow at the gable [the mother of [the little nigger]3285-the little nigger]3289-the mother of the little nigger stood churning . Slowly [she]3289-the mother of the little nigger raised

and let fall the stick in [her]3289-the mother of the little nigger hands , murmuring to [herself]3289-the mother of the little nigger a sleepy chant such as [[her]3289-the mother of the little nigger people]3291-her people love ; it sounded like the humming of far - off bees .

A different life showed itself in the front of [the house]206-the house , where [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie 's cart stood ready inspanned , and [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman [herself]214-the boer - woman sat in [the front room]1096-the front room drinking coffee . [She]214-the boer - woman had come to visit [[her]214-the boer - woman step - daughter]3295-her step - daughter , probably for the last time , as [she]3295-her step - daughter now weighed two hundred and sixty pounds , and was not easily able to move . On a chair sat [[her]214-the boer - woman mild young husband]3296-her mild young husband nursing [the baby]4494-the baby [a pudding - faced , weak - eyed child]3298-a pudding - faced , weak - eyed child . " [You]726-the young man take it and get into [the cart]2314-the cart with it , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie . " What do [you]726-the young man want here , listening to [[our]4934-our woman]4935-our woman 's talk ? "[4091-my child] [The young man]726-the young man arose , and meekly went out with [the baby]4494-the baby .

" [I]54-em 'm very glad [you]726-the young man are going to be married , [[my]54-em child]4091-my child , "[54-em] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , as [she]53-tant ' sannie drained the last drop from [her]53-tant ' sannie coffee cup . " [I]53-tant ' sannie would n't say[53-tant ' sannie]

so while [that boy]860-that boy was [here]3430-here , it would make [him]860-that boy too conceited ; but marriage is the finest thing in [the world]252-the world . [I]0-i 've been at it three times , and if it pleased [God]56-god to take [this husband]3304-this husband from [me]0-i [I]0-i should have another . There 's nothing like it , [[my]0-i child]4091-my child ; nothing . "[4091-my child]

" Perhaps it might not suit [all people]4595-all people , at all times , as well as it suits [you]4091-my child , [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Em]54-em . There was a little shade of weariness in the voice .

" Not suit [every one]3534-every one ! "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie . " If [the beloved Redeemer]4939-the beloved redeemer did n't mean [men]3470-men to have [wives]2172-wives what did [He]4939-the beloved redeemer make [women]1671-women for ? That 's what [I]53-tant ' sannie say . If [a woman]540-a woman 's old enough to marry and does n't [she]540-a woman 's sinning against [the Lord]3492-the lord it 's a wanting to know better than [Him]4939-the beloved redeemer . What , does [she]540-a woman think [the Lord]3492-the lord took all that trouble in making [her]540-a woman for nothing ? It 's evident [He]4939-the beloved redeemer wants [babies]4297-babies , otherwise why does [He]4939-the beloved redeemer send [them]4297-babies ? Not that [I]53-tant ' sannie 've done much in that way [myself]53-tant ' sannie , "[53-tant ' sannie] said

[Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , sorrowfully ; " but [I]53-tant ' sannie 've done [my]53-tant ' sannie best . "[53-tant ' sannie]

[She]53-tant ' sannie rose with some difficulty from [her]53-tant ' sannie chair , and began moving slowly toward the door .

" It 's a strange thing , "[242-a man] [she]53-tant ' sannie said , " but [you]4947-you ca n't love [a man]242-a man till [you]4947-you 've had [a baby]892-a baby by [him]242-a man . Now there 's [that boy]860-that boy there , when [we]4951-we were first married if [he]860-that boy only sneezed in the night [I]53-tant ' sannie boxed [his]860-that boy ears ; now if [he]860-that boy lets [his]860-that boy pipe - ash come on [my]53-tant ' sannie milk - cloths [I]53-tant ' sannie do n't think of laying a finger on [him]860-that boy . There 's nothing like being married , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , as [she]53-tant ' sannie puffed toward the door . " If [a woman]540-a woman 's got [a baby]892-a baby and [a husband]4954-a husband [she]540-a woman 's got the best things [the Lord]3492-the lord can give [her]540-a woman ; if only [the baby]4494-the baby does n't have convulsions . As for [a husband]4954-a husband , it 's very much the same who [one]324-one has . [Some men]1735-some men are fat , and [some men]1735-some men are thin ; [some men]1735-some men drink brandy , and [some men]1735-some men drink gin ; but it all comes to the[53-tant ' sannie]

same thing in the end ; it 's all one . [A man]242-a man 's [a man]242-a man , [you]3308-you know . "[53-tant ' sannie]

Here [they]3309-they came upon [Gregory]156-gregory , who was sitting in the shade before [the house]206-the house . [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie shook hands with [him]156-gregory . " [I]53-tant ' sannie 'm glad [you]156-gregory 're going to get married , "[53-tant ' sannie] [she]53-tant ' sannie said . " [I]156-gregory hope [you]156-gregory 'll have as many [children]3428-children in five years as a cow has calves , and more too . [I]156-gregory think [I]156-gregory 'll just go and have a look at [your]156-gregory soap - pot before [I]156-gregory start , "[156-gregory] [she]53-tant ' sannie said , turning to [Em]54-em . " Not that [I]53-tant ' sannie believe in this new plan of putting soda in the pot . If [the dear Father]4964-the dear father had meant soda to be put into soap what would [He]4964-the dear father have made milk - bushes for , and stuck them all over the "[53-tant ' sannie] veldí as thick as lambs in the lambing season ? "[53-tant ' sannie]

[She]53-tant ' sannie waddled off after [Em]54-em in the direction of [the built - in soap - pot]3311-the built - in soap - pot , leaving [Gregory]156-gregory as [they]3312-they found [him]156-gregory , with [his]156-gregory dead pipe lying on the bench beside [him]156-gregory , and [his]156-gregory blue eyes gazing out far

across [the flat]616-the flat , like one who sits on [the sea - shore]3314-the sea - shore watching that which is fading , fading from [him]156-gregory . Against [his]156-gregory breast was a letter found in the desk addressed to [himself]156-gregory , but never posted . It held only four words : " [You]156-gregory must marry [Em]54-em . "[56-god] [He]156-gregory wore it in a black bag round [his]156-gregory neck . It was the only letter [she]53-tant ' sannie had ever written to [him]156-gregory .

" [You]54-em see if the sheep do n't have the scab this year ! "[3492-the lord] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie as [she]53-tant ' sannie waddled after [Em]54-em . " It 's with all these new inventions that the wrath of [God]56-god must fall on [us]4965-us . What were [the children of [Israel]188-israel]4966-the children of israel punished for , if it was n't for making a golden calf ? [I]214-the boer - woman may have [my]214-the boer - woman sins , but [I]214-the boer - woman do remember the tenth commandment . "[214-the boer - woman] Honour [[thy]3315-thy father]3316-thy father and [mother]4231-mother that it may be well with [thee]3315-thy , and that [thou]3315-thy mayest live long in [the land which [the Lord [thy]3315-thy God]3319-the lord thy god giveth thee!í]3318-the land which the lord thy god giveth thee!í It 's all very well to say [we]3320-we honour [them]3321-them , and then to be finding out things

that [they]3321-them never knew , and doing things in a way that [they]3321-them never did them ! [[My]0-i mother]3493-my mother boiled soap with bushes , and [I]0-i will boil soap with bushes . If the wrath of [God]56-god is to fall upon [this land]3323-this land , " said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , with the serenity of conscious virtue , "[53-tant ' sannie] it shall not be through [me]0-i . Let [them]3321-them make [their]3321-them steam - waggons and [their]3321-them fire - carriages ; let [them]3321-them go on as though [the dear Lord]3742-the dear lord did n't know what [He]3742-the dear lord was about when [He]3742-the dear lord gave horses and oxen legs , the destruction of [the Lord]3492-the lord will follow [them]3321-them . [I]0-i do n't know how [such people]3992-such people read [their]3992-such people Bibles . When do [we]3327-we hear of [Moses]92-moses or [Noah]189-noah riding in [a railway]3328-a railway ? [The Lord]3492-the lord sent [fire - carriages]3330-fire - carriages out of [heaven]3422-heaven in those days : there 's no chance of [His]3492-the lord sending [them]3330-fire - carriages for [us]3327-we if [we]3327-we go on in this way , " said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie sorrowfully , thinking of the splendid chance which [this generation]1902-this generation had lost .[53-tant ' sannie]

Arrived at the soap - pot [she]3332-she looked over into it thoughtfully .

" Depend upon it [you]54-em 'll get the itch , or some other disease ; the blessing of [the Lord'll]190-the lord'll never rest upon it , "[53-tant ' sannie] said [the Boer - woman]214-the boer - woman . Then suddenly [she]214-the boer - woman broke forth . " And [she]214-the boer - woman eighty - two , and goats , and rams , and eight thousand morgan , and the rams real angora , and two thousand sheep , and a shorthorn bull , "[3336-the rich englishman] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , standing upright and planting a hand on each hip . [Em]54-em looked at [her]53-tant ' sannie in silent wonder . Had connubial bliss and the joys of motherhood really turned [the old Boer - woman]3334-the old boer - woman 's head ?

" Yes , "[0-i] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie ; " [I]53-tant ' sannie had almost forgotten to tell [you]54-em . By [the Lord]3492-the lord if [I]53-tant ' sannie had [him]3335-him here ! [We]4969-we were walking to [church]1502-church last Sacrament Sunday , [Piet]86-piet and [I.]0-i Close in front of [us]4969-we with [old Tant ' Trana]128-trana , with dropsy and cancer , and ca n't live eight months . Walking by [her]53-tant ' sannie was something with [its]128-trana hands under its coat - tails , flap , flap , flap ; and its chin in the air ,[53-tant ' sannie]

and a stick - up collar , and the black hat on the very back of the head . [I]0-i knew [him]3335-him ! " Who 's that?í [I]53-tant ' sannie asked . "[53-tant ' sannie] [The rich Englishman]3336-the rich englishman that [Tant ' Trana]128-trana married last week.í " Rich Englishman ! [I]0-i 'll [rich Englishman]4971-rich englishman [him]3335-him , í [I]0-i said ; "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll tell [Tant ' Trana]128-trana a thing or two.í [My]0-i fingers were just in [his]3335-him little white curls . If it had n't been [the blessed Sacrament]3337-the blessed sacrament , [he]3335-him would n't have walked so " sourka , sourka , courka , í any more . But [I]3338-i thought , wait till [I]3338-i 've had it , and then . But [he]3335-him , sly fox , [son of Satan]4972-son of satan , [seed of [the Amalekite]4974-the amalekite]4973-seed of the amalekite , [he]3335-him saw [me]3338-i looking at [him]3335-him in [the church]656-the church . [The blessed Sacrament]3337-the blessed sacrament was n't half over when [he]3335-him takes Tant ' [Trana]128-trana by the arm , and out [they]4977-them go . [I]3338-i clap [[my]3338-i baby]4978-my baby down to [[its]4978-my baby father]4814-its father , and [I]3338-i go after [them]4977-them . But , "[3338-i] said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , regretfully , " [I]3338-i could n't get up to [them]4977-them ; [I]3338-i am too fat . When [I]3338-i got to the corner [he]4814-its father was pulling Tant ' Trana up into [the cart]2314-the cart . "[3338-i] [Tant ' Trana]128-trana , í [I]0-i said , " [you]128-trana 've married [a Kaffir]3514-a kaffir 's dog ,[3933-lord]

a Hottentot 's brakje.í [I]0-i had n't any more breath . [He]3338-i winked at [me]0-i ; [he]3338-i winked at [me]0-i , " said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , [her]53-tant ' sannie sides shaking with indignation , "[54-em] first with one eye , and then with the other , and then drove away . [Child of the Amalekite]3339-child of the amalekite ! " said [Tant ' Sannie]53-tant ' sannie , "[54-em] if it had n't been [the blessed Sacrament]3337-the blessed sacrament . Lord , Lord , [Lord]3933-lord ! "[60-waldo]

Here [the little Bush - girl]3342-the little bush - girl came running to say that the horses would stand no longer , and still breathing out vengeance against [her]3342-the little bush - girl old adversary [she]3342-the little bush - girl laboured toward [the cart]2314-the cart . Shaking hands and affectionately kissing [Em]54-em , [she]3342-the little bush - girl was with some difficulty drawn up . Then slowly [the cart]2314-the cart rolled away , [the good Boer - woman]3345-the good boer - woman putting [her]3345-the good boer - woman head out between the sails to smile and nod . [Em]54-em stood watching it for a time , then as the sun dazzled [her]54-em eyes [she]54-em turned away . There was no use in going to sit with [Gregory]156-gregory : [he]156-gregory liked best sitting there alone , staring across [the the green karroo]3346-the the green karroo ; and till [the maid]222-the maid had done churning

there was nothing to do ; so [Em]54-em walked away to [the waggon - house]229-the waggon - house , and climbed on to the end of [Waldo]60-waldo 's table , and sat there , swinging one little foot slowly to and fro , while the wooden curls from the plane heaped themselves up against [her]54-em black print dress .

" [Waldo]60-waldo , "[60-waldo] [she]54-em said at last , " [Gregory]156-gregory has given [me]54-em the money [he]156-gregory got for the waggon and oxen , and [I]54-em have fifty pounds besides that once belonged to [some one]3445-some one . [I]54-em know what [they]4983-them would have liked to have done with it . [You]60-waldo must take it and go to some place and study for a year or two . "[54-em] " No , [little one]4352-little one , [I]54-em will not take it , "[54-em] [he]60-waldo said , as [he]60-waldo planed slowly away ; " the time was when [I]54-em would have been very grateful to [any one who would have given [me]54-em a little money , a little help , a little power of gaining knowledge]4985-any one who would have given me a little money , a little help , a little power of gaining knowledge . But now , [I]54-em have gone so far alone [I]54-em may go on to the end . [I]54-em do n't want it , [little one]4352-little one . "[54-em]

[She]54-em did not seem pained at [his]60-waldo refusal , but swung [her]54-em foot to and fro , the little old wrinkled forehead more wrinkled up than ever .

" Why is it always so , [Waldo]60-waldo , always so ? "[0-i] [she]54-em said ; " [we]4987-we long for things , and long for them , and pray for [them]4983-them ; [we]4987-we would give all [we]4987-we have to come near to them , but [we]4987-we never reach [them]4983-them . Then at last , too late , just when [we]4987-we do n't want [them]4983-them any more , when all the sweetness is taken out of [them]4983-them , then [they]4983-them come . [We]4987-we do n't want them then , "[60-waldo] [she]54-em said , folding [their]3349-their hands resignedly on [her]54-em little apron . After a while [she]54-em added : " [I]54-em remember once , very long ago , when [I]54-em was [a very little girl]4988-a very little girl , [[my]54-em mother]3493-my mother had a work - box full of coloured reels . [I]54-em always wanted to play with them , but [she]3493-my mother would never let [me]54-em . At last one day [she]3493-my mother said [I]54-em might take the box . [I]54-em was so glad [I]54-em hardly knew what to do . [I]54-em ran round [the house]206-the house , and sat down with it on the back steps .[54-em]

But when [I]0-i opened the box all the cottons were taken out . "[54-em]

[She]54-em sat for a while longer , till [the Kaffir maid]1271-the kaffir maid had finished churning , and was carrying the butter toward [the house]206-the house . Then [Em]54-em prepared to slip off the table , but first [she]54-em laid [her]54-em little hand on [Waldo]60-waldo 's . [He]60-waldo stopped [his]60-waldo planing and looked up . " [Gregory]156-gregory is going to [the town]612-the town to - morrow . [He]156-gregory is going to give in [our]4992-our bans to [the minister]3957-the minister ; [we]4992-our are going to be married in three weeks . "[3358-three white kids] [Waldo]60-waldo lifted [her]54-em very gently from the table . [He]60-waldo did not congratulate [her]54-em ; perhaps [he]60-waldo thought of the empty box , but [he]60-waldo kissed [her]54-em forehead gravely .

[She]54-em walked away toward [the house]206-the house , but stopped when [she]54-em got half - way . " [I]191-the old hebrew god will bring [you]60-waldo a glass of buttermilk when it is cool , "[191-the old hebrew god] [she]54-em called out ; and soon [her]54-em clear voice came ringing out through the back windows as [she]54-em

sang the " Blue Waterí to [herself]54-em , and washed the butter .[144-nature]

[Waldo]60-waldo did not wait till [she]54-em returned . Perhaps [he]60-waldo had at last really grown weary of work ; perhaps [he]60-waldo felt [the waggon - house]229-the waggon - house chilly for [he]60-waldo had shuddered two or

hree three

times , though this was hardly likely in that warm summer weather ; or , perhaps , and most probably , one of [his]60-waldo old dreaming fits had come upon [him]60-waldo suddenly . [He]60-waldo put [his]60-waldo tools together , ready for to - morrow , and walked slowly out . At the side of [the waggon - house]229-the waggon - house there was a world of bright sunshine , and a hen with [her]54-em chickens was scratching among the gravel . [Waldo]60-waldo seated [himself]60-waldo near [them]3355-them with [his]60-waldo back against the red - brick wall . The long afternoon was half spent , and the kopje was just beginning to cast its shadow over the round - headed yellow flowers that grew between [it]3356-it and [the farm - house]211-the farm - house . Among the flowers the white butterflies hovered and on the old " kraal "[54-em]

mounds [three white kids]3358-three white kids gamboled , and at the door of [one of [the huts]1999-the huts]3359-one of the huts [an old grey - headed Kaffir - woman]3361-an old grey - headed kaffir - woman sat on the ground mending [her]3361-an old grey - headed kaffir - woman mats . A balmy , restful peacefulness seemed to reign everywhere . Even [the old hen]3362-the old hen seemed well - satisfied . [She]3362-the old hen scratched among the stones and called to [her]3362-the old hen chickens when [she]3362-the old hen found a treasure ; and all the while tucked to [herself]3362-the old hen with intense inward satisfaction . [Waldo]60-waldo , as [he]60-waldo sat with [his]60-waldo knees drawn up to [his]60-waldo chin and [his]60-waldo arms folded on them , looked at it all and smiled . [An evil world]3363-an evil world , [a deceitful , treacherous , mirage - like world]3364-a deceitful , treacherous , mirage - like world , it might be ; but [a lovely world for all that]3365-a lovely world for all that , and to sit there gloating in the sunlight was perfect . It was worth having been [a little child]3461-a little child , and having cried and prayed so [one]324-one might sit there . [He]60-waldo moved [his]60-waldo hands as though [he]60-waldo were washing them in the sunshine . There will always be something worth living for while there are shimmery afternoons . [Waldo]60-waldo chuckled with intense

inward satisfaction as [the old hen]3362-the old hen had done [she]3362-the old hen , over the insects and the warmth ; [he]60-waldo , over the old brick - walls , and the haze , and the little bushes . Beauty is [God]56-god 's wine , with which [He]60-waldo recompenses [the souls that love [Him]60-waldo]3369-the souls that love him ;

[he]60-waldo [He]60-waldo

makes [them]3369-the souls that love him drunk .

[The fellow]400-the fellow looked , and at last stretched out one hand to a little ice - plant that grew on the sod wall of [the sty]1181-the sty ; not as though [he]60-waldo would have picked it , but as it were in a friendly greeting . [He]60-waldo loved it . One little leaf of the ice - plant stood upright , and the sun shone through it . [He]60-waldo could see every little crystal cell like a drop of ice in the transparent green , and it thrilled [him]60-waldo . There are only rare times when [a man]242-a man 's soul can see [Nature]144-nature . So long as any passion holds its revel there , the eyes are holden that [they]3373-they should not see [her]144-nature .

Go out if [you]3374-you will , and walk alone on [the

hill - side]2429-the hill - side in the evening , but if [[your]3374-you favourite child]3376-your favourite child lies ill at [home]302-home , or [[your]3374-you lover]3378-your lover comes to - morrow , or at [your]3374-you heart there lies a scheme for the holding of wealth , then [you]3374-you will return as [you]3374-you went out ; [you]3374-you will have seen nothing . For [Nature]144-nature , ever , like [the old Hebrew God]191-the old hebrew god , cries out , " [Thou]4994-thou shalt have [no other gods before [me]54-em]4995-no other gods before me . "[54-em] Only then , when there comes a pause , a blank in [your]3374-you life , when the old idol is broken , when the old hope is dead , when the old desire is crushed , then the Divine compensation of Nature is made manifest . [She]144-nature shows [herself]144-nature to [you]3374-you . So near [she]144-nature draws [you]3374-you , that the blood seems to flow from [her]144-nature to [you]3374-you , through a still uncut cord : [you]3374-you feel the throb of [her]144-nature life .

When that day comes , that [you]3374-you sit down broken , without one human creature to whom [you]3374-you cling , with [your]3374-you loves [the dead and the living - dead]3379-the dead and the living - dead ; when the very thirst for knowledge through

long - continued thwarting has grown dull ; when in the present there is no craving , and in the future no hope , then , oh , with a beneficent tenderness , [Nature]144-nature enfolds [you]3374-you .

Then the large white snow - flakes as they flutter down , softly , one by one , whisper soothingly , " Rest , [poor heart]4996-poor heart , rest ! "[54-em] It is as though [[our]3380-our mother]1793-our mother smoothed [our]3380-our hair , and [we]3380-our are comforted . And yellow - legged bees as they hum make a dreamy lyric ; and the light on the brown stone wall is a great work of art ; and the light through the leaves makes the pulses beat .

Well to die then ; for , if [you]3374-you live , so surely as the years come , so surely as the spring succeeds the winter , so surely will passions arise . [They]3382-they will creep back , one by one , into the bosom that has cast [them]3382-they forth , and fasten there again , and peace will go . Desire ,

ambi- ambition

tion , and the fierce agonizing flood of love for [the living]2626-the living [they]3382-they will spring again . Then [Nature]144-nature will draw down [her]144-nature veil ; with all [your]3374-you longing [you]3374-you shall not be able to raise one corner ; [you]3374-you can not bring back those peaceful days . Well to die then !

Sitting there with [his]3384-his arms folded on [his]3384-his knees , and [his]3384-his hat slouched down over [his]3384-his face , [Waldo]60-waldo looked out into the yellow sunshine that tinted even the very air with the colour of ripe corn , and was happy .

[He]60-waldo was [an uncouth creature with small learning , and no prospect in the future but that of making endless tables and stone - walls]3385-an uncouth creature with small learning , and no prospect in the future but that of making endless tables and stone - walls , yet it seemed to [him]60-waldo as [he]60-waldo sat there that life was a rare and very rich thing . [He]60-waldo rubbed [his]60-waldo hands in the sunshine . Ah , to live on so , year after year , how well ! Always in the present ; letting each day glide , bringing its

own labour , and its own beauty ; the gradual lighting up of [the hills]299-the hills , night and the stars , fire - light and the coals ! To live on so , calmly , far from the paths of [men]3470-men ; and to look at the lives of clouds and insects ; to look deep into the heart of flowers , and see how lovingly the pistil and the stamens nestle there together ; and to see in the thorn - pods how the little seeds suck [their]3388-their life through the delicate curled - up string , and how [the little embryo]3389-the little embryo sleeps inside ! Well , how well , to sit so on one side taking no part in [the world]252-the world 's life ; but when [great men]3391-great men blossom into books looking into those flowers also , to see how the world of [men]3470-men too opens beautifully , leaf after leaf . Ah ! life is delicious ; well to live long , and see the darkness breaking , and the day coming ! The day when soul shall not thrust back soul that would come to it ; when [men]3470-men shall not be driven to seek solitude because of the crying out of [their]3470-men

hearts for love and sympathy . Well to live long and see the new time breaking . Well to live long ; life is sweet , sweet , sweet ! In [his]3384-his breast pocket , where of old the broken slate used to be , there was now a little dancing - shoe of [[his]3384-his friend]949-his friend who was sleeping . [He]3384-his could feel it when [he]3384-his folded [his]3384-his arm tight against [his]3384-his breast ; and that was well also . [He]3384-his drew [his]3384-his hat lower over [his]3384-his eyes and sat so motionless that [the chickens]3395-the chickens thought [he]3384-his was asleep , and gathered closer around [him]3384-his . [One]324-one even ventured to peck at [his]3384-his boot ; but [he]3384-his ran away quickly . Tiny , yellow fellow that [he]3384-his was , [he]3384-his knew that [men]3470-men were dangerous ; even sleeping [they]3470-men might awake . But [Waldo]60-waldo did not sleep , and coming back from [his]60-waldo sunshiny dream , stretched out [his]60-waldo hand for the tiny thing to mount . But the chicken eyed the hand askance , and then ran off to hide under

[[its]3398-its mother]3399-its mother 's wing , and from beneath [it]3398-its [it]3398-its sometimes put out [its]3398-its round head to peep at [the great figure sitting there]3400-the great figure sitting there . Presently [its brothers]3401-its brothers ran off after a little white moth , and it ran out to join [them]3401-its brothers ; and when the moth fluttered away over [their]3401-its brothers heads [they]3401-its brothers stood looking up disappointed , and then ran back to [[their]3401-its brothers mother]1186-their mother .

[Waldo]60-waldo through [his]60-waldo half - closed eyes looked at [them]3401-its brothers . Thinking , fearing , craving , those tiny sparks of brother life , what were they , so real there in [that old yard]3403-that old yard on that sunshiny afternoon ? A few years where would [they]3401-its brothers be ? Strange little brother spirits ! [He]60-waldo stretched [his]60-waldo hand toward [them]3401-its brothers , for [his]60-waldo heart went out to [them]3401-its brothers ; but not one of [the little creatures]3404-the little creatures came nearer [him]60-waldo , and [he]60-waldo watched [them]3401-its brothers gravely for a time ; then [he]60-waldo smiled , and began muttering to [himself]60-waldo after [his]60-waldo old fashion . Afterward [he]60-waldo folded [his]60-waldo arms upon [his]60-waldo knees , and rested [his]60-waldo

forehead on them . And so [he]60-waldo sat there in the yellow sunshine , muttering , muttering , muttering , to [himself]60-waldo .

It was not very long after when [Em]54-em came out at the back - door with a towel thrown across [her]54-em head , and in [her]54-em hand a cup of milk . " Ah , "[54-em] [she]54-em said , coming close to [him]60-waldo , " [he]60-waldo is sleeping now . [He]60-waldo will find it when [he]60-waldo wakes , and be glad of it . "[None-None] [She]54-em put it down upon the ground beside [him]60-waldo . [The mother - hen]3405-the mother - hen was at work still among the stones , but the chickens had climbed about [him]60-waldo and were perching on [him]60-waldo . [One]324-one stood upon [his]60-waldo shoulder , and rubbed its little head softly against [his]60-waldo black curls : another tried to balance itself on the very edge of the old felt hat . [One tiny fellow]3407-one tiny fellow stood upon [his]60-waldo hand , and tried to crow ; another had nestled itself down comfortably on the old coat - sleeve , and gone to sleep there .

[Em]54-em did not drive [them]3408-them away ; but [she]54-em covered the glass softly at [his]60-waldo side . " [He]60-waldo will wake soon , "[None-None] [she]54-em said , " and be glad of it . "[None-None] But the chickens were wiser .

THE END .
